Plants can “read” anonymous stories from others, creating a safe, identity-free emotional ecosystem.

PlantBuddy blends nature, AI, IoT, and decentralized tech to reduce loneliness, build empathy, and enable a decentralized emotional data economy.

Walron is a privacy-first Web3 Patreon platform on Sui blockchain, fully aligned with the DATA SECURITY & PRIVACY track. Features include Seal SDK Identity-Based Encryption (IBE) with threshold cryptography, Walrus decentralized verifiable storage, on-chain subscription NFTs for trustless access control, zero platform fees with 100% creator revenue, and SuiNS portable identity. All content is encrypted before upload, stored on Walrus distributed network, and only verified subscribers can decrypt using on-chain

proof. Privacy is guaranteed by cryptography, not platform trust.

StartupSeal – Web3 Startup Trust Engine

Problem We Are Solving

The Web3 startup ecosystem is facing a major trust crisis. More than $3.8B was lost to fraudulent crypto projects in 2024–25. Around 68% of investors have encountered fake or copied startup pitches. There is no standard method to verify startup authenticity before fundraising. GitHub repositories, team credentials, and traction data can be easily faked. Traditional verification methods are slow, manual, costly, and centralized.This results in genuine startups losing funding opportunities while scammers drain investor capital.


Our Solution

StartupSeal provides automated, blockchain-verified trust scoring using AI and Web3 technologies.

AI-Powered Five-Category Analysis

1. Media Authenticity – detects AI-generated or manipulated content

2. Tech Credibility – verifies real GitHub commit history and activity

3. Governance Transparency – checks team structure and legitimacy

4. On-chain Behavior – analyzes blockchain activity

5. Social Signals – validates community engagement

Immutable Verification Records

-> StartupSeal issues NFTs on the Sui blockchain.

-> Uploaded documents are stored using Walrus decentralized storage.

-> Nautilus confidential computing generates cryptographic proofs.

Real-Time Trust Scores (0–100)
Includes full scoring breakdown, GitHub verification, hackathon participation validation, and document authenticity checks using Google Vision AI.

Instant Verification Flow
Startup details and GitHub repo are submitted, analyzed in under two minutes, and a blockchain-verified StartupSeal is issued with a public proof link.


Workflow

1. Startup registration with Sui wallet connection

2. GitHub OAuth authentication and repository analysis

3. AI Trust Oracle scoring across five categories

4. Document upload and verification through Google Vision AI

5. Blockchain submission, NFT minting, and on-chain storage

6. Public verification page with score breakdown and proofs


Future Insights

Short-term (3–6 months):
Multi-chain support, platform integrations (AngelList, ProductHunt, Y Combinator), improved AI fraud detection, and mobile app support.

Mid-term (6–12 months):
DAO-based governance, reputation staking, investor badges, and automated compliance support.

Long-term (12+ months):
AI pitch-deck generator, predictive startup success scoring, a marketplace for verified startup NFTs, and a global verification standard for VCs.


Revenue Model

  • Freemium model with basic verification for free and premium analytics as paid features.

  • Enterprise white-label solutions for VCs and accelerators.

  • Licensing anonymized fraud-pattern data.

  • Verification-as-a-Service API for platforms.

Bullz answers the single biggest question in Web3: "What to buy?"

We solve this by blending the mechanics of prediction markets with the viral loop of fantasy football. Users build a "Squad" of 7 assets and lock capital to back their predictions. This mechanism filters out the noise of bots, farmers, and paid shillers, generating a Provably Authentic sentiment layer backed by real "skin in the game."

projectName: Knowledge Center: The Free Knowledge Library for Sharing School Projects and Any File
description:
School Library - Walrus Evidence System

School Library is a decentralized application (dApp) designed to permanently preserve student projects and academic resources using the Walrus Network. It functions as a "Free Knowledge Library," ensuring that educational achievements are stored immutably on the blockchain.

The user interface immerses students in a nostalgic "Virtual Classroom" crafted entirely with CSS Art, avoiding external images for a lightweight, responsive experience. Upon logging in with a generation and alias, users interact with symbolic desk items:

  • The Scroll: A drag-and-drop interface for uploading files to the Walrus Testnet.

  • The Owl: Represents wisdom, offering insights into the project's mission.

  • The Notebook & Magnifying Glass: Tools for verifying uploads and exploring stored data via blockchain explorers like SuiScan.

Built as a Single Page Application (SPA) using HTML5, CSS3, and Vanilla JavaScript, the system connects directly to the Walrus HTTP Publisher. It generates unique Blob IDs for every upload, serving as cryptographic proof of existence. By blending a charming, retro educational aesthetic with cutting-edge decentralized storage technology, School Library provides a unique, permanent home for the legacy of future generations.

The Problem: The Broken Ad Economy The current advertising model is broken. Advertisers burn capital on "impressions" that are often bots, resulting in a 100% loss of principal. Users—the producers of attention data—receive zero compensation for their time and privacy. The market is inefficient, opaque, and extractive.

The Solution: AdLotto AdLotto is a Zero-Loss Data Marketplace where the commodity is User Attention. We replace the traditional "pay-per-view" model with a "stake-for-attention" model.

  1. Marketplace for Advertisers (Buyers): Instead of spending money, advertisers stake SUI. The yield generated by this liquidity becomes the "budget" to pay for attention. Their principal remains safe and can be unstaked at any time.

  2. Marketplace for Viewers (Sellers): Users "sell" their attention to the protocol. By performing a client-side decryption of an ad (using Seal), they generate a cryptographic Proof of Attention.

  3. Settlement: The protocol routes the staking yield directly to the users who provided verified proofs.

Technical Architecture (The "Trust Engine")

  • Storage (Walrus): High-resolution ad creatives are stored as decentralized blobs on Walrus, ensuring data availability without blockchain bloat.

  • Privacy & Verification (Seal): We use Seal's Identity-Based Encryption to seal ads. The content remains "Dark Data" until a user initiates a transaction to view it. The act of decryption generates a signature, serving as irrefutable on-chain proof that the data was consumed.

  • Execution (Sui Move + Keeper): Automation bots use Verifiable Randomness (VRF) to select high-stake ads for the "Hero" spot, ensuring a fair, tamper-proof market.

Why This Fits "Data Economy/Marketplaces" We are not just building a dApp; we are defining a new asset class: Tokenized Attention. AdLotto creates a circular economy where data producers (viewers) and data consumers (advertisers) exchange value directly, transparently, and without intermediaries, powered entirely by the intrinsic yield of the Sui network.

SuiAuth: Stop the "My Wallet Got Hacked" Nightmare

Chapter 1 : The Problem: Another Day, Another Hack
You're scrolling Twitter, coffee in hand, and see yet another post: “My wallet got hacked, lost everything.”
It's become so common it barely registers anymore.

Even Vitalik Buterin’s X account gets compromised in a phishing attack that steals $700,000.
https://www.theblock.co/post/250047/vitalik-buterins-x-account-hacked-to-carry-out-phishing-attack-that-stole-700000-in-crypto-nfts

Another victim.
https://x.com/CryptoGWB/status/1976036859001106788

The numbers are staggering: nearly 500 MetaMask users are hacked every single day, as wallet attacks explode.

A single SUI wallet victim loses $29 million.
https://www.bitgetapp.com/amp/news/detail/12560604533418


And these are just the incidents that make headlines — countless smaller losses happen every hour, quietly devastating people's financial futures.

The worst part? There’s no undo button, no customer support to call, no way to recover the funds.

The current wallet security model is fundamentally broken:
Private keys are a single point of failure — 12 or 24 random words standing between you and financial ruin, where one mistake means permanent loss.


Chapter 2: The Solution - Enter SuiAuth


Sui has already put lot of efforts in getting the best security infra with zkLogin and social authentication. But the problem still exists . Let's see how suiAuth works ?
SuiAuth eliminates private keys entirely. Instead of managing cryptographic secrets, users authenticate with their phone—the same way they log into their bank, email, or any secure app. Scan a QR code with Google Authenticator, and you're done. No seed phrases, no private keys, no memorizing random words. When you want to send funds, you enter a six-digit code from your authenticator app. That's it.

But here's the crucial difference: unlike custodial wallets where a company holds your keys (and can freeze your account or get hacked themselves), SuiAuth is completely decentralized. Your secrets are verified by secure hardware, stored encrypted across a distributed network, and executed on-chain. No single point of failure, no company to trust, no central server to hack. It's the security model Web3 deserves—hardware-backed protection with zero trust assumptions.


Chapter 3: The Architecture - How We Built It
When you set up SuiAuth, we generate a TOTP secret—the same technology Google Authenticator uses for millions of accounts daily. This secret produces a new six-digit code every 30 seconds. But instead of storing this secret on some server (hackable) or your device (lose your phone, lose everything), we use a clever three-layer system:

First, we build a Merkle tree—a cryptographic structure that lets us prove a password is valid without ever revealing the password itself. Imagine a tree where each leaf is a hash of a possible OTP code, and branches combine these hashes up to a single root. Given a specific OTP and a "proof path" through the tree, we can verify it matches the root without seeing any other codes. We create these trees in 64-minute periods, each containing 128 windows of 30 seconds. This means at any moment, your current OTP has a unique position in the tree that can be mathematically proven without exposing the underlying secret.

Second, these encrypted Merkle trees live on Walrus—a decentralized storage network. Not on a company's server, not on your device, but distributed across a peer-to-peer network. Even if one storage node goes down, your data remains accessible. Even if someone intercepts the encrypted data, it's useless without your TOTP secret (which only exists in your authenticator app).

Third, when you authenticate, Nautilus TEE verifies your OTP. A TEE (Trusted Execution Environment) is a secure enclave built into modern processors—think of it as a locked vault inside your computer's CPU. Not even your operating system can see what's happening inside. The TEE fetches your Merkle tree from Walrus, verifies your six-digit code against it, and generates a cryptographic attestation—a proof that verification happened correctly in secure hardware.

Finally, our Move smart contract on Sui blockchain checks this TEE attestation using SEAL (Sui's attestation verification framework) and executes your transaction. The entire flow—from entering your code to transaction confirmation—takes under a second.

Chapter 4: The Experience - See It In Action

Demo : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sEdkoqkcuRQ

The beauty is in the integration: TOTP gives us time-based authentication everyone understands, Merkle trees enable efficient cryptographic proofs, Walrus provides decentralized storage, Nautilus TEE adds hardware-backed security, and Sui's SEAL framework ties it all together with on-chain attestation verification. Each piece solves a specific problem, and together they create a wallet that's simultaneously more secure, more decentralized, and more user-friendly than anything currently available.


Chapter 5: EndGame
SuiAuth removes these failure modes entirely. Your authenticator app is protected by your phone's biometrics, your Merkle trees are encrypted on a distributed network, your verification happens in secure hardware, and your transactions execute on an Sui.

If you have made to this far, We really appreciate your time and Hope you like SuiAuth.
Thank You so much.

One Eye is a verifiable AI oracle that accepts confidential parameters to make a decision upon that data without revealing the sensitive information to the public.

Built with Seal x Nautilus, this demo is a Nautilus Enclave that took the News API Key as the seal params, then inside the enclave, the server will call the news api to get the data, then feed it into the GPT-4o-mini, configured for deterministic output, analyzes this verified data to generate precise SHORT or LONG trading signals.

This will open the new case for the future, whether you are the investor who wants to feed any private strategy into the model, or a prediction market that wants to resolve on private KYC data, etc.

CurePocket: Global Health Passport on Sui

CurePocket is a privacy-first personal health passport that allows users to securely carry and share their medical data (medications, lab results, X-rays) anywhere in the world. Powered by Sui, Walrus, and Seal, it ensures you own your health data completely.

💡 Key Highlights

👩‍⚕️ Designed by a Pharmacist

Built by a team including a practicing pharmacist, CurePocket addresses real-world clinical pain points—like forgotten medication history or lost lab results—ensuring the system is medically practical and user-friendly.

📱 Mobile-First Design

Designed for the "pocket," our UI is 100% mobile-first.

  • Intuitive Card UI: View complex medical records easily on a smartphone.

  • AI-Powered Scan: Instantly digitize paper prescriptions and lab results using your camera and AI OCR.

  • QR Code Sharing: Instantly share encrypted data with doctors via QR code in emergencies or while traveling abroad.

  • Simple Onboarding: Start using immediately with just a wallet connection.

🔒 Privacy & Tech

  • Sui (SBT): Non-transferable Medical Passport to manage identity and data references.

  • Walrus: Decentralized, encrypted storage for large medical files (images/PDFs).

  • Seal: Granular access control ensuring only the patient holds the decryption keys.

OtterProof is the missing trust layer for decentralized AI and data marketplaces. In an ecosystem where data is abundant but quality is often unverified, OtterProof establishes a new standard for integrity.

Powered by our custom Tusk SDK, the protocol allows data providers to rigorously validate their datasets—ensuring schema compliance, completeness, and privacy—before storage. Once validated, data is securely anchored on Walrus, while the verification results are immortalized as on-chain attestations on Sui. This process creates a transparent, immutable "Quality Certificate" for every dataset, unlocking a future of trusted decentralized data exchange.

Overview

SourceNet is the first frictionless data marketplace that lets users monetize their personal data without the crypto headaches. By leveraging Sui ZKLogin and Sponsored Transactions, we’ve eliminated the need for wallets, seed phrases, and gas fees. Users simply log in with Google and sell their encrypted data as Sui Objects. Powered by Walrus Protocol and DeepSeek AI, SourceNet finally makes data sovereignty accessible to the masses.

The Problem: The "Data Serfdom" Crisis

We are living in a broken data economy.

  1. Users generate the value, Big Tech keeps the profit: You create terabytes of digital footprint every year, but Silicon Valley giants monetize it for billions while you earn $0.

  2. Data is Trapped in Silos: Your digital life is fragmented across platforms (Google, Meta, Amazon), making it impossible to aggregate and sell your own "digital identity" as a single asset.

  3. Web3 is Unusable for Normies: Existing decentralized data marketplaces exist, but they are plagued by the "Web3 UX Nightmare"—requiring MetaMask installs, seed phrase management, and purchasing crypto for gas fees before a user can even upload their first file.


What we Solve

SourceNet is the "Invisible Web3" data marketplace that democratizes data ownership by making it as easy as sending an email.

  • Frictionless Onboarding: We replaced wallets with Sui ZKLogin. Users sign in with Google, and a non-custodial wallet is created instantly in the background. No extensions, no seed phrases.

  • Gasless Experience: Through Sponsored Transactions, we pay the gas. Sellers can upload, mint, and list their data without ever owning a single SUI token.

  • Sovereign & Private: Data isn't just "uploaded"; it is minted as a dynamic Sui Object (DataPod) and stored on Walrus Protocol. It is fully encrypted, meaning users retain absolute ownership and can revoke access or resell at will.

  • Instant Monetization: By integrating DeepSeek AI for data valuation and metadata tagging, we help users price their data correctly and connect them with buyers instantly.


How It Works

The "Zero-Trust" Architecture, SourceNet bridges the gap between Web2 usability and Web3 security through a 4-stage secure pipeline, ensuring data remains encrypted and users never touch a private key.

1. Seller Upload & Minting (The "Frictionless" Ingestion)

We prioritize onboarding ease without sacrificing security.

  • Auth: Users authenticate via Sui ZKLogin (Google OAuth), eliminating seed phrases.

  • Security: Data undergoes SHA-256 hash computation for integrity and AES-256-GCM encryption. The encryption key is securely persisted in the upload staging metadata.

  • Storage & Minting: Instead of centralized servers like S3, encrypted files are uploaded directly to Walrus Protocol for decentralized storage. The system then mints a Sui Object (DataPod) and lists it on the Kiosk with a published status.

2. Buyer Purchase (Gasless Acquisition)

Buying data is as easy as a standard e-commerce checkout.

  • Key Exchange: Upon browsing, the buyer’s client generates an X25519 keypair locally.

  • Transaction: We utilize a Sponsored Transaction model. The backend builds the tx via POST /api/buyer/purchase, allowing the buyer to purchase without holding SUI tokens for gas.

  • Queueing: Once signed, a fulfillment job is immediately queued via BullMQ.

3. Automated Fulfillment (The "Re-Encryption" Engine)

Our backend handles the secure transfer of ownership asynchronously:

  • Retrieval: The BullMQ job fetches the encrypted file from Walrus and decrypts it using the seller’s temporary key.

  • Hybrid Re-Encryption: The system instantly re-encrypts the data using the Buyer’s Public Key (combining X25519 + AES-256-GCM).

  • Finalization: The new, buyer-specific blob is uploaded to Walrus (with high replication and retention), the purchase status is updated to completed, and the escrow payment is released to the seller.

4. Sovereign Access

The final step ensures only the buyer can see the data.

  • Download: The buyer requests the file using the new blob ID.

  • Local Decryption: The encrypted blob is downloaded and decrypted locally in the browser (X25519 → Ephemeral Key → AES-256-GCM), ensuring end-to-end privacy.

The Problem

Most task platforms stop at “work done, money paid,” so the real execution knowledge (how tasks were solved, under which constraints and with what quality) is lost in private silos. Organizations, teams, and AI builders have no efficient way to discover, verify, and reuse this experience data, while freelancers cannot monetize their expertise beyond one-off payments.

The Solution

TaskOS is a decentralized task and experience marketplace where every completed task is turned into a structured, provable “experience data” asset. These assets are securely stored, access-controlled, and can be bought, sold, or inherited, creating a new data economy around real-world execution knowledge.

Core Innovation

Instead of treating tasks as ephemeral transactions, TaskOS treats completed work as an on-chain, ownable data product with clear provenance, quality signals, and programmable access via encryption policies. By combining task workflows with decentralized storage and fine-grained access control, TaskOS makes it possible for individuals, teams, and AI consumers to trade and reuse high-quality experience data safely.

How It Works

  1. Users (individuals, teams, businesses, projects) create tasks and optionally escrow rewards, then assign them privately or publish them for freelancers.

  2. When a task is completed and approved, TaskOS captures execution metadata (skills, domain, quality, time, context) and packages it into an “experience data” object.

  3. The raw artifacts are encrypted and stored off-chain, while references and ownership are recorded on-chain as an asset that can be listed in the marketplace.

  4. Buyers purchase access; smart contracts handle payment, and access policies are updated so authorized buyers can retrieve and decrypt the underlying data.

Key Features

  • Decentralized task distribution: private, team-only, and public tasks with reward escrow and approval flows.

  • Experience data assets: completed tasks become standardized, ownable data objects with rich metadata and quality scores.

  • Secure data economy: encrypted storage plus programmable access (private, allowlist, subscription) to protect sensitive content.

  • Experience marketplace: browse, filter, and purchase experience data by skill, domain, quality, and price, with clear licensing options.

  • Composability for AI and analytics: buyers can plug experience datasets into their AI pipelines, internal knowledge bases, or performance benchmarking tools.

DocScout is a next-generation research platform that helps users discover, organize, and transform information efficiently. Using advanced and specialized search techniques, the platform makes it easy to locate PDFs, slides, articles, and other academic resources across the web. Once retrieved, DocScout can summarize, rewrite, or create alternative versions of the content, turning raw data into actionable knowledge ready for study, analysis, or sharing.

Beyond simple discovery, DocScout acts as a comprehensive workspace for research management. Users can store notes, organize findings, link related documents, and generate insights with AI support. This integrated approach transforms scattered information into a coherent workflow, making research faster, more productive, and easier to collaborate on.

At the heart of DocScout is its connection to Walrus, a decentralized storage network on Sui. Walrus ensures that all research files, notes, and outputs are stored securely, tamper-proof, and censorship-resistant. By combining intelligent special search techniques, AI-powered content processing, and decentralized file storage, DocScout offers a robust and reliable environment for students, academics, and knowledge workers seeking an efficient and future-ready research solution.

⭐ WALRUS AGENTS — Decentralized Multi-Agent AI Training Network

WALRUS AGENTS are Tokenized AI agents (ERC-8004) minted as NFTs that coordinate decentralized training of neural networks directly in your browser. Each agent is an on-chain asset with model updates stored on Walrus Protocol and verified through SEAL attestations. Users contribute compute, earn rewards, and trade agents—while Sui smart contracts manage coordination, verification, and incentives. Fully decentralized AI with no centralized servers required.

What our multi-agents do?

  • Our NFT-based agents execute a unified decentralized training pipeline. Each browser activates a role — preprocessing, architecture optimization, gradient computation, validation, or aggregation. Together, they coordinate a fully distributed learning process. This transforms isolated browser sessions into a collaborative AI training network, where intelligence improves through community contributions and every step is cryptographically linked.

What we are training?

  • A compact yet fully functional 41-parameter neural network (3→4→4→1) designed for rapid browser-based updates. It performs real backpropagation using TensorFlow.js, learns from synthetic agent-performance signals, and evolves model versions with each contribution. Every training cycle generates weights, gradients, accuracy/loss metrics, timestamps, and contributor data, producing genuine incremental learning.

What transactions we make on Sui?

Our Move smart contracts provide verifiable identity, coordination, and incentives:

1. Agent Registration (minting)

Calls agent_registry::mint_agent

  • - Mints a tokenized AI Agent NFT

  • - Stores the Walrus metadata blob ID

  • - Initializes model version, contribution count, timestamps

2. Training Contribution Recording

Calls training_rewards::record_contribution

  • - Stores the Walrus gradient blob ID

  • - Creates a TrainingContribution object

  • - Issues the reward (0.001 SUI)

  • - Emits ContributionRecorded for on-chain auditability

Sui provides the trust layer underpinning agent identity, training history, and incentives.

What we store on Walrus?

Walrus holds the actual AI outputs produced by training:

  • - Model weights (41-parameter Float32Array)

  • - Gradient deltas

  • - Accuracy & loss metrics

  • - Model version + contributor address

  • - Architecture + timestamp metadata

These are stored as content-addressed Walrus blobs, making the model’s entire evolution permanent, retrievable, and independently verifiable.

What Seal Certification is for?

Seal Certification is Walrus’s cryptographic guarantee that stored blobs:

  • - were successfully committed

  • - will remain available across the specified epoch window

  • - are redundantly stored across multiple publishers

  • - match the submitted content (integrity verified)

This functions as a verifiable storage proof, ensuring that every training artifact used for on-chain tracking is authentic, durable, and trustless.

In-fight AMM is a new form of prediction market platform that allows users to change their prediction positions in real-time during combat sports matches. It is being developed for the Walrus Haulout Hackathon.

▫️Vision

While traditional prediction markets focus on pre-match predictions, In-fight AMM specializes in live in-match experiences. It provides a completely new prediction market experience where spectators can adjust their positions in real-time based on match developments while watching live streams.

▫️Key Features

[In-fight Specialized Prediction Market]
The platform enables betting from right before match start, with the prediction market beginning from fighter entrance scenes. Users can engage in real-time trading during matches, instantly changing positions while watching match developments. The system features live streaming integration, allowing users to trade seamlessly while watching the broadcast.

[Real-time Data Display]
The platform displays match statistics in real-time during the fight, including control rate, punch count, and other match statistics.


[Ultra-fast Settlement System]
The system provides settlement within 10 minutes after match end through verifiable automatic settlement via Nautilus Trust Oracle. Users can instantly claim and withdraw funds 10 minutes after the match ends, making them ready for the next match by reinvesting funds before the next match begins.

[Price Mechanism via LSMR AMM]
The platform adopts LSMR (Logarithmic Market Scoring Rule) AMM from early Polymarket. Prices automatically adjust in real-time based on user bets, utilizing a high liquidity AMM method instead of Orderbook.

▫️User Flow

  1. User accesses platform 5 minutes before match start

  2. Prediction market opens during fighter entrance

  3. Adjust positions round by round while watching, predicting developments

  4. After match ends, oracle automatically verifies results

  5. Claim within 10 minutes and prepare for the next match

▫️Tech Stack

  • Blockchain: Sui

  • Oracle: Nautilus Trust Oracle

  • AMM: LSMR (Logarithmic Market Scoring Rule)

  • Future: Walrus, SEAL


▫️ Team

We are the Web3 Fighters team.

  • Kyohei ito: Black belt in Aikido and have served as CTO or Head of Japan at multiple Web3 companies. Delivered Web3 projects for Sony, Netflix, and MAZDA.

  • James Xu: Former professional kickboxer and now leads Web3 strategy at one of Japan’s largest fight promotions.

▫️Traction

We are officially partnered with one of Japan’s largest fight promotions.
The first Chinese K-1 champion is also part of our team.
We have strong access to many major fight promotions across Japan.

▫️Achievements

At the Sui × ONE Championship Hackathon, we won second place and ONE’s Favorite Prize.
This opened the door to real collaboration with ONE, and discussions are ongoing.

▫️Roadmap
We validated our business concept at the ONE Hackathon and built a Nautilus-integrated prototype at the Haulout Hackathon.

Next, we are raising funding.
We were introduced to Soma Capital, an early investor in Kalshi.
Meetings are scheduled with Scallop and DSRV to explore yield integration, Japan market entry, and possible investment.

We applied to the JR East Startup Program with a PoC that integrates anonymized SEAL data with prediction markets.

We are launching a Web3 education program with Waseda University.

▫️Future Development

[Pre-fight AMM]

A separate prediction market specialized for pre-match predictions will also be offered (this hackathon focuses on In-fight).

[Walrus Utilization]
The platform will implement decentralized storage for match data and storage of live streaming content.


[SEAL Utilization]
Privacy protection features and user data encryption will be integrated into the system.

## 🚨 Problem Statement

  • The $104B+ creator economy is broken.

  • Creators face exploitative platform fees (15-20%), arbitrary deplatforming, zero content ownership, payment delays, and no subscription transferability.

  • Centralized platforms control creator-fan relationships and take 45% of earnings.

## Solution

Auriya is a decentralized creator economy platform built on Sui, leveraging Walrus for content storage & Seal for Content access control - think like Decentralized Patreon using Walrus + Seal. Creators can monetize exclusive content through tiered NFT subscriptions, with all media stored permanently on Walrus.

## Key Features

For Creators:

- Earn 98% of revenue (~3% gas fees only) vs. 15-45% on traditional platforms

- Censorship-resistant content stored permanently on Walrus (not deletable)

- Own subscriber data on-chain (portable, no lock-in)

- Instant payments to wallet (no delays)

- Flexible tiered pricing ($5/$10/$20/month etc.)

For Subscribers:

- Purchase Subscription NFT for lifetime access per tier

- Transferable subscriptions (gift/resell on NFT marketplaces)

- Cryptographically verified access rights

- Content can't be censored or retroactively removed

### Why 10x Better

| Feature | Traditional | Auriya |

|---------|-------------|--------|

| Fees | 15-45% | ~3% |

| Ownership | Platform owns data | Creator owns everything |

| Censorship | Yes | No |

| Payments | 7-14 day delays | Instant on-chain |

| Portability | Locked in | Fully portable |

## Tech Stack

- Blockchain: Sui (CreatorProfile & SubscriptionNFT as composable objects)

- Storage: Walrus (decentralized blob storage with cryptographic verification)

- Access Control: Seal (encrypted content access)

- Composability: Secondary markets via NFT marketplaces (Clutchy, Hyperspace)

#### vs Patreon

- Fees: Platform takes 20-30% cut → Auriya: ~3% gas fees

- Censorship: Can ban creators/delete content → Auriya: Censorship-resistant

- Ownership: Platform owns relationship → Auriya: Creator owns everything

- Payments: 7-14 day delays → Auriya: Instant on-chain

- Portability: Locked to platform → Auriya: Fully portable

#### vs Substack

- Fees: 10% platform fee → Auriya: 3% gas fees

- Ownership: Platform owns email list → Auriya: Creator owns on-chain data

- Media: Text-focused, limited media → Auriya: Full multimedia support

#### vs Gumroad

- Censorship: Can ban creators → Auriya: Unstoppable

- Fees: 10% + payment processing → Auriya: 3% total

- Subscriptions: Limited subscription features → Auriya: NFT-based, composable

---

projectName: VeritasLog - Compliance Logs Verifiable, Encrypted & On-Chain
description:
VeritasLog: A Story About Trust, Proof, and Privacy (Walrus × Seal × Sui)

When our incident response team looked back over the last year, one truth stung the most: the hardest part of compliance wasn’t collecting evidence it was proving it. Every audit asked the same questions:
“Can you show me the original log?” “How do I know it hasn’t been changed?” “Why do so many people need to see sensitive data just to verify it exists?”

That frustration became VeritasLog.

We set out to build a system where proof doesn’t require blind trust, where private data stays private, and where the audit trail is stronger because it lives on open rails. The result is a simple, powerful pipeline: encrypt and store with Walrus, anchor and gate with Sui, prove integrity with Seal, and search safely style normalization all behind a wallet native, role based UX.

The First Pain: “Show me the original”

In the old world, an admin would export a log to a shared drive; months later, an auditor would download that file and we’d argue over whether it was the same one. Hashes lived in spreadsheets. Links broke. People changed roles. What if instead of passing around files, we passed around proof?

In VeritasLog:

  1. An Admin uploads a log (text or file). The app normalizes the content so that two semantically identical logs always produce the same fingerprint.

  2. That normalized bundle is encrypted with Seal (selective disclosure–ready) and stored as ciphertext on Walrus.

  3. We write a small, privacy preserving record on Sui: the Walrus blob ID, a Seal/commitment (32 byte identity for the bundle), severity code (0/1/2), and timestamp nothing sensitive on-chain.

  4. Later, when anyone opens a log, the app fetches the Walrus blob, re-derives the commitment, and verifies it against the on-chain value before decrypting. The viewer sees content only if they’re authorized, and everyone else sees proof that the log exists and hasn’t changed.

The fight over “original file vs copied file” disappears because the protocol decides, not a person.

The Second Pain: “Too many people can see too much”

Traditional tools over expose by default. Auditors often need evidence of existence and aggregated insight, not full plaintext. We designed around that.

In VeritasLog:

  • Normalization styles gives us predictable, structured metadata (e.g., severity, module, createdAt) that we can index off-chain for blazing fast queries like “HIGH severity last week” or “incidents in module auth service.”

  • The payload stays encrypted in Walrus until an approved user opens it. Auditors can browse by severity/date and request access without seeing sensitive contents. Admins can approve that access on-chain.

This is selective disclosure with guardrails: search everything; see only what you’re allowed to see.

The Third Pain: “Who gave access to whom and when?”

Compliance wants accountability, not just access. We made access control transparent and wallet native.

Role model (on-chain via Sui Move):

  • SUPER_ADMIN (defined at deploy) can add new ADMIN addresses.

  • ADMIN uploads logs and approves access requests from auditors.

  • AUDITOR is the default role for first fime wallet connections: they can browse metadata, request access, or request a role upgrade.

Every promotion and approval is an on-chain transaction. No off-chain user tables, no forgotten admin panels just a clear, immutable trail of who authorized what, when.

The Core Loop (as a judge will experience it)

  1. Connect a Sui wallet. If it’s your first time, you’re an AUDITOR.

  2. Search: “Show HIGH severity” You get a list from the index no plaintext exposed.

  3. Request access to a log. The on-chain registry records the request and notifies Admins.

  4. An ADMIN approves. That approval lands on-chain; your wallet becomes an authorized viewer for that log.

  5. You open the log. The app retrieves the ciphertext from Walrus, verifies the Seal commitment vs Sui, and decrypts. If anything was tampered with, verification fails loudly before any content is shown.

From the auditor’s perspective, it feels like a modern app. Under the hood, it’s a cryptographic handshake between storage, chain, and policy.

Design Choices We’re Proud Of

  • Privacy by construction: We refuse to store plaintext metadata on-chain. Our Move contract only records (Walrus CID, commitment, severity code, timestamp).

  • Verifiable storage: Before we ever decrypt, we recompute the commitment and match it to the on-chain value so “what you see” is provably “what was committed.”

  • Wallet native RBAC: No passwords, no emails, no shadow directories. Roles and approvals are on-chain easier to audit, harder to game.

  • Scales with reality: Walrus is built for content‐addressed blobs; normalization style makes indexing predictable; Sui is a high-throughput ledger; Seal enables selective disclosure and future proofs.

  • Failure aware UX: If a node is flaky (testnet happens!), users still get clear status, retries, and non-blocking reads for metadata searches.

What’s Under the Hood (concise and honest)

  • Contracts (Sui Move)

    • Shared registry with register_log(walrus_cid, commitment<vector<u8>>, created_at, severity_code<u8>)

    • Role checks for add admin, approve access, and a minimal on-chain event for indexing.

  • Seal (SDK, testnet)

    • Encrypts normalized bundles; identity bytes (commitment) derived deterministically.

    • Ready to add policy functions (seal_approve*) in Move for fully verifiable, on-chain decryption workflows.

  • Walrus (testnet)

    • Stores the ciphertext blobs; blob IDs are anchored on Sui; client verifies before decrypt.

  • Frontend

    • Next.js 16 (App Router), shadcn/ui, React Hook Form + Zod, @mysten/dapp-kit for wallet, and clean, role aware screens.

Threat Model & Compliance Mapping (why this is credible)

  • Tampering: Changing even one byte in the Walrus blob breaks the Seal commitment; verification fails before decryption.

  • Over exposure: Only authorized viewers get derived keys; auditors can search without content access.

  • Insider risk: All grant/approve actions are on-chain; admins are accountable to the same ledger auditors trust.

  • Regulator alignment: We can prove “all HIGH severity logs in a period” exist and are unmodified, then selectively disclose just the ones under review.

What This Unlocks Beyond the Demo

  • Granular redactions: Seal supports selective disclosure; we can reveal sections without revealing full payloads.

  • Programmable approvals: Move policies can gate decryption by role, time, quorum, or even prediction market backed attestations.

  • Pluggable search backends: Today we index severity/date; tomorrow we can add entity extraction or anomaly flags still without exposing raw content.

Why This Fits the “Data Security & Privacy” Track

We didn’t just encrypt a file and call it a day. We rebuilt the compliance loop so that:

  • Privacy is the default (ciphertext at rest, selective disclosure at view time),

  • Verifiability is the norm (commitment and pointer on-chain),

  • Operational reality is respected (fast search on safe metadata, wallet native roles, no off-chain glue required to trust decisions).

VeritasLog shows how Walrus, Seal, and Sui can work together to turn compliance from a paper exercise into a cryptographic one practical for teams, persuasive for auditors, and compelling for judges.

Spectra is a decentralized, privacy-preserving content moderation system designed for user-generated content on Web3. While decentralized storage solutions like Walrus and SEAL allow anyone to upload any type of content, platforms currently lack fair, transparent, and verifiable ways to moderate harmful material, detect duplicates, or attribute derivative works.

Spectra solves this by running open-source vision-language models inside a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE). This enables secure, private, and tamper-proof analysis of uploaded content — without relying on centralized AI APIs.

Spectra provides four core capabilities:

  • Harmful content filtering (e.g., detecting smoking or unsafe imagery)

  • Duplicate detection through similarity scoring

  • Provable content attribution using image embeddings (SigLIP)

  • Full privacy for both creators and reviewers, since all analysis happens inside the enclave

To demonstrate these capabilities, we built a meme curation website on Sui. Users can upload memes, report harmful posts, detect duplicates, and prove derivative relationships — all verified on-chain through enclave signatures.

Spectra introduces a foundation for decentralized moderation, transparent attribution, and future on-chain royalty systems for creators. It is one of the first systems to combine decentralized storage, TEEs, and open-source AI models to deliver trustworthy moderation without sacrificing user privacy.

The first crypto-native marketplace focused on Physical AI Data (robotics, drones, sensor data). Our goal is to help creators monetize their datasets easily and connect buyers efficiently with the exact data they're looking for.

Sui2Scrape — x402-Enforced Payments for AI Agents and Automated Systems

Sui2Scrape makes AI agents pay on-chain before accessing encrypted content

The Problem:

AI agents, web scrapers, and automated systems access premium content without payment. Traditional paywalls, IP blocking, and rate limits are ineffective because bots bypass authentication and share tokens. Content creators have no reliable way to enforce payment for automated access.

The Solution:

Sui2Scrape implements the x402 payment protocol, requiring on-chain payment proof before serving encrypted content. Here's how each component works:

Sui Blockchain stores and verifies payments:

  • Registry contract maps domains and resources to encrypted content metadata

  • Paywall contract mints AccessPass objects (on-chain tokens) only after payment

  • Middleware queries Sui RPC to verify AccessPass ownership, remaining uses, and expiry before serving content

Walrus Decentralized Storage hosts encrypted content:

  • Content owners upload encrypted blobs to Walrus publishers, receiving a content ID (CID)

  • The CID is stored in the Sui Registry contract

  • When access is verified, middleware fetches the encrypted blob from Walrus aggregators

Seal Threshold Encryption protects content until payment:

  • Content is encrypted using Seal with a policy ID tied to the resource

  • Seal key servers require on-chain approval via seal_approve() before releasing decryption keys

  • The Registry contract verifies AccessPass validity before approving key release

  • Decryption happens only after payment verification completes

The Flow:

  1. Content owner encrypts with Seal, uploads to Walrus, registers on Sui

  1. AI agent requests protected route → receives HTTP 402 Payment Required

  1. Agent purchases AccessPass on Sui → receives on-chain token

  1. Agent retries with signed headers → middleware verifies pass on Sui

  1. Middleware fetches encrypted blob from Walrus → calls Seal with AccessPass proof

  1. Seal verifies on-chain approval → releases keys → content is decrypted and served

All payments are recorded on-chain, and content remains encrypted until payment is verified. The system enforces payment at the protocol level, making it impossible for automated systems to bypass.

SealProof is a decentralized platform that establishes immutable provenance for digital content using AI-powered detection, blockchain verification, and privacy-preserving storage.

The Problem

In the age of generative AI, proving content authenticity has become nearly impossible. AI can create text, images, and code indistinguishable from human work.

Traditional solutions face critical challenges:

- Centralized verification services require blind trust

- Timestamps can be backdated with no cryptographic proof

- No way to prove WHEN content was analyzed for AI

- Provenance records can be tampered after creation

The result: A content authenticity crisis where creators can't prove originality, and consumers can't verify sources.

The Solution

SealProof provides cryptographic proof of content authenticity through blockchain attestation. By combining AI detection, decentralized storage, and smart contract enforcement, SealProof makes provenance washing cryptographically impossible.

Core Innovation

Unlike traditional systems that only detect tampering after the fact, SealProof actively prevents it through smart contract enforcement. The Move contract rejects duplicate content registration, making timestamp backdating and AI score manipulation impossible.

How It Works

-> Upload Flow

1. AI Detection: Five heuristic algorithms analyze content patterns, linguistic markers, and statistical anomalies, generating a confidence score (0-100) indicating likelihood of AI generation

2. Seal Encryption (Optional): Client-side Identity-Based Encryption with 2-of-2 threshold decryption using real Seal testnet key servers for owner-controlled access

3. Walrus Upload: Content uploaded to decentralized blob storage, receiving a unique Blob ID for censorship-resistant retrieval

4. Blockchain Registration: Move smart contract stores immutable metadata:

- SHA-256 content hash

- AI detection score (stored as Option<u64>)

- Creator wallet address

- Block timestamp

- Encryption status

- Walrus Blob ID reference

Key Insight: The AI score is stored immutably at upload time with cryptographic proof via transaction signature - it cannot be changed later.

-> Verification Flow

1. Query Events: Search ContentRegistered events by Walrus Blob ID

2. Fetch Proof: Retrieve ContentProof object from blockchain

3. Display Results:

- AI detection classification (Human vs AI-generated)

- Content hash verification

- Creator attribution

- Registration timestamp

- Trust score and verification count

4. External Verification: Direct links to Sui Explorer (blockchain record) and Walrus Aggregator (content retrieval)

5. Download Certificate: JSON certificate with complete cryptographic proof for third-party verification

Key Features

-> Active Tamper Prevention

The smart contract includes E_CONTENT_ALREADY_REGISTERED enforcement:

```move

assert!(!table::contains(&registry.content_index, content_hash), E_CONTENT_ALREADY_REGISTERED);

```

This prevents duplicate registration attempts, making it cryptographically impossible to:

- Backdate timestamps

- Re-register content with different AI scores

- Fake provenance records

-> Immutable AI Detection

AI scores stored as Option<u64> in the ContentProof struct:

```move

ai_detection_score: Option<u64>,

is_ai_generated: Option<bool>,

```

Stored on-chain at upload time with transaction signature proof - cannot be modified retroactively.

-> Decentralized Architecture

- Storage: Walrus decentralized blob storage

- Attestation: Sui blockchain with Move smart contracts

- Encryption: Seal IBE with distributed key servers

- No centralized servers - completely trustless verification

-> Independent Verification

Anyone can verify content authenticity using:

- Blockchain queries (ContentRegistered events)

- Sui Explorer (external blockchain verification)

- Walrus Aggregator (content retrieval)

- Downloadable JSON certificates (third-party proof)

-> Trust Metrics

On-chain reputation system:

- Verification count tracking

- Trust score calculation (0-100)

- Temporal provenance timeline

- Creator attribution

Penguin is a fully decentralised messenger application without any centralised server. Penguin allows users to send, receive messages, media, voice recordings, in chat gifts, create groups and many more... Penguin eases onboarding with Enoki and all these is made possible with Walrus, Seal and the Sui Messaging SDK

Songsim Label connects data requesters with labelers in a trustless marketplace. Requesters post tasks with bounties, labelers submit labels, and smart contracts handle consensus and payouts automatically.

agent8004 is an implementation of the ERC-8004 Trustless Agents on EVM chains, a decentralized identity and reputation system for AI agents, and implements the ERC-8004 standard on Sui blockchain with Walrus decentralized storage. AI agents are global, and the standard shouldn't be limited to just EVM chains, as other chains like Solana, Near, Google have already joined the 8004 team to make this standard chain-agnostic.

agent8004 solves the critical trust problem in AI agents by providing verifiable on-chain identities, immutable reputation tracking, and cryptographic validation. Built with three core Sui Move smart contracts (Identity, Reputation, and Validation registries), the system enables agents to register with ERC-8004 compliant metadata including capabilities, endpoints, and supported protocols (A2A, MCP, OASF). All metadata and feedback are stored permanently on Walrus with SHA-256 hash verification, creating tamper-proof records.

The full-stack Next.js application provides a marketplace like interface where users can browse registered agents, view transparent reputation histories, submit verified feedback, and register new agents with simple or advanced modes. This is the first POC ERC-8004 implementation on Sui, establishing a foundation for secure, transparent AI agent ecosystems where users can confidently interact with blockchain-verified agents backed by immutable reputation trails.

The contracts are currently deployed on Sui Testnet with Package ID 0xc286a2dc94e646d74f17ef0b786485f966d360b83608ab637c06bdc1b8c604d6

projectName: Pollar - Decentralized NFT DAO Voting App
description: Pollar is a next-generation NFT DAO voting platform built on the Sui blockchain, designed to revolutionize community governance by bridging the gap between robust decentralized security and seamless user experience. By leveraging zkLogin, Pollar eliminates the traditional barriers of Web3 onboarding, allowing users to securely authenticate and participate in governance using their familiar Google credentials without managing complex seed phrases. The platform ensures the permanence and censorship resistance of all voting data through Walrus decentralized storage, guaranteeing that poll histories and community decisions are immutably preserved. Furthermore, Pollar integrates Mysten Seal to provide state-of-the-art privacy; votes are encrypted client-side, ensuring a fair and unbiased voting process where results are verifiable on-chain yet remain confidential until the poll concludes. This powerful combination of technologies empowers NFT communities and DAOs to conduct transparent, secure, and truly democratic elections with unprecedented ease and trust.

Combined with and powered by Sui, Walrus and Seal, Otter Protocol is the last piece needed for a truly autonomous internet.
Otter is a programmable data exchange layer that connects data providers and consumers through secure, self-discoverable access-control removing the need for provider-defined interfaces.
In simpler terms we make access permission request happen directly on the data level instead of the data provider being the one to explicitly setup a frontend or interface. This way, anyone can programmatically request access to data and decrypt when granted permission without the need to go through a frontend set up by the data provider.

We also introduced the concept of Data streaming (or chunking) which allows consumers pay for a small chunk as preview before commiting fully to paying for the whole data -- this ensures that The Data Consumer is also getting the exact quality of the data they want before fully commiting / paying


WHY DO WE NEED TO MAKE ACCESS PERMISSIBLE WITHOUT A PROVIDER SETUP FRONT?

1. A provider setup point for access causes fragmentation meaning for each data to be fetched you have to fetch the corresponding frontend in order to get the contract that must be called for access

  1. It disrupts autonomy for agents because of the restrictions of the internet and the fact that the current internet takes humans as first class citizens and not bots

“The web we have today was built for people, not AI. It assumes that humans, with browsers and apps, are the main actors, and automation is an afterthought.” — Adeniyi https://x.com/emanabio/status/1988310398488244277?s=46

SUMMARY

Otter is introducing a data exchange layer where humans with browsers and Dapps are not the only audience, any data can be fetched, permissions requested and data accessed without being constrained to a particular frontend.

Now the agent or consumer is able to directly request permissions and access blob data without going through a frontend for decryption details, users can also decide the percentage of data they’re willing to preview first and pay for that alone meaning you don’t have to trust that that’s the appropriate data It is a client agnostic and frontend independent data exchange layer

A privacy-first event platform where Walrus stores event content and Seal controls who can access it.

Public events store metadata openly on Walrus for censorship-resistant access. Private events encrypt content before Walrus storage, with access controlled by Seal's programmable smart contracts.

Users stake SUI tokens for NFT tickets, which are verified against on-chain Move policies. Upon approval, Seal's distributed key servers provide decryption keys using threshold cryptography. Users retrieve encrypted content from Walrus and decrypt it client-side.

Walrus provides immutable decentralized storage. Seal enables programmable encryption where access rules evolve without re-encrypting content. Together: content that lives forever on decentralized infrastructure, accessible only to those satisfying cryptographic policies.

zkLogin integration lets users authenticate via OAuth without managing wallets—Web2 UX with Web3 security.

TL;DR: Walrus stores encrypted events. Seal enforces who decrypts. Smart contracts replace access control servers.

projectName: ZKCredential: Zero-Knowledge Identity and Compliance Oracle
description:
### Executive Summary

**ZKCredential** is a privacy-first identity verification system that enables users to prove their credentials (age, income, KYC status) without revealing any personal data. 

In essence: **Prove what matters. Hide everything else.**

---

## The Problem

### Today's Reality:
- Banks require customers to submit personal data (age, income, identity) to verify creditworthiness
- This data gets stored in centralized databases
- Databases get hacked. Data gets sold. Privacy is violated.
- Users have no choice: either provide everything or get no loan

### The Proof:
- **87% of data breaches** involve personally identifiable information (PII)
- **$4.5 trillion** potential loss from compromised identity data by 2023
- **GDPR fines**: Up to 4% of annual revenue for data violations
- **Users distrust**: 79% concerned about PII being misused

---

## The Solution: ZKCredential

### How It Works (Simple View):

**Step 1: Alice Submits Private Data**
- Alice fills a simple form with her age, income, and KYC status
- This data stays ONLY on her device
- Never uploaded to any server

**Step 2: Device Creates a Mathematical Proof**
- Alice's device creates a "proof" (cryptographic certificate)
- The proof proves: "Alice is 18+, earns Rp 30M+, has passed KYC"
- The proof does NOT reveal: Her exact age, exact income, or identity
- Proof size: only 288 bytes (incredibly small)

**Step 3: Alice Submits Only the Proof**
- Alice sends ONLY the proof to the bank (not her personal data)
- Bank verifies the proof in 11 milliseconds
- Bank knows Alice qualifies - but knows NOTHING about her

**Step 4: Credential is Minted**
- Proof is stored permanently on immutable storage
- Credential created on blockchain
- Alice can reuse this credential forever with any institution

---

Walrus PQC Audit System: Quantum-Safe Data Integrity for Decentralized Storage

A comprehensive audit platform that addresses the critical security gap in decentralized storage systems facing quantum computing threats. This hackathon project delivers production-grade features combining cutting-edge cryptography with practical usability.

🔐 Core Innovations:
• Post-Quantum Signatures: NIST-approved Dilithium3 (FIPS 204 Level 3) generating 1728-byte quantum-resistant signatures with 10+ year security guarantees
• Merkle Tree Verification: Blake2b-256-based challenge-response protocol for efficient storage integrity proofs, compatible with Walrus's erasure coding architecture
• Privacy Layer: Seal identity-based encryption (IBE) with threshold encryption and role-based access control (compliance_officer, auditor, data_owner)
• Blockchain Integration: Sui Move smart contracts for immutable audit records and decentralized access policies

🚀 Technical Highlights:
• Rust-based auditor node performing real Merkle verification on Walrus Testnet (verified blob: eRrTusk8yshFQpkemgDnbg0f4-qDo623V2NpeVG1Zcg)
• Dual-layer integrity: SHA-256 for fast application checks + Blake2b-256 for protocol-level Merkle proofs
• Graceful degradation with Seal API fallback ensuring core functionality remains operational
• Zero hardcoded secrets with full environment variable configuration support
• 5-minute reproducible demo with comprehensive documentation (README.md + DEMO_INSTRUCTIONS.md)

🎯 Real-World Impact:
• Future-proofs decentralized storage against quantum attacks (NIST estimates quantum computers breaking RSA/ECDSA by 2030)
• Enables compliant enterprise adoption with audit trails and access control
• Demonstrates practical PQC integration without sacrificing performance (audit completes in ~2 seconds)

Built for Walrus Haulout Hackathon - Data Security & Privacy Track
Tech Stack: Rust, Move (Sui), TypeScript, liboqs (Dilithium3), Walrus Testnet, Seal IBE
Repository: https://github.com/ARZER-TW/walrus-audit-system

WalTune: Decentralized Music Streaming with Walrus Storage & X402 Micropayments

Executive Summary

WalTune is a revolutionary decentralized music streaming platform that solves the critical problems of artist exploitation and payment delays in the music industry. By leveraging Walrus decentralized storage and the X402 micropayment protocol on the Sui blockchain, WalTune enables instant, transparent, and fair compensation for artists while providing listeners with a seamless streaming experience.

Key Innovation: We are the first music streaming platform to combine Walrus's content-addressed decentralized storage with X402's HTTP-native micropayment protocol, creating a truly decentralized, pay-per-play music ecosystem where artists receive instant payments for every stream.

Problem Statement

The current music streaming industry is fundamentally broken:

  • Artists earn less than ₹0.10 per stream on major platforms

  • Payment delays of 30-90 days prevent artists from accessing their earnings

  • Platforms take 30-45% revenue cuts, leaving artists with minimal compensation

  • No transparency in payment calculations or streaming metrics

  • Centralized storage creates single points of failure and censorship risks

  • No direct relationship between listeners and artists

Our Solution: Walrus + X402 Integration

Walrus: Decentralized Audio Storage

Why Walrus?

  • Content-Addressed Storage: Each audio file gets a unique blob ID based on its content, ensuring immutability and deduplication

  • Decentralized Network: No single point of failure or censorship

  • Permanent Storage: Music files are stored permanently across the Walrus network

  • Cost-Effective: Eliminates expensive centralized storage infrastructure

  • Streaming Support: Direct streaming from Walrus aggregator nodes

Our Implementation:

  • Audio files uploaded by artists are stored on Walrus network

  • Each song receives a unique Walrus blob ID stored on-chain

  • Stream URLs are generated dynamically from Walrus aggregator endpoints

  • The backend validates blob existence before serving streams

  • Zero-downtime streaming with automatic failover

X402: HTTP-Native Micropayments

Why X402?

  • HTTP-Native Protocol: Uses standard HTTP 402 Payment Required status code

  • Seamless UX: One-time authorization enables automatic payments

  • Instant Settlements: Payments processed immediately, not batched

  • Trustless: Cryptographic verification ensures payment authenticity

  • No Middlemen: Direct artist-to-listener payment flow

Our Implementation:

  • Custom X402 middleware intercepts streaming requests

  • Returns HTTP 402 with payment instructions when payment required

  • The frontend handles payment authorization (one-time signature, 24-hour validity)

  • Payment verification via BlockEden X402 facilitator

  • Support for both direct payments and play credits system

  • Automatic retry mechanism with payment headers

    Innovation Highlights

    1. Seamless Payment Flow

    • One-Time Authorization: Users sign once to authorize automatic payments (up to 1 SUI, 24-hour validity)

    • Zero Friction: Subsequent plays happen automatically without wallet prompts

    • Transparent: All payments visible on-chain with transaction hashes

    2. Decentralized Storage Architecture

    • Content Addressing: Each song has a unique Walrus blob ID based on content hash

    • Immutable Storage: Files cannot be modified or deleted

    • Censorship Resistant: No single entity controls content availability

    • Cost Efficient: Eliminates expensive cloud storage costs

    3. Dual Payment System

    • Direct Payments: Traditional X402 flow with on-chain transactions

    • Play Credits: Pre-purchased credits for faster streaming (no transaction per play)

    • Flexible: Users choose their preferred payment method

    4. HTTP-Native Protocol

    • Standard Compliance: Uses HTTP 402 Payment Required status code

    • RESTful Design: Payment instructions in JSON response body

    • Easy Integration: Works with any HTTP client

    • Developer Friendly: Clear API contracts and error handling

      User Experience

      For Artists

      1. Register: Connect wallet and register as artist on-chain

      2. Upload: Upload audio file → stored on Walrus → receive blob ID

      3. Publish: Register song on-chain with blob ID and price

      4. Earn: Receive instant payments for every stream

      For Listeners

      1. Connect Wallet: One-click wallet connection

      2. Authorize: Sign one-time authorization (24-hour validity)

      3. Stream: Click play → automatic payment → instant streaming

      4. Support Artists: 100% of payment goes directly to the artist.

      Security & Trust

      Payment Security

      • Cryptographic Verification

      • Signature Validation

      • Amount Validation

      • Recipient Validation

      Storage Security

      • Content Addressing

      • Decentralized

      • Immutable

      • Verifiable

      Authorization Security

      • Time-Limited

      • Amount-Limited

      • Local Storage

      • Revocable

      Impact & Value Proposition

      For Artists

      • Instant Payments

      • 100% Revenue

      • Transparency

      • Ownership

      • Global Reach

      For Listeners

      • Fair Pricing

      • Direct Support

      • Seamless UX

      • Transparency

      • Censorship Resistant

      For the Ecosystem

      • Decentralization

      • Innovation

      • Scalability

      • Interoperability

      Competitive Advantages

      1. First Mover: First music platform combining Walrus and X402

      2. True Decentralization: Both storage and payments are decentralized

      3. Instant Payments: No 30-90 day delays; payments are immediate

      4. Zero Platform Fees: Artists keep 100% of their earnings

      5. Censorship Resistant: Content stored on decentralized network

      6. Developer Friendly: Open-source, well-documented, extensible

MothrBox Descriptions

🦋 Tagline (One-liner)

MothrBox - Encrypted Decentralized Storage Made Simple

📝 Short Description (1-2 sentences)

MothrBox is a unified CLI tool that automatically encrypts your files and stores them on the Walrus decentralized storage network. With support for AES-256-GCM, ChaCha20-Poly1305, and ECC encryption, MothrBox ensures your data remains private and secure while leveraging blockchain-based storage.

📄 Medium Description (Elevator Pitch)

MothrBox is a powerful command-line encryption and storage system that combines military-grade cryptography with decentralized storage on the Sui blockchain's Walrus protocol. Built with Rust for performance and security, MothrBox automatically encrypts your files before uploading them to a decentralized network, ensuring your data is both secure and censorship-resistant.

The tool supports three industry-standard encryption algorithms (AES-256-GCM, ChaCha20-Poly1305, and ECC-P256), features automatic key derivation using Argon2, and provides a simple, intuitive interface for managing encrypted data. Whether you're securing sensitive documents, backing up important files, or building privacy-focused applications, MothrBox offers enterprise-grade security in a lightweight, easy-to-use package.

📖 Long Description (Full Overview)

What is MothrBox?

MothrBox is an open-source, unified command-line tool that seamlessly combines strong encryption with decentralized storage, providing a secure and censorship-resistant solution for storing sensitive data. Built on the Sui blockchain's Walrus Protocol, MothrBox eliminates the need for centralized cloud storage providers while ensuring your data remains private through client-side encryption.

Core Features

🔐 Military-Grade Encryption

  • AES-256-GCM: Industry-standard authenticated encryption with 256-bit keys

  • ChaCha20-Poly1305: Modern stream cipher optimized for systems without AES hardware acceleration

  • ECC (P-256 ECIES): Elliptic curve cryptography for asymmetric encryption with public/private key pairs

  • Argon2: Memory-hard key derivation function resistant to GPU cracking attacks

🌐 Decentralized Storage

  • Built on Walrus Protocol (Sui blockchain)

  • No single point of failure

  • Censorship-resistant

  • Geographic redundancy

  • Byzantine fault tolerance

⚡ Performance & Efficiency

  • Written in Rust for memory safety and blazing speed

  • Zero-copy operations where possible

  • Minimal memory footprint

  • On-demand execution (no background services)

  • Automatic cleanup of temporary files

🎯 Unified CLI Architecture

  • Single Docker image containing both Rust CLI and Deno runtime

  • No exposed HTTP endpoints

  • Direct process calls (no network overhead)

  • Automatic encryption before upload

  • Automatic decryption after download

🛡️ Security Best Practices

  • Client-side encryption (data encrypted before leaving your machine)

  • Secure random number generation

  • Authentication tags for integrity verification

  • HMAC-SHA256 for message authentication

  • Salt and nonce randomization to prevent pattern analysis

How It Works

  1. Encryption: When you upload a file, MothrBox encrypts it locally using your chosen algorithm and password

  2. Upload: The encrypted file is uploaded to the Walrus decentralized storage network

  3. Blob ID: You receive a unique blob ID to retrieve your file later

  4. Download: Using the blob ID, MothrBox downloads the encrypted file

  5. Decryption: The file is automatically decrypted using your password

  6. Cleanup: Temporary encrypted files are automatically removed

Use Cases

Personal Privacy

  • Secure backup of sensitive documents (medical records, financial documents)

  • Password-protected photo and video storage

  • Private journal and note storage

  • Encrypted file sharing without trusting third parties

Business Applications

  • Secure document distribution

  • Encrypted backups with geographic redundancy

  • Compliance with data protection regulations (GDPR, HIPAA)

  • Confidential file exchange between parties

Developer Tools

  • Encrypted configuration and secrets management

  • Secure artifact storage for CI/CD pipelines

  • Decentralized backup for source code

  • Privacy-focused application backends

Web3 & Blockchain

  • Encrypted metadata for NFTs

  • Private data storage for dApps

  • Secure key backup and recovery

  • Decentralized file hosting for web applications

Technical Specifications

Encryption Algorithms

  • AES-256-GCM (NIST standard, FIPS 140-2 approved)

  • ChaCha20-Poly1305 (RFC 8439, used by TLS 1.3)

  • ECC P-256 with ECIES (NIST P-256 curve)

Key Derivation

  • Argon2id (winner of Password Hashing Competition 2015)

  • 256-bit derived keys

  • Unique salt per operation

Storage Backend

  • Walrus Protocol on Sui blockchain

  • Reed-Solomon erasure coding

  • Byzantine fault tolerance

  • Distributed across multiple storage nodes

Performance Metrics

  • Encryption speed: ~500 MB/s (AES-256-GCM with AES-NI)

  • Upload speed: Limited by network and Walrus nodes

  • Memory usage: ~50 MB during operation

  • Docker image size: ~400 MB (includes Rust runtime + Deno)

Architecture

MothrBox uses a unified Docker architecture where:

  • Rust CLI: Handles all cryptographic operations and user interaction

  • Deno Runtime: Manages communication with Walrus Protocol (internal only)

  • No HTTP Server: Direct process calls eliminate network overhead

  • Automatic Encryption: All uploads are encrypted by default

This design ensures maximum security (no exposed endpoints), optimal performance (no HTTP overhead), and simplicity (single container, one command).

Why MothrBox?

Privacy First Unlike traditional cloud storage (Dropbox, Google Drive, iCloud), MothrBox encrypts your data before it leaves your machine. The storage provider never has access to your encryption keys or plaintext data.

Decentralization Your data is distributed across multiple nodes on a blockchain-based network. No single entity controls your data, and there's no single point of failure.

Open Source All code is open source and auditable. You can verify the encryption implementation yourself or build from source.

No Vendor Lock-in Your data is stored on a public blockchain protocol. You're not dependent on a single company or service staying in business.

Cost Effective Pay only for what you store, with transparent pricing on the Sui blockchain. No monthly subscriptions or hidden fees.

Comparison

Feature MothrBox Dropbox/GDrive AWS S3 IPFS Client-side encryption ✅ ❌ Optional ❌ Decentralized ✅ ❌ ❌ ✅ Automatic encryption ✅ ❌ ❌ ❌ No monthly fees ✅ ❌ ❌ ✅ Censorship resistant ✅ ❌ ❌ ✅ Multiple encryption algos ✅ ❌ ❌ ❌ Open source ✅ ❌ ❌ ✅

Installation & Usage

# Setup
./mothrbox.sh setup

# Upload with automatic encryption
./mothrbox.sh upload secret.pdf MyPassword123

# Download with automatic decryption
./mothrbox.sh download <blob-id> secret.pdf MyPassword123

# Encryption only (no upload)
./mothrbox.sh encrypt-aes file.txt encrypted.bin password

# Generate ECC keys
./mothrbox.sh keygen

Security Considerations

What MothrBox Protects Against ✅ Unauthorized access to stored data ✅ Data breaches at storage provider ✅ Man-in-the-middle attacks ✅ Tampering detection (via authentication tags) ✅ Password cracking (via Argon2)

What MothrBox Doesn't Protect Against ❌ Weak passwords (use strong, unique passwords) ❌ Compromised local machine (malware can steal passwords) ❌ Social engineering (protect your passwords) ❌ Quantum computers (current algorithms are not post-quantum)

Best Practices

  1. Use strong, unique passwords (20+ characters, random)

  2. Store passwords in a password manager

  3. Keep your private keys secure (for ECC)

  4. Verify file integrity after download

  5. Keep MothrBox updated for security patches

Roadmap

Current (v0.1)

  • ✅ Three encryption algorithms

  • ✅ Walrus Protocol integration

  • ✅ Unified Docker architecture

  • ✅ Automatic encryption/decryption

Planned (v0.2)

  • 🔄 Post-quantum cryptography (Kyber, Dilithium)

  • 🔄 File compression before encryption

  • 🔄 Multi-file archives

  • 🔄 Metadata encryption

Future (v1.0)

  • 📋 GUI application

  • 📋 Browser extension

  • 📋 Mobile apps (iOS/Android)

  • 📋 Key management system

  • 📋 File versioning

  • 📋 Sharing with access control

Support

  • Documentation: https://docs.mothrbox.xyz/

  • Email: build@neslabs.io

MothrBox: Your data, encrypted. Your storage, decentralized. Your privacy, guaranteed. 🦋
Upload Once. Verify Forever. Encrypted on Walrus, Immutable on Sui
