🚀 Tech Stack: React, Sui Move, Enoki, Walrus, Seal.

Satya - A Decentralized AI Model Marketplace with Cryptographic Trust

Project Overview

Satya is a groundbreaking decentralized platform designed to revolutionize the AI model marketplace by embedding cryptographic trust and security at its core. Built on the Sui blockchain, it addresses key pain points in traditional AI marketplaces, such as lack of transparency, model piracy, and unreliable verification.

By leveraging Trusted Execution Environments (TEE), homomorphic encryption, and smart contracts, Satya enables creators to sell AI models securely while providing buyers with verifiable proof of performance and authenticity. This project was developed as a hackathon entry to demonstrate how blockchain-native architecture can create a trustless ecosystem for AI commerce.

The Problem

The AI model marketplace is plagued by significant trust and security issues that stifle innovation and adoption. In centralized platforms, users are forced to rely on intermediaries to verify model authenticity, process payments, and safeguard intellectual property. This creates vulnerabilities: creators often face model theft, inadequate quality checks, and inequitable revenue sharing. Buyers, on the other hand, grapple with uncertainties around model performance, potential biases, and the risk of encountering malicious or misrepresented algorithms.

Current solutions depend heavily on reputation-based systems and centralized audits, which are susceptible to manipulation, hacks, or single points of failure. There's no reliable way to prove that a model delivers as promised, leading to information asymmetry where sellers hold all the cards. Without cryptographic safeguards, models can be tampered with, reverse-engineered, or altered undetected. Payment handling adds another layer of friction, as users must trust third-party processors for secure, cross-border transactions, exposing them to fraud and delays.

These challenges not only slow down the global exchange of AI assets but also limit accessibility for independent developers and small teams in the AI space.

The Solution

Satya reimagines AI marketplaces by removing trust dependencies through a fully decentralized, cryptographically secure architecture. At its heart, the platform uses Trusted Execution Environments (TEE) to produce tamper-proof attestations verifying a model's performance metrics, bias levels, and authenticity. This ensures that buyers can confidently assess models without running them locally or risking exposure to proprietary code.

To protect creators' intellectual property, Satya integrates SEAL homomorphic encryption, which allows computations on encrypted models. This means verifications and evaluations can occur securely without decrypting the underlying data, preventing piracy while enabling practical use cases like on-demand testing.

Payments and revenue distribution are automated via smart contracts on the Sui blockchain, guaranteeing fair compensation for creators and transparent fee collection for the platform. Every transaction, verification, and interaction is logged on an immutable blockchain ledger, providing end-to-end auditability without needing a central authority. Quality metrics generated within secure enclaves, are stored on-chain, giving buyers access to reliable, verifiable data to inform their decision, in essence, Satya shifts the paradigm from "trust me" to "verify it," fostering a permissionless, global marketplace where AI models can be traded like secure digital assets.

Technical stack

Satya employs a robust, modern tech stack optimized for performance, security, and user experience:

  • Frontend: Built with Next.js 15 and TypeScript for type-safe, efficient development. Server-side rendering ensures fast load times and SEO-friendliness, while Tailwind CSS delivers a responsive, mobile-first UI that works seamlessly across devices.

  • Blockchain Integration: Utilizes @mysten

    /dapp-kit and

    @mysten

    /sui.js

    for effortless wallet connections and transaction handling. Smart contracts are written in Sui Move, a secure language that manages marketplace operations, payment logic, and access controls with built-in formal verification to prevent bugs.

  • Storage and Security: Walrus provides decentralized, fault-tolerant storage for model files, ensuring high availability and redundancy. The SEAL library handles homomorphic encryption for privacy-preserving computations, and Nautilus TEE servers generate cryptographic proofs of model integrity.

  • APIs and Services: A set of RESTful APIs manages model uploads, verification requests, and secure decryption of blobs. WebSocket integrations enable real-time updates, such as progress tracking during verifications, for a dynamic and responsive user interface.

This stack is designed for scalability, with a focus on blockchain-native tools to minimize latency and maximize security.

Leveraging the Sui Blockchain

Satya is purpose-built on Sui to harness its innovative features for AI commerce. Sui's object-centric data model treats AI models as native blockchain objects, allowing direct ownership and transfer without cumbersome token wrappers. This simplifies trading and reduces complexity compared to traditional ERC-20 or NFT standards.High-throughput parallel execution ensures the platform handles peak trading volumes without bottlenecks, while Move's formal verification guarantees the security of financial smart contracts.

Low gas fees make micro-payments viable, supporting diverse pricing strategies like pay-per-use or subscription models for AI inferences.With sub-second transaction finality, users get instant confirmations, ideal for real-time AI model exchanges. Sui's composability opens doors to integrations with other DeFi or data services, and sponsored transactions lower barriers for newcomers by covering initial gas costs.

The event system powers live marketplace feeds and analytics, while dynamic NFTs allow model metadata to evolve as new TEE-verified performance data is added. By anchoring everything on Sui, Satya creates a verifiable, efficient ecosystem that empowers creators and buyers alike, turning AI trading into a secure, borderless reality.

Impact and Future Potential

Satya not only solves immediate trust issues in AI marketplaces but also paves the way for broader adoption of decentralized AI. It democratizes access for indie developers, reduces barriers for global collaboration, and sets a new standard for verifiable AI assets. Future expansions could include AI model composability, cross-chain interoperability, and community governance.

Aura is a next-generation earn-out protocol designed to bring transparency and fairness to M&A. Traditional earn-outs suffer because records are opaque, incentives are misaligned, and both sides must rely on trust rather than verifiable evidence. Aura replaces this fragile setup with a cryptographically secured workflow that gives every participant confidence in the numbers.

All performance documents are stored on Walrus, creating a shared, tamper-proof source of truth. Sensitive files are encrypted through Seal, ensuring that only authorized parties can access financial data while still keeping the overall system verifiable. Smart contracts anchor the entire mechanism by encoding KPI rules, timelines, and settlement conditions directly on-chain, allowing payments to trigger automatically once requirements are met.

Auditors gain instant access to authenticated records without endless reconciliation. Sellers no longer worry about post-acquisition manipulation, and buyers gain assurance that payouts reflect real performance rather than negotiation leverage.

By combining decentralized storage, encrypted access control, and automated on-chain logic, Aura transforms earn-outs from a contentious, manual process into a streamlined, transparent, and trust-minimized mechanism suitable for modern M&A.

============

Data Flow

📜 Deal Creation Flow:

  1. Buyer prepares deal parameters (seller address, auditor address, KPI targets, etc.)

  2. Frontend → Backend Relay → Walrus (upload encrypted deal docs)

  3. Frontend signs Sui transaction with deal parameters + blob ID

  4. Sui Blockchain creates deal contract and stores blob ID earnout::create_deal)

📊 Financial Data Upload Flow:

  1. Frontend encrypts financial docs with Seal SDK (client-side)

  2. Frontend → Backend Relay → Walrus (upload encrypted blob)

  3. Frontend signs Sui transaction to register blob ID on-chain

  4. Sui Blockchain stores blob ID + metadata in deal contract earnout::add_walrus_blob)

📥 Download & Verification Flow:

  1. Frontend fetches encrypted blob from Walrus (via blob ID)

  2. Frontend decrypts with Seal SDK earnout::seal_approve)

  3. Auditor verifies decrypted data and attests it on-chain

  4. Smart Contract updates verification status earnout::audit_data)

📝 KPI Calculation with TEE:

  1. Frontend downloads encrypted blobs from Walrus

  2. Frontend decrypts data with Seal SDK

  3. Frontend sends decrypted data to Nautilus TEE

  4. TEE computes KPI + generates cryptographic attestation

  5. Frontend submits KPI result + attestation to Sui Blockchain earnout::submit_kpi_and_settle)

  6. Smart Contract verifies attestation → executes settlement earnout::verify_nautilus_attestation)

============

Key Features

For Buyers:

  • Transparent Process: On-chain proof of all financial submissions

  • Reduced Legal Costs: Automated KPI verification eliminates disputes

  • Flexible Reporting: Upload revenue, expenses, and payroll data monthly

For Sellers:

  • Real-time Monitoring: Track KPI progress against targets

  • Trustless Verification: Decrypt financial docs anytime without buyer permission

  • Guaranteed Payment: Smart contract escrow ensures funds are available

For Auditors:

  • Immutable Audit Trail: All data submissions timestamped on-chain

  • Efficient Workflow: Download encrypted docs from Walrus, verify, attest KPI

  • Cryptographic Proof: Sign attestations with wallet key

Walrus Data Hub is a decentralized 3D Web3 platform that transforms how data is stored, verified, curated, and exchanged. It brings together three hackathon tracks into one unified system: a Decentralized Data Marketplace, AI–driven data intelligence, and a Truth Engine for authenticity verification.

At its core, Walrus Data Hub allows anyone to upload datasets, store them immutably on Walrus, prove ownership through cryptographic hashes, and trade datasets with provable provenance using a Sui wallet. Users can explore climate data, wildlife tracking datasets, research files, or media archives within a transparent and censorship-resistant system.

The platform’s AI Indexer automatically analyzes datasets and assigns categories or insight tags, enabling faster discovery and improved curation with minimal friction. This democratizes access to high value data while lowering onboarding barriers for both data producers and consumers.

The built-in Truth Engine provides lightweight authenticity verification by analyzing metadata patterns, provenance cues, and source markers. This feature helps flag manipulated or unreliable data supporting a more trustworthy digital ecosystem where misinformation is harder to propagate and sensitive datasets cannot be quietly altered or erased.

The interface is built as a fully client-side HTML project with 3D glassmorphic visuals, Sui Wallet Adapter integration, and real-time interactive components. It works instantly on any browser and provides a smooth, low-friction demo for users and judges.

Walrus Data Hub demonstrates the future of decentralized data economies:
– user-owned datasets
– transparent provenance
– censorship-resistant storage
– AI-powered insight generation
– open access to truth-verifiable information

It showcases how Walrus + Sui can power a new generation of open, sovereign data ecosystems where communities not centralized platforms control how data is stored, shared, monetized, and trusted.

Suirify is a sovereign identity protocol built on Sui that resolves Web3's & Web2 fundamental conflict between trust and privacy. We address the identity trilemma where users currently choose between total anonymity, complete privacy sacrifice, or centralized custody by enabling "verify once, use everywhere without Exposing PII data" through privacy-preserving credentials.

Our solution allows users to undergo a single verification using government IDs to mint a reusable, self-sovereign Suirify Attestation in their wallet. The architecture ensures zero PII storage by processing personal data only in ephemeral memory and permanently deleting it after verification, using cryptographic proofs for compliance checks without exposing user data.

we're building the foundational identity infrastructure for compliant DeFi, secure financial services, and true on-chain reputation. Suirify represents the missing piece in Web3's & Web2 evolution, maintaining decentralization's core values while enabling real-world utility and regulatory compliance for the next billion users.

SealedEncryptedBlog is an encrypted blogging platform built using React for frontend development, Sui blockchain contracts, Walrus decentralized storage, and the Seal encryption framework.

The platform enables users to publish articles in a decentralized manner. Content can be created as public posts accessible to anyone, or as encrypted articles visible only to designated users—with the publisher retaining access by default.

Article content and embedded images are stored via Walrus. Encrypted content undergoes frontend encryption using Seal before being chain-based notarized and stored, ensuring confidentiality and integrity during transmission and storage.

The platform also introduces an interactive mechanism where likes mint NFTs, mapping user interactions into unique on-chain digital credentials. It allows publishers to modify or delete articles, thereby building a decentralized blogging system with public sharing capabilities and granular access control—all while safeguarding content security and privacy.

SealedEncryptedBlog 是一款基于 React 前端、Sui 区块链合约、Walrus 去中心化存储与 Seal 加密框架构建的加密型博客平台。

平台支持用户以去中心化方式发布文章，既可以创建任何人均可阅读的公开内容，也可以发布仅指定用户可见的加密型文章，默认发布者始终拥有访问权限。

文章正文与插入图片通过 Walrus 进行存储，加密型内容则在前端使用 Seal 完成加密后再上链存证与存储，保证数据在传输与存储过程中的机密性与完整性。

平台同时引入点赞即铸造 NFT 的互动机制，将用户的点赞行为映射为链上的独特数字凭证，并允许发布者对文章进行修改与删除，从而在保证内容安全与隐私保护的前提下，构建一个具备公开分享与精细化访问控制能力的去中心化博客系统。

ZeroVault turns sensitive datasets into private, verifiable digital assets on Sui.

Instead of uploading raw CSVs, images, or logs to a central platform, creators encrypt their files end‑to‑end, store only ciphertext as Walrus blobs, and prove authenticity with Groth16 ZK proofs verified on‑chain. Buyers never see plaintext on the blockchain but they still get strong guarantees about what they’re buying.

Under the hood, ZeroVault combines:

  • Seal encryption & key wrapping so files are always stored and transmitted as ciphertext.

  • Walrus for durable, content‑addressed blob storage, with direct Walruscan links for every dataset.

  • A Sui Move marketplace that uses Programmable Transaction Blocks and a dedicated zk_verifier module to call Sui’s native Groth16 verifier and update a shared ProofRegistry.

  • Nautilus TEE (Rust, containerized) that pulls encrypted blobs from Walrus, runs data‑quality analysis in a trusted environment, and returns a quality score + attestation without exposing raw data.

  • zkEmail‑style attestations that bind creators’ wallets to email domains (e.g. @university.edu, @company.com), rendering “Verified @domain” badges without revealing the full email.

From the user’s perspective, ZeroVault feels like a polished Web3 SaaS:

  • Creators upload any file type, watch a live “ZeroVault pipeline” (Encrypt & upload → Run ZK proof → Verify on‑chain → Mint entry), and one‑click list on‑chain.

  • Buyers browse a clean marketplace UI with dataset cards showing price in SUI, Walrus blob links, Nautilus quality scores, and zkEmail badges, then purchase via Sui wallet and secure‑download the original file (correct filename + MIME type) after decryption in the browser.

  • All of this runs “for real” on a single AWS EC2 instance: Node/Express + Postgres backend, Next.js frontend, Nautilus container, and Sui / Walrus testnet integration—no mocks, no fake IDs.

ZeroVault is a blueprint for privacy‑preserving data economies: creators keep control of their raw data, buyers get verifiable quality and provenance, and the chain only ever sees encrypted blobs, proofs, and attestations—not the datasets themselves.

Zing is built on the belief that the internet has lost its original promise — a place where creators can truly own their work and identity. Today’s web lacks a native identity layer, leaving creators dependent on centralized platforms that control distribution, monetization, and even access to their own content. Zing aims to restore digital sovereignty to creators by giving them verifiable ownership of both their identity and their creations.

During this hackathon, we continued to advance Zing’s capabilities. We completed our traceable watermark service and implemented layered encryption for efficient media decryption and customized access control. By integrating the traceable watermark with our identity module, creators can now better protect their content from copyright infringement and unauthorized leaks, taking the security of their rights to the next level.

1. Zero-Latency Content Delivery via TEE-Loaded AES-GCM(256) File Key

Load the creator’s AES-GCM(256) file key once inside Nautilus’ Trusted Execution Environment.
This eliminates repeated key-fetching, enabling high-throughput encrypted workloads like:

  • Video streaming

  • Audio playback

  • Batch content extraction

  • Rapid multi-asset watermark generation

The result: secure + blazing fast content delivery.


2. TEE-Isolated Access Control Engine for Dynamic Gatekeeping

With the File Key now resident in TEE memory, our internal server becomes a fully customizable access control gateway:

  • Membership tier gating

  • Time-limited access windows

  • Pay-per-view unlock

  • Region or device-based restrictions

  • Custom rule pipelines defined per Studio

All enforced inside a trusted hardware execution layer, not application code.

3. On-Chain Identity + Off-Chain Privacy via Sui's Native Cryptography

Every watermark embeds:

  • Signer’s address

  • Studio ownership signature

  • Nonce + timestamp

  • Unique cryptographic watermark ID

This creates a provable on-chain identity trail while keeping content encrypted and private off-chain.

4. Traceable Watermarks for Leak Attribution

Each exported image/video frame carries a unique, invisible LSB-based watermark tied to:

  • Subscriber ID

  • Access path

  • Request signature

  • Timestamp / session

If a file leaks → we can mathematically determine who leaked it with our identity module

Sirius Data Layer is a decentralized data-versioning system built on the Sui blockchain and powered by Walrus for encrypted, distributed storage. It provides secure, verifiable, and immutable dataset management through on-chain governance handled by Sui Move smart contracts. Data is stored in encrypted form with redundancy, and file keys are sealed using policy-based cryptography so that only authorized users can decrypt them. Each commit includes a Merkle root for integrity verification, ensuring tamper-evident version control without storing full data on-chain. A Trusted Execution Environment performs content checks using AI, automatically rejecting illegal material and certifying valid files. The project includes a React frontend for repository and file management with wallet integration, and a TypeScript Express backend coordinating encryption, file operations, TEE verification, and caching. Sirius Data Layer targets scenarios requiring secure, auditable, and collaborative data handling, such as research datasets, regulated environments, and sensitive data management.

The platform uses Sui blockchain for immutable attestations, Walrus for decentralized storage, Seal for cryptographic proofs, and Nautilus for fast indexing. It helps users identify authentic content in an era of AI-generated media and deepfakes.

The Pursuit of Fairness - On-Chain AI Bias Auditor

The Pursuit of Fairness is a provably authentic AI Bias Auditing Engine that transforms opaque, untrustworthy AI fairness evaluations into cryptographically verified, tamper-proof, and publicly auditable truth records.

Today, AI fairness audits happen behind closed doors. Companies can modify results, hide discriminatory outcomes, or publish manipulated reports without any way for users or regulators to verify truth. There is no accountability, no provenance, and no cryptographic proof of fairness.

We fix that by bringing AI Truth + Encryption + Decentralized Provenance + On-Chain Verification into a single trustless pipeline.

🔍 What the Project Does

1. Runs bias analysis
Evaluates any dataset or prediction output and generates fairness metrics such as disparate impact, demographic parity, equal opportunity difference, and statistical bias levels.

2. Encrypts all audit results using Seal
Reports are encrypted client-side using Seal’s threshold encryption and sealed with fine-grained access policies.
➡️ No one — including us — can view the fairness report without permission.

3. Stores encrypted fairness reports on Walrus
The encrypted audit blob is uploaded to Walrus, producing a verifiable blob_id and blob_hash.
➡️ Guarantees permanence, censorship resistance, and tamper-proof storage.

4. Anchors proofs on Sui Blockchain
A FairnessCertificate object is minted containing:

  • Walrus blob ID

  • Hash fingerprint of audit result

  • AI model identifier

  • Summary fairness metrics

  • Timestamp + auditor wallet

➡️ Anyone can verify authenticity instantly.

5. Public Verification Portal
Users, regulators, and developers can fetch Walrus blobs, verify their hashes, and confirm audit integrity on-chain.

🧩 Why It Fits the “Provably Authentic” Track

This project creates truth-anchored AI audits that can’t be forged, hidden, or altered.
It uses Walrus for immutable evidence, Seal for encryption, and Sui for public verification — exactly matching the track’s goals:

✔ Proving integrity of data
✔ Verifying source & provenance
✔ Making AI outputs trustworthy
✔ Providing on-chain authenticity for sensitive results

No fairness audit has been trustless — until now.

🛠️ Tech Stack

  • AI Engine: GPT / Local ML for fairness scoring

  • Seal: Threshold encryption + policy-based access

  • Walrus: Decentralized audit storage

  • Sui Blockchain: On-chain FairnessCertificate registry

  • Frontend: Next.js + Tailwind UI

  • Backend: Node.js + Walrus uploader + Sui signer

🎯 Impact

The Pursuit of Fairness helps:

  • Enterprises prove unbiased AI systems

  • Regulators validate audits without exposing sensitive data

  • Users trust AI products with cryptographic guarantees

  • Developers debug and document fairness over model versions

With OpenAI embeddings, an optimized RAG search pipeline, and optional SEAL encryption, Storarc lets you upload documents, ask natural language questions, and retrieve precise, context-aware answers — all without relying on centralized servers.

Why Storarc?

Traditional cloud services experience frequent large-scale outages, from Cloudflare disruptions to AWS downtime and even global failures like the CrowdStrike-Microsoft incident. Storarc removes single points of failure using true decentralization:

  • Distributed storage via Walrus

  • On-chain proof of ownership with Sui

  • End-to-end client-side encryption with SEAL

  • Natural language search and chat using AI

What Can Storarc Do?

Suitable for researchers, developers, enterprises, students, legal teams, and anyone who wants permanent, private, AI-powered knowledge storage.

Technical Foundation

Current Limitations (Testnet)

Roadmap

  • Multi-language support

  • Enhanced encryption

  • Mobile applications

  • Mainnet launch

  • IPFS redundancy and external API integrations

For access control:

  • Upload document in private mode.

  • Open the application in another browser/tab

  • Connect with a different wallet address (not the one with which the private doc is uploaded)

  • Try chatting and asking details from the document uploaded.

  • It will respond with "No accessible document"

  • Go back to the browser/tab and connect with wallet with which the private doc is uploaded.

  • Navigate to documents page

  • Click on the private document (which have the locked icon)

  • Paste the address in the input field and click grant and sign the transaction.

  • After the transaction is complete, navigate back to the browser/tab connected with the non whitelisted address

  • This time you should be able to see the details about the private document.

GhostContext is a decentralized marketplace that allows users to monetize sensitive documents without ever revealing the raw data to a server. By combining Sui for access control, Walrus for encrypted storage, and WebGPU for local inference, we bring the AI to the data, ensuring secrets never leave the user's browser.


Project Description (The Details)

The Problem:


The world is facing a "Privacy vs. Utility" crisis. Enterprises cannot upload sensitive financial reports or IP to cloud LLMs (like ChatGPT) due to data leak risks. Meanwhile, domain experts cannot monetize their proprietary knowledge because selling a file usually results in piracy and loss of control.

The Solution:
GhostContext solves this by creating a "Thick Client, Thin Chain" architecture. We enable a trustless data economy where:

  1. Creators encrypt documents locally and mint "Access NFTs" on Sui.

  2. Buyers purchase access and fetch encrypted blobs from Walrus.

  3. The Magic: The document is decrypted in-memory and fed into a running entirely in the browser via WebGPU.

Unlike other marketplaces that just sell files, GhostContext allows users to chat with and extract intelligence from high-value data without the raw information ever touching the internet.

How We Are Different from local llm ( olama ) :

Most "Local AI" tools are isolated silos safe but unshareable. GhostContext adds an Economic Layer to Local AI:

  • Networked Privacy: Unlike tools like Ollama where data is stuck on your hard drive, GhostContext allows Secure Collaboration. You can share sensitive insights without emailing the raw file.

  • Programmable Access (Sui): We use blockchain as a DRM layer. The NFT acts as a digital key, ensuring that only verified buyers can decrypt the data. This turns static PDFs into monetizable, liquid assets.

  • Blind Storage (Walrus): Unlike AWS, Walrus storage nodes only hold encrypted shards. They cannot peek at the data, creating a censorship-resistant vault.


    Tech Stack

  • Blockchain: Sui Move (Shared Object Marketplace).

  • Storage: Walrus Protocol (Blob Storage).

  • AI Engine: WebLLM & Transformers.js (WebGPU/WASM).

  • Vector DB: indexdb (Client-side vector search).

  • Frontend: React, Tailwind, Framer Motion.


Why Sui & Walrus?

We didn't choose this stack just because of the hackathon; it is the only stack that makes this architecture possible.

Why Sui? (The Speed of Commerce)

  • Object-Centric Model: Unlike other chains where assets are just balances in a ledger, Sui treats our "Encrypted Contexts" as distinct Objects. This allows us to attach complex metadata (Blob IDs, Encryption IVs) directly to the NFT itself.

  • Low Latency: For a real-time AI marketplace, we need instant finality. When a user buys access, they need the key now, not in 10 minutes. Sui’s sub-second finality makes the UX feel like Web2.

Why Walrus? (The Privacy Anchor)

  • Cost-Effective Large Blobs: Storing entire PDFs and Vector Indices on Ethereum or Solana is prohibitively expensive. Walrus handles large unstructured data (Blobs) efficiently.

  • Decentralized Robustness: By using Walrus, we ensure that the "Ghost Vault" has no single point of failure. Even if our frontend goes down, the encrypted knowledge remains accessible and censorship-resistant on the decentralized web.

Together: Sui acts as the Brain (Logic/Access) and Walrus acts as the Memory (Storage), creating a perfect unstoppable backend


Future Roadmap

  • Phase 1 (Current): Secure P2P Document Sharing & Chat.

  • Phase 2 (Q2 2025): "GhostNodes" – Allowing users with powerful GPUs to rent out their compute for decentralized training/inference (DePIN).

  • Phase 3 (Q4 2025): ZK-Proofs – Integrating Zero-Knowledge proofs to verify the authenticity of a document (e.g., "Is this really a Tesla Patent?") without decrypting it.

⚠️ Instructions for Judges (Important)

To test the Local AI features fully:

  1. Hardware: Please use a Desktop/Laptop with a dedicated GPU (or a modern M1/M2 Mac). WebGL is required.

  2. Network: Connect your wallet to Sui Testnet.

  3. The "Magic" Moment: In the demo, you can turn off your WiFi after the document loads, and the AI will continue to answer questions. This proves no data is leaving your device.

TLT (TimeLocked Truth) is the first Polymarket-style prediction market on Sui that enables users to create claims backed by time-locked encrypted evidence. Unlike traditional prediction markets where all data is public, TLT uses Seal's identity-based encryption to keep sensitive evidence private until a predetermined deadline, unlocking entirely new use cases for privacy-preserving truth markets.

🎯 The Problem

Traditional prediction markets lack privacy for sensitive information. Whistleblowers, insider traders (legal ones), and participants with confidential data cannot participate without exposing their sources or evidence prematurely. This limits the markets' utility for high-stakes, sensitive predictions.

💡 Our Solution

TLT combines three Mysten technologies to solve this:

Seal - Identity-based encryption with programmable time-lock policies

Walrus - Decentralized storage for claim specs and encrypted evidence

Sui - Smart contracts for claim registry and access control enforcement

Users create claims, attach encrypted evidence that automatically becomes decryptable after the deadline, and stake on outcomes—all while maintaining privacy until the truth emerges.

✨ Key Features

- 🔐 Time-Locked Evidence: Seal encrypts evidence that only unlocks after claim deadline

- 📦 Decentralized Storage: All data stored on Walrus (specs + encrypted blobs)

- ⚖️ Programmable Policies: Move smart contracts control decryption access

- 🎨 Polymarket-Style UI: Modern, clean interface with live market cards

- 🔔 Professional UX: Toast notifications, smooth animations, no browser popups

- ⚡ Real-Time Updates: Auto-refresh markets every 10 seconds

🛠️ Technical Stack

- Frontend: React 18 + TypeScript + Vite + TailwindCSS

- Encryption: @mysten/seal SDK for client-side time-lock encryption

- Storage: Walrus Publisher API (HTTP uploads)

- Blockchain: Sui Move contracts + @mysten/dapp-kit

- UI: Radix UI + Sonner toasts + Lucide icons

🔑 Why This Fits "Data Security & Privacy"

1. End-to-End Encryption: Evidence encrypted client-side, never exposed unencrypted

2. Zero Trust Architecture: No centralized party can access evidence before deadline

3. Threshold Encryption: 2-of-2 Seal key servers required for decryption

4. Onchain Policy Enforcement: time_lock_policy.move verifies deadline before approving keys

5. Novel Use Cases: Enables whistleblower markets, confidential predictions, insider trading (legal)

📊 Use Cases

Whistleblower Markets: "Company X will announce fraud within 30 days" → Evidence stays encrypted until public

Corporate Predictions: "Product launch delayed to Q2" → Internal docs time-locked

Scientific Claims: "Research paper will be retracted" → Methodology concerns sealed until formal investigation

TLT transforms prediction markets from public speculation to privacy-preserving truth verification—where evidence stays sealed until the moment of revelation.

read on github on more details : https://github.com/cadalt0/CallerID

CallerID is a decentralized, privacy-first caller identification system built on the Sui blockchain. It enables users to identify unknown callers without exposing their contact data, leveraging Nautilus Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) for secure processing, Walrus for encrypted blob storage, and Seal for threshold encryption. All operations are cryptographically attested and verified on-chain.



### How CallerID Works

Contact Management:

- Users can manually add contact details or upload VCF files through the web interface

- All hashing (Blake2b256) and Seal encryption operations happen securely inside the Nautilus server (Trusted Execution Environment)

- Encrypted contact blobs are stored in Walrus decentralized storage

- After processing, users can publish contacts on-chain to the Sui blockchain

Spam Detection & Voting:

- Users can vote spam or not spam on phone numbers

- Community votes determine if a number is spam/fraud/scam

- Staking Required: Before voting spam, users must stake SUI tokens

- Slashing Mechanism: False spam reports result in slashing of staked SUI, ensuring honest reporting and preventing abuse

This creates a decentralized, trustless system where the community collectively maintains a spam database while protecting user privacy through encryption and secure enclaves.

Retrieving Caller Information:

- Website Lookup: Contact details can be retrieved through the website's lookup feature by entering a phone number

- Automatic Device Detection: On incoming calls, the Android app automatically retrieves caller information

- Secure Decryption: The system hashes the phone number and decrypts contact data inside Nautilus TEEs to verify and retrieve caller details

- Android Beta App: A lightweight Android beta app is available for testing real-time caller identification

### Key Features

- 🔒 Privacy-First: Contacts are encrypted locally and stored as encrypted blobs - no plaintext data ever leaves your device

- 🛡️ Nautilus TEEs: All sensitive operations execute inside Nautilus Trusted Execution Environments with cryptographic attestations, ensuring verifiable secure processing

- 💾 Walrus Storage: Encrypted contact blobs stored in Walrus decentralized storage - cost-effective, permanent, and censorship-resistant

- 🔐 Seal Encryption: Threshold encryption using Seal protocol for secure key management and distributed decryption without single points of failure

- ⛓️ On-Chain Verification: CID digests and Merkle roots stored on-chain for transparent, auditable verification

- 🚫 Spam Detection: Community-driven spam reporting with stake-based voting system

- 📱 Android App: Native Android application for real-time caller identification

- 🌐 Web Interface: Modern Next.js web application for contact management and lookup

---

### Example Data

#### Walrus Storage

Encrypted contact blobs are stored in Walrus decentralized storage:

- Blob ID: IVYKtSBjj2ywdL2utk_-nHBjANqqnvy-5WZtAZNy2_M

- Blob Object ID: 0x8b725a26dbd22886f337aaf1df4ecacb740f2d6fe4bd850588fd4db4c4123ef4

- [View on Sui Explorer](https://suiexplorer.com/object/0x8b725a26dbd22886f337aaf1df4ecacb740f2d6fe4bd850588fd4db4c4123ef4?network=testnet)

#### Nautilus TEE Processing

Example response from Nautilus enclave after processing contacts:

```json

{

"response": {

"intent": 0,

"timestamp_ms": 1763923538401,

"data": {

"contacts": [

{

"name": "happy meal",

"phone_hash": [

222, 253, 200, 99, 45, 64, 162, 243, 198, 192, 248, 87, 129, 12, 106, 248,

136, 223, 38, 223, 62, 54, 25, 76, 241, 108, 180, 167, 201, 64, 212, 19

],

"email": "",

"other": ""

}

]

}

},

"signature": "436614af5a2e068d7af745438669082f268b3dd23ac33bafee0b4ff182d1503d"

}

```

#### Seal Encryption

Contact data (email and other fields) is encrypted using Seal threshold encryption. The encryption process:

1. Initialization: SealClient connects to multiple key servers (threshold: 2 of N)

2. Encryption: Email and other fields are encrypted using Seal SDK with phone hash as the policy ID

3. Output: Encrypted blobs are stored while names remain plaintext for lookup

Example encrypted contact structure:

- name: Plaintext (for quick lookup)

- encrypted_email: Hex-encoded encrypted email using Seal threshold encryption

- encrypted_other: Hex-encoded encrypted other field using Seal threshold encryption

- phone_hash: Blake2b256 hash of phone number (used as Seal policy ID)

The encryption uses distributed key servers, ensuring no single point of failure and enabling threshold decryption when needed.

Vyra is a privacy-preserving transaction protocol built on the Sui blockchain, designed to protect user identity, financial data, and on-chain activity without compromising speed or usability.

Vyra introduces a confidential transfer layer that breaks the public link between senders and receivers, encrypts transaction amounts, and enables users to interact privately with Sui-based apps and assets.

Built for real-world financial use, Vyra offers unlinkable transfers, stealth addresses, relayer-based gasless withdrawals, and optional auditability—making privacy a practical, scalable, and developer-friendly primitive for the Sui ecosystem.

Mnemosyne is a cognitive-assistance system built on edge computing + cloud AI, designed to help individuals with Alzheimer’s disease or memory impairments instantly recognize people and recall emotional-association information in real-life situations.

The system captures live video through a camera and uses the Azure Face API for facial recognition. The identified person is then matched with a “memory node” stored on the Walrus/Sui network, generating patient-friendly reminder messages that are gently delivered through the display and TTS (text-to-speech).

Intent-Based DeFi Agent

Intenus is a universal intent-based infrastructure empowered by AI agents that transform natural language into optimal on-chain execution. It unifies fragmented DeFi protocols into a single interface, allowing users to trade efficiently across the ecosystem simply by expressing their goals.

Vision

Transform DeFi from a maze of protocols into a single, intelligent interface where users express intents and AI agents handle the complexity.

PROBLEM STATEMENTS

Despite the rapid growth of Decentralized Finance (DeFi), the ecosystem remains inaccessible to the mass market and technically constrained by outdated architectural models.

  1. Fragmented Liquidity & Interoperability Friction

Liquidity is scattered across chains and protocols, forcing users to juggle dozens of interfaces.

Even simple multi-step workflows—swap → bridge → lend—require manual coordination, high gas, and high risk of execution failure.

  1. Scope Limitations

Current intent-based solutions are narrow and domain-specific.

Protocols like CoW only solve token swaps; aggregators like 1inch optimize for price but can’t understand conditional logic or complex user workflows.

  1. Complexity Barrier & Cognitive Overload

Optimal execution today requires expert knowledge of slippage, MEV, gas markets, routing, and protocol specifics.

Most users simply cannot operate at this level—leading to inefficiency, errors, and lost capital.

  1. The Verifiability Dilemma

Complex AI-driven optimizations can’t run on-chain (too expensive), but running off-chain introduces trust issues and opacity.
DeFi currently lacks an infrastructure that is both intelligent and provably fair.

SOLUTIONS

  1. Intent AI Agent

Natural language → executable workflows

Converts conversations into valid IGS Schemas using NLP. Users simply chat their goals ("Swap ETH to USDC, bridge to Aptos"), while the Agent handles all technical complexities—gas, routes, chain IDs—automatically.

  1. Intenus General Standard - IGS Schema

Universal protocol language for intents

Standardized JSON framework that structures user goals (IGS Intent) and solver execution paths (IGS Solution). Enables seamless AI-to-solver-to-TEE communication with composable DeFi primitives (Swap, Lend, Bridge).

  1. Universal Solver Network - USN

USN is an open marketplace where independent solvers compete to fulfill user intents. By drawing from on-chain liquidity, P2P matching, or off-chain inventory, solvers craft optimized IGS Solutions that aim to outperform market benchmarks and deliver the most efficient execution.

Heterogeneous Strategies: USN gives solvers full freedom to design their execution logic—ranging from DEX aggregation and CoW-style P2P matching to proprietary AI or hybrid strategies.

Open Competition: A permissionless arena where solvers race to deliver the most profitable outcome, regardless of the method used.

Incentivized Integrity: Staking and slashing enforce real "skin-in-the-game," ensuring solvers stay aligned with execution quality and reliability.

  1. Verifiable AI Ranking

Bias-free optimization in TEEs

Machine learning engine running inside Nautilus TEEs that ranks solutions by profit, gas, and reputation. Every decision generates cryptographic Attestation proofs—guaranteeing merit-based, manipulation-resistant selection.

  1. Programmable Privacy (The Shield)

User-controlled encryption via Seal

Users define decryption rules (e.g., "Reputation > 80, Min Stake = 100 ETH"). Eliminates MEV by encrypting intents end-to-end with time-bounded, conditional access—invisible to predatory bots.

ARCHITECTURE

[Media]

WHY WALRUS?

Solving the cost-scale dilemma

Intenus generates massive data volumes—IGS Schemas, Solutions, AI training sets. Walrus provides decentralized storage that scales without exploding gas costs.

  • 90% Cost Reduction: Offloads heavy intent/solution data off-chain

  • AI Infrastructure: Low-cost persistent storage for continuous model training and optimization

WHY SEAL?

Solving the "Dark Forest" problem

Standard encryption is binary (on/off). Seal enables programmable access rules that adapt to solver quality and market conditions.

  • MEV Immunity: Conceals intent specifics during solving—front-running becomes mathematically impossible

  • Quality Gating: Auto-grants decryption only to solvers meeting Stake/Reputation thresholds

  • Ephemeral Access: Time-bounded windows auto-revoke post-execution

WHY NAUTILUS?

Solving the verifiable off-chain intelligence paradox

On-chain AI = too expensive. Off-chain servers = no trust. Nautilus TEEs enable provably fair AI with cryptographic guarantees.

  • Verifiable AI: Heavy ML models run off-chain, generate on-chain attestation proofs

  • Blind Evaluation: Scores encrypted solutions without exposing solver strategies (IP protection)

  • Tamper-Proof: Hardware-enforced integrity—ranking is merit-based, not manipulated

IMPACT & INNOVATION

  1. For Users

  • 75% reduction in cognitive load — Execute sophisticated strategies with simple intents

  • 15-25% better outcomes vs direct protocol interaction

  1. For Solvers

  • Open competition marketplace — Permissionless entry, any strategy allowed

  • Monetize proprietary algorithms — Earn fees while protecting IP via blind evaluation

  • Merit-based selection — Reputation and performance directly drive volume

  1. For DeFi Ecosystem

  • First universal intent standard (IGS)

  • Cross-protocol composability at scale

  • Innovation through competition — Solver diversity accelerates execution quality

  1. Technical Breakthroughs

  • IGS Schema: Comprehensive DeFi intent language

  • USN: Heterogeneous solver marketplace

  • TEE-based AI Ranking: First production verifiable AI for DeFi optimization

KEY RESOURCES

SealTrust is a cryptographic verification and encrypted storage platform for AI training datasets


The Problem

When downloading datasets for AI training, there's no way to verify authenticity or control access without trusting a central authority. Data can be tampered with, provenance is unclear, and access control relies on centralized servers that can be compromised.


The Solution

SealTrust replaces trust with cryptographic proof and hardware-backed verification:

  1. Hash - Compute SHA-256 hash of the original unencrypted dataset

  2. Encrypt - Secure with Seal threshold encryption (2-of-3 key servers)

  3. Store - Upload encrypted blob to Walrus decentralized storage

  4. Verify - Nautilus TEE (AWS Nitro Enclave) attests to metadata integrity

  5. Record - Create immutable DatasetNFT on Sui blockchain

  6. Access - Only wallets on the allowlist can decrypt and download


Why It Matters

  • Provenance - Cryptographic proof that data hasn't been modified

  • Privacy - Encryption ensures only authorized parties can access

  • Decentralization - No single point of failure or trust

  • Verifiability - Anyone can verify a hash against the on-chain record


Tech Stack

  • Sui - Blockchain and NFT registry

  • Walrus - Decentralized blob storage

  • Seal - Threshold encryption with on-chain access control

  • Nautilus - TEE verification (AWS Nitro Enclaves)


Links

  • App: https://sealtrust.app

  • Docs: https://docs.sealtrust.app

  • GitHub: https://github.com/Seal-Trust

  • X (Twitter): https://x.com/sealtrust


Trust. Encrypt. Verify.

Suimo is an MCP gateway that lets AI agents fetch and consume protected data behind paywalls, logins, or anti-bot defenses while handling access, billing, and decryption for them.

It stores encrypted resources on Walrus, uses Seal IBE with on-chain key servers for encryption and decryption, and settles pricing on SUI (WAL).

Agents call connectors to upstream sources, Suimo encrypts and stores, settles per request, decrypts on access, and returns content with signed receipts.

projectName: Evala – Decentralized Human Validation Engine on Sui & Walrus
description:
Evala is a decentralized marketplace for human validation services built on Sui and Walrus. It enables data creators to publish micro-tasks requiring human judgment—such as image selection, labeling, or content evaluation—while validators earn SUI and reputation by contributing accurate decisions.

The system replaces centralized data-labeling platforms with provable ownership, transparent pricing, decentralized storage, and trustless reward distribution.

Core Problem

AI systems, creators, and digital platforms need high-quality human feedback for tasks like labeling, A/B testing, and moderation. Existing solutions rely on opaque platforms (Scale AI, MTurk) where creators lose ownership, pricing is centralized, and validator quality is hard to verify.

Evala solves this by making human judgment a decentralized, verifiable commodity.

How the Marketplace Works

1. Data Producers (Creators)

  • Upload 2–5 variants to Walrus (image/video/audio/text/PDF)

  • Fund a reward pool (minimum 0.1 SUI)

  • Open the validation task to the marketplace

  • Close voting and trigger automated distribution

2. Validators

  • Browse open tasks

  • Vote on the best or most correct variant

  • Earn SUI rewards if their vote aligns with consensus

  • Accrue reputation (+10 per correct validation)

3. Market Pricing & Ownership

  • Creators set their own reward pool size

  • All content stored under immutable Walrus CIDs

  • No central server or custodial platform

  • Events include file type metadata for faster UI resolution

4. Trustless Exchange Mechanism

  • EvalaContent emits ContentRegisteredV2 with metadata

  • EvalaVote tracks variant counts in a shared VoteBook

  • EvalaReward identifies winning variant and distributes rewards

  • RewardDistributed provides proof of payment

5. On-Chain Reputation System

  • EvalaReputation mints soulbound NFTs

  • Prevents double-claiming via Table<ID, bool>

  • Serves as a quality signal for future premium tasks

Why This Is a Marketplace (Not Just a Voting Tool)

Transparent Economic Incentives

  • Creators pay for reliable human consensus

  • Validators are compensated for correctness

  • Reward pool size becomes a market-driven price

  • Reputation increases validator value

Decentralized Data Ownership

  • Walrus ensures content remains producer-owned

  • CID-based storage prevents lock-in

  • No platform controls the data lifecycle

Fully Verifiable Exchange

  • All votes, rewards, and claims occur on-chain

  • Programmable, trustless distribution

  • No intermediaries or platform fees

Scalable, Permissionless Market

  • Anyone can create or validate tasks

  • Fits naturally into data marketplaces, AI pipelines, and DAO systems

Use Cases

AI / ML

  • Image labeling

  • Sentiment analysis

  • Dataset annotation

  • Moderation tasks

Creator Economy

  • Thumbnail A/B testing

  • UI/UX design feedback

  • Packaging and branding validation

Web3

  • DAO proposal ranking

  • NFT curation

  • Prediction and staking flows

Technical Highlights

  • Shared objects and event-driven state

  • CID-only payloads respecting Move byte limits

  • Magic-byte detection for Walrus blobs

  • Inline and fullscreen previews across media types

  • zkLogin private voting + staking path

  • DevInspect usage for off-chain contract reads

Frontend (Next.js dApp)

  • Multi-file upload with type validation

  • Dynamic previews (image/video/audio/PDF/text)

  • Public and private voting

  • Creator dashboard for distributions

  • Validator dashboard for unclaimed tasks

  • Optional summarization endpoint for human-AI hybrid workflows

Tech Stack

  • Sui Move (5 contract modules)

  • Walrus (publisher & aggregator APIs)

  • zkLogin (Google OIDC)

  • Next.js 14 + TypeScript + Tailwind

  • file-type (magic byte detection)

  • OpenRouter API (optional AI summary)

Contracts (Devnet)

  • Package ID: 0xc5f4ccbcaafce39dbe786eb4e5a328c03da43083b0077ef3c0ebdeb8fc8db29a

Roadmap

V2:

  • Tiered tasks for high-reputation validators

  • Batch validation API for ML pipelines

  • Reputation-weighted consensus

  • Adversarial detection

  • Dynamic pricing based on demand

  • Multi-round validation

ArchiveChain

Version Control for the World Wide Web

Imagine if you could git commit a breaking news story to the blockchain.

ArchiveChain is a decentralized Truth Engine that captures web history, locks it on Sui, and stores it permanently on Walrus. We make censorship impossible and history tamper-proof.

The Problem: The Silent Edit History is malleable. A news outlet publishes an exposé on corporate corruption. Two hours later, under legal pressure, they silently delete the incriminating paragraphs. The URL is the same. The timestamp says "Updated." The truth has vanished.

Existing archives are centralized libraries that can be sued, blocked, or pressured to delete records. We needed a system that is mathematically impossible to censor.

The Solution: A Remote Notary ArchiveChain acts like GitHub for the entire web:

  • Remote Capture: Our decentralized node launches an isolated browser to capture the page. Because the user never touches the raw HTML, the evidence cannot be faked.

  • Immutable Storage (Walrus): The Repo. Data is stored on Walrus nodes, which cannot be taken down by a central admin.

  • Cryptographic Proof (Sui): The Commit Log. We mint a frozen Sui Object linking the content hash and timestamp, creating an unbroken chain of custody.

Features

  • Visual Diff: We compare two versions of a website side-by-side. Red text highlights exactly what was censored; Green text exposes the spin.

  • AI Truth Analyst: Our integrated Grok AI reads the diff and issues a verdict: "High Impact Censorship (9/10): Critical allegations of toxic waste dumping were removed."

  • The Whistleblower Drop: A privacy-preserving mode using Hybrid Encryption. Whistleblowers can encrypt archives using a journalist's Public Key, turning Walrus into a secure, decentralized dead drop.

With ArchiveChain, the past is no longer up for debate. It is on-chain.

To know more details about the project, check HowItWorks, SystemArchitecture and Technical Implementation and Readme on Github.

DeTransfer: Decentralized, Trustless & Private File Transfer Network

DeTransfer is a fully trustless, privacy-preserving file transfer protocol that enables secure sharing of files without ever exposing data to centralized servers. Powered by Sui SEAL encryption, Walrus decentralized storage, and Sui on-chain registry, DeTransfer ensures end-to-end confidentiality, verifiable delivery, and zero-knowledge access permissions.

How It Works

1. Zero-Knowledge Encryption & Identity Binding

  • Files are encrypted locally using Sui SEAL, which binds the encryption to the receiver’s address as the identity.

  • No one - including DeTransfer can decrypt the file except the intended receiver.

  • Encryption keys are distributed across SEAL key servers using threshold cryptography.

2. Decentralized Storage on Walrus

  • Encrypted files are uploaded to Walrus, a decentralized blob storage network.

  • Storage is verifiable, censorship-resistant, and permanently addressable via a blob_id.

  • No plaintext ever touches a server or off-chain storage.

3. On-Chain Metadata & Access Control via Sui

  • Minimal metadata (sender, recipient, blob reference) is stored on Sui to create a tamper-proof transfer record.

  • Access control is enforced through a Seal allowlist smart contract, which validates decryption requests.

  • Only the recipient’s private key can authorize decryption, fully trustless and wallet-native.

4. Receiver-Side Decryption

  • The receiver retrieves the encrypted blob from Walrus.

  • The SEAL client requests key shares from decentralized key servers.

  • A threshold of servers approves based on on-chain access policy, reconstructs the decryption key, and returns it securely.

  • The file is decrypted locally on the user’s device.

What DeTransfer Enables

  • Anonymous, private, verifiable file transfers with no central intermediaries.

  • Cryptographically enforced access control - no admin, no server, no manual permissions.

  • End-to-end privacy where only sender and receiver ever see file contents.

  • Auditability without exposure - delivery, access, and proofs live on-chain without leaking data.

DeTransfer creates a new standard for secure, decentralized file sharing by combining zero-knowledge encryption, decentralized storage, and blockchain-verified access control, all without sacrificing usability or privacy.

Overview

CloakX is a privacy-preserving data compute marketplace — not just a traditional data marketplace. It enables users to contribute encrypted data while allowing AI contributors and researchers to run large-scale model training on this data inside secure execution environments, without ever exposing or transferring raw user data.

Instead of selling data, CloakX sells permissioned, privacy-safe computation. AI contributors gain access to rich, high-quality datasets through controlled compute pipelines executed inside the Nautilus Trusted Execution Environment (TEE), ensuring that sensitive information remains encrypted and inaccessible at all times.

Users are incentivized for contributing their encrypted data, creating a sustainable ecosystem where privacy, utility, and fair compensation coexist.

CloakX transforms private data into a secure, revenue-generating compute resource.

Core Vision

To create a global ecosystem where:

  • Data owners retain full sovereignty over their information

  • AI developers access verifiable, ethical, high-quality datasets

  • Privacy is guaranteed by design, not by policy

  • Compute happens where trust is mathematically and cryptographically enforced

CloakX aims to redefine how data is owned, shared, and commercialized in the age of AI.

Problem Statement

Today’s data economy is broken:

  • Users lose control over their personal data

  • Data is sold to third parties without informed consent

  • Centralized data lakes are frequent targets for breaches

  • AI companies struggle to access compliant, privacy-safe datasets

  • Data monetization is unfair and opaque

Existing solutions force a trade-off between privacy and utility. CloakX eliminates this trade-off entirely.

Solution

CloakX introduces a secure, decentralized infrastructure where:

  • Users upload encrypted data to Walrus decentralized storage

  • Metadata and permissions are managed via Sui smart contracts

  • Data is never decrypted outside secure TEE environments

  • AI buyers can run compute on private data without viewing it

  • Results are returned as encrypted AI models or insights

This ensures zero visibility of raw user data for any party other than the data owner.

How CloakX Works

1. Data Onboarding (User Side)

  • Users connect via wallet or secure identity system

  • Data is locally encrypted on the user’s device

  • Encrypted data is uploaded to Walrus

  • Hash references and access rules are registered on Sui blockchain

2. Data Pool Creation

  • Users opt into specific data pools (fitness, health, mobility, finance)

  • Each pool defines pricing, access rights, and consent parameters

  • Smart contracts manage participation and revenue splits

3. Buyer Request

  • AI companies or researchers submit a model training request

  • They define dataset criteria, type of output, and budget

  • Funds are escrowed via smart contracts

4. Secure Compute via TEE

  • Data is temporarily decrypted only inside CloakX-controlled TEEs

  • Model training occurs inside the enclave

  • No external system can inspect raw data or internal memory

5. Model Output Delivery

  • Final trained model or insights are encrypted using buyer’s public key

  • Output is stored on Walrus

  • Access is granted only to the verified buyer

6. Automated Settlement

  • Smart contracts automatically distribute payments

  • Users receive compensation proportional to data contribution

  • CloakX retains protocol fees

Architecture Stack

  • Frontend: Web + Mobile dashboards for users and buyers

  • Blockchain Layer: Sui Smart Contracts for access control & settlement

  • Storage Layer: Walrus for encrypted decentralized data storage

  • Compute Layer: Nautilus framework (AWS Nitro Enclave)

  • Identity Layer: Wallet-based authentication

  • Encryption: Client-side AES + public key infrastructure

Impact

CloakX enables a future where:

  • Data owners are empowered, not exploited

  • AI development is ethical and compliant

  • Privacy becomes a default standard

It converts privacy into a monetizable asset while ensuring trust, transparency, and security.

AI-Agent Driven Comic Publishing Protocol on Sui

 

Infinite Heroes is a decentralized application (dApp) built on the Sui Network that empowers users to become instant comic book creators.

 

By orchestrating AI Agents for generative storytelling and leveraging Walrus Storage for decentralized, high-capacity media hosting, Infinite Heroes solves the "Prosumer Paradox" in Web3 giving users ownership of high-quality media assets without the prohibitive costs of on-chain storage or manual production.

 

 

The platform transforms a simple user selfie into a stylized HeroAsset, which can then be inserted into infinite, AI-generated narratives. The final product is a ComicIssue—a Dynamic NFT (dNFT) that links verifiable ownership (Sui) with immutable, decentralized media hosting (Walrus).

 

The application provides a streamlined "No-Code" interface for creation:

 

Identity Tokenization (The Cast):

 

Upload: The user uploads a photo (selfie or avatar).

 

Minting: The platform mints a HeroAsset NFT on Sui. The high-resolution source image is stored on Walrus, while the Sui object retains the BlobID and identity metadata.

 

Narrative Selection:

 

Genre: Users select a narrative archetype (e.g., Cyberpunk Noir, High Fantasy, Space Opera).

 

Mode: Users toggle between "Action Mode" (visual focus) or "Novel Mode" (rich dialogue and plot depth).

 

Generation & Ownership:

 

The user clicks "Start Adventure".

 

The AI Agent Swarm generates the script, consistency maps, and final panels.

 

A ComicIssue NFT is delivered to the user's wallet, fully readable and tradable immediately via Sui Kiosk.

 

 

The Ledger: Sui Blockchain (Move)

 

Sui serves as the control plane for asset ownership, logic, and royalty enforcement.

 

Object-Based Ownership: Unlike account-based chains, Sui's object model allows us to create ComicIssue assets that act as distinct containers for data.

 

Dynamic Fields: We utilize dynamic fields to track evolving metadata, such as read_count, sequel_links (connecting issues), and community_votes.

 

Kiosk Implementation: All assets are minted directly into a Sui Kiosk. This forces all secondary market trades to adhere to our defined TransferPolicy, guaranteeing royalties for the original HeroAsset creator.

 

 

Content generation is handled by a coordinated swarm of specialized AI agents:

 

Script Agent (LLM): Handles world-building, dialogue generation, and "Novel Mode" narrative depth.

 

Visual Agent (Image Gen): utilizes the HeroAsset Walrus blob as a ControlNet reference to ensure the user's character remains consistent across different panels and poses.

Walrus Sentinel: The Decentralized Phishing Protection Layer

Walrus Sentinel is a browser extension that protects Web3 users from phishing attacks, malicious dApps, and wallet drainers by using immutable threat intelligence stored directly on Walrus Blobs.

THE PROBLEM:

Current security tools rely on centralized servers (like Google Safe Browsing). These are prone to:

1. Single Points of Failure (Servers can be hacked or go down).

2. Censorship (Valid dApps can be blocked).

3. Slow Updates (Phishing sites move faster than centralized databases).

THE SOLUTION:

We store the "Risk Database" on the Walrus Network.

- Unstoppable: The threat list is stored on Walrus Blobs, making it censorship-resistant.

- Real-Time: The extension intercepts malicious URLs instantly by checking the Walrus Blob ID.

- Transparent: Anyone can verify the risk list on-chain.

HOW IT WORKS:

1. The user visits a website.

2. The extension fetches the threat list from the Walrus Aggregator.

3. If a match is found, access is blocked instantly with a warning screen.

FUTURE VISION (Phase 2):

We are building an "Incentivized Security Marketplace".

White Hat Hackers will submit risk reports to Walrus and earn SUI tokens automatically via Smart Contracts. The prototype UI for this feature is already included.

ODX is a platform that turns fandom into an economy. Instead of just liking shows, characters, games, and stories online, ODX lets people own pieces of the IP they care about and earn rewards for their engagement.

Here’s the idea: every time someone rates an anime, posts a meme, makes a prediction, or contributes anything on the platform, ODX saves that activity in a way that proves who created it and when — and no one can delete or fake it. At the same time, ODX also pulls in real-world data from places like MyAnimeList, AniList, Reddit, and Instagram to understand what’s trending outside the platform.

All of this — the community’s engagement and the internet’s activity — gets combined to calculate the value of each IP token. When an IP becomes more popular or the community gets more active, its token reflects that. Users can trade these tokens, build portfolios, and earn rewards for being early supporters or making accurate predictions.

In short:
ODX lets fans turn their engagement into real value.
You interact with the content you love, the system tracks real popularity across the web, and token prices move based on actual fandom energy — not hype or guesswork.

It’s a blend of fandom, data, and crypto that transforms community passion into something you can own, trade, and earn from.

Built on sui, running on walrus and verified by nautilus !

What Makes ODX Different

Your engagement, your ownership

  • Every rating, prediction, and post is stored on Walrus (decentralized storage)

  • Cryptographically signed with your wallet

  • You own your data; the platform can’t manipulate or censor it

  • Your contributions are immutable and verifiable

Engagement drives value

  • IP tokens represent the popularity and engagement of anime/manga series

  • Token prices reflect real community engagement data

  • Early contributors earn rewards as IPs gain popularity

  • Accurate predictions earn bonus rewards

Trade what you know

  • Buy and sell IP tokens like stocks

  • Spot trading for direct token purchases

  • Perpetual futures with up to 100x leverage

  • Real-time price discovery based on engagement metrics


    How ODX Uses Walrus & Nautilus

    Walrus

    Our platform uses Walrus to:

    • Store all user contributions (ratings, memes, posts, predictions) with wallet signatures, which proves ownership and makes data immutable

    • Timestamp every contribution, which enables tracking who contributed first for early contributor rewards

    • Provide cryptographic proof of ownership, which prevents fake contributions and ensures fair reward distribution

    • Store data permanently and immutably, which allows users to verify their engagement history and claim rewards

    This helps:

    • Users own their data and can prove their contributions

    • The reward system verify early contributors and distribute bonuses fairly

    • Token prices reflect real, verifiable engagement data

    • Prevent gaming of the reward system with fake accounts

    Nautilus

    Our platform uses Nautilus to:

    • Fetch external fandom data from MyAnimeList, AniList, Reddit, Instagram, which provides market reality data

    • Cryptographically sign external data in a secure enclave, which ensures the data can't be tampered with

    • Verify external metrics on-chain, which prevents manipulation of token prices

    This helps:

    • Combine user engagement (Walrus) with external market data (Nautilus) for accurate pricing

    • Prevent price manipulation by using verified external truth sources

    • Token prices reflect both community sentiment and real-world popularity

    • Build trust through cryptographically verifiable external data

    Gamified Rewards Through Walrus

    Our platform uses Walrus to:

    • Track contribution timestamps, which determines early contributor status (first 100 get 2x rewards)

    • Store all user contributions permanently, which enables tracking engagement count for viral content bonuses (1000+ engagements = 3x rewards)

    • Record prediction data with timestamps, which enables accuracy tracking over time (>70% accuracy = 1.5x rewards)

    • Provide immutable proof of contributions, which ensures rewards are calculated fairly and can't be disputed

    This helps:

    • Users earn more tokens by posting early (early contributor bonus)

    • Users earn more tokens by creating viral content (viral content bonus)

    • Users earn more tokens by making accurate predictions (prediction accuracy bonus)

    • Users can stack multiple bonuses (early + accurate + viral = up to 9x rewards)

    • Create a competitive, gamified experience where engagement directly translates to rewards

Oracle Marketplace is a decentralized oracle data marketplace built on the Sui blockchain, designed to create a trustless, transparent, and efficient ecosystem where data providers can monetize their services and data consumers can access reliable, verifiable oracle data on demand.

At its core, the platform functions as a two-sided marketplace. Data providers—ranging from financial APIs to weather services or custom data aggregators—can create oracle services directly on-chain. Each service includes customizable parameters such as name, description, service type (e.g., price feeds, weather data, sports results, or custom compute), pricing per query (denominated in SUI), and a required collateral deposit (minimum 0.01 SUI) to ensure service reliability. Providers retain full control over their services, including the ability to activate, pause, or update configurations via decentralized storage.

On the consumer side, users can browse the marketplace, filter services by type or performance metrics, view real-time statistics (such as success rate, total queries, and uptime), and subscribe to services with a single transaction. Subscriptions grant 30 days of query access, and each query is processed on-chain under a pay-per-use model—users only pay when they actually request data. Query results are immutable, timestamped, and accompanied by verifiable evidence.

A key innovation is the integration with Walrus, Sui’s decentralized storage network. Every time a provider submits oracle data, supporting evidence (such as API responses or signed logs) is automatically uploaded to Walrus. The resulting content identifier (CID) is stored on-chain alongside the query result, enabling anyone to independently verify the origin, integrity, and authenticity of the data—without relying on centralized trust.

To streamline integration, Oracle Marketplace provides a full-featured TypeScript/JavaScript SDK. The SDK supports end-to-end workflows: creating query objects, uploading evidence to Walrus, building and signing Sui transactions, submitting results, and retrieving service or query information. Providers can also generate secure, revocable API keys to automate data submission from backend systems, with all keys managed through a dedicated dashboard and stored securely (hashed) in the backend.

The platform enforces a simple and fair economic model: a 3% fee is automatically deducted from each query payment and directed to a treasury module, while 97% goes directly to the data provider. All financial flows, subscriptions, and query executions are handled transparently via Sui smart contracts, ensuring censorship resistance and composability with other on-chain applications.

Security is reinforced through multiple layers: on-chain permission checks, collateral locking to penalize unreliable services, cryptographic verification of Walrus evidence, and strict API key authentication. Additionally, the backend API—exposed through RESTful endpoints—synchronizes on-chain state with off-chain indices for fast frontend rendering, while the frontend offers intuitive dashboards for service discovery, subscription management, and analytics.

Target use cases span DeFi (price feeds for lending or derivatives), parametric insurance (weather or event triggers), gaming (randomness or real-world inputs), prediction markets, and any smart contract requiring trusted external data. By combining Sui’s high-throughput, object-centric architecture with Walrus’s scalable storage, Oracle Marketplace delivers a scalable, cost-effective, and developer-friendly oracle solution.

In summary, Oracle Marketplace is not just an oracle aggregator—it’s a complete, decentralized infrastructure for data commerce on Sui. It empowers data providers to operate as independent oracle operators while giving developers and protocols seamless, verifiable access to real-world data, all within a transparent, on-chain economy.

Suitter is a decentralized social network built on the Sui blockchain that provides users with ownership of their data and content. Unlike traditional social platforms, Suitter offers censorship resistance, user sovereignty, and monetization opportunities through NFTs. Users can create posts (Suits), interact with content through likes and comments, discover and connect with other users, and start direct conversations - all while maintaining full ownership of their data and content.

Cypheron is a decentralized data marketplace built on the Sui blockchain, designed to prioritize user privacy and transactional efficiency.
