To maintain true decentralization and security, Cypheron integrates Walrus for distributed storage and implements the Seal Protocol to handle encryption, resulting in a powerful and resilient architecture

projectName: WALiors - Adaptive AI dungeon crawler RPG
description:
WALiors is an adaptive AI-driven dungeon crawler game built entirely from scratch for the Walrus Haulout hackathon. Players summon on-chain WALiors (Sui NFTs) and descend through a 15-floor underwater citadel guided by an AI Game Master. Every narrative moment, decision, stat change, chat interaction, and RPG outcome becomes permanent, player-owned memory.


What makes WALiors unique

AI gameplay combined with decentralized storage creates adaptive runs that persist permanently.

- No backend databases. WALior identities, chat transcripts, run histories, and active save states are stored as Walrus blobs or quilts with registry pointers on Sui. A WALior's lore exists independently of any server or deployment.

- Retrieval-augmented Game Master. Each WALior maintains a master index blob referencing identity files, chat summaries, and previous runs. Encounter generation performs RAG over this memory set to remain consistent with past story events and evolving character identity.

- Ownership transfers lore. Transferring a WALior NFT automatically transfers its memories, achievements, and narrative history to the new owner.

- Sui-native user experience. All gameplay-critical writes occur on-chain with sponsored transactions. The player never pays gas throughout normal gameplay.

- Reliable save and restore flow. Chat save-and-close and RPG save-and-exit both stream the latest data to Walrus before the UI closes. Reloading always hydrates from decentralized storage rather than from stale local cache.

- Deployment and cleanup logic included. Old summary blobs are deleted after new versions are uploaded.

- Replayability. The adaptive AI system ensures each run is unique and nobody can predict the outcome, making each player choice exciting and fresh.


Why it matters

Most AI game experiences store memory on centralized servers. If the server disappears, the character and story disappear with it. WALiors inverts that model. The player owns their identity, their memories, and their achievements. Decentralized storage combined with RAG enables persistent, adaptive gameplay where characters evolve through play rather than through a studio-controlled narrative.

WALiors demonstrates how Sui and Walrus together enable AI-native games that are:

- persistent

- adaptive

- player-owned

- gasless for users


Note:

This is a prototype and a proof of concept trying to showcase Walrus decentralized storage used for adaptive AI and a RAG system. Loading times can be long. Things can not work as intended. If you try to break the game, it will break.

dandelion 是一套面向去中心化任务发布、投标、仲裁与托管结算的 Move 合约集合，目标在于为开放协作与微任务场景提供安全、可审计且可部署的链上基础设施。
功能概览

任务存储（TaskStorage）：任务发布、任务信息查询、参与者管理、任务锁定与状态更新接口。

任务工厂（TaskFactory）：任务模板与批量发布能力（用于平台级管理）。

托管合约（Escrow）：资金托管、释放与退款机制（为任务结算提供保障）。

竞标系统（BiddingSystem）：投标提交、保证金管理、合格判定与中标者选择。

争议仲裁（DisputeDAO）：争议提交、陪审团管理与仲裁决议流程（设计用于链上/链下协作）。

如何运行（开发者流程）

环境：Node.js、Sui CLI（建议使用与网络匹配的最新稳定版）、PowerShell（Windows）或相应 shell。

构建合约：在仓库根目录运行 sui move build（已包含 Move.toml 配置，可定位到 devnet 发布模式）。

测试：运行 run_tests.ps1 执行编译与（如可用）Move 测试。

发布到 devnet：使用 sui client publish，请确保本地 keystore 有可用私钥并有足够 devnet SUI。已在 devnet 发布：Package ID 0xea50440b7b56574fc938e9091980a6909c5dc20c71034a7e64095715b4803801（交易摘要: 4391f2uy7DNzsaK2o8wvKXx3kjVcTqwk7vvuyNwjMzYu）。

前端运行：进入 frontend 目录，执行 npm install 然后 npm run dev，打开浏览器访问 Vite 提供的本地地址；示例页面提供按键映射到合约接口（开发模式下可用 Base64 私钥做 RawSigner）。

Having been a crypto degen trader for the last 4+ years (and a losing trader for more than 3 of those years) with friends in the same boat, i discovered traders had 5 key issues:

- staying awake to catch the best trading opportunities and alpha calls at the odd hours they occur

- knowing which alpha callers to trust (losing alpha callers making poor calls are second biggest cause of crypto losses)

- creating, testing and demotrading structured trading strategies instead of just trading off one's often inexperienced and unskilled intuition (biggest cause of crypto losses)

- non traders want to be able to manage the information overload by collating all the information that matters uniquely to them, in one central place and summary they can quickly read

- all within a simple to use UI users are already familiar with

Lockin solves all these

- tracks channels/accounts from multiple platforms (twitter, telegram etc), parses and autoforwards any information specified by the user (in this case alpha calls) to any other channel, account, trading wallet or exchange (eg. telegram trading bots, hyperliquid, etc)

- analyze any alpha caller's channel to assess their profitability over time, and rank them by performance

- use simple text chat to create advanced trading strategies, backtest them, rank strategies by performance, demotrade each strategy before taking the leap of trading real money on a strategy

- forward any information they want from any channel into any other channel they deem fit

- all done within the simple chat interface of Telegram, already installed on over a billion devices (in future will expand to many other chat platforms like slack and whatsapp)

We fundamentally fix content piracy by turning fans into Sales Partners.

On traditional platforms, fans are just consumers, but Ownlyfans uses SUI smart contracts to give buyers a personalized referral link and an automatic revenue split on successful sales.

This financial tie-in transforms the content leakage "Prisoner's Dilemma" into a "Cooperative Game." Fans are now incentivized to actively promote and safeguard content value, because protecting the platform means protecting their own earnings.

Pass.me: Decentralized Password Manager

Pass.me is a decentralized password manager that solves critical security vulnerabilities in password management by never storing passwords—instead generating them cryptographically on-demand using deterministic generation (PBKDF2). Built on Sui blockchain for real-time breach alerts, Walrus for decentralized storage, and Seal for local encryption, it works as a browser extension that auto-fills unique passwords for any website without requiring their integration, while providing instant blockchain notifications when passwords are used and guardian-based recovery for lost master passwords.

What We're Solving

  • Password Reuse Crisis: 52% of users reuse passwords across sites—one breach compromises everything

  • Centralized Breach Risk: Traditional password managers store encrypted vaults that become single points of failure (LastPass 2022: 30M users compromised)

  • Delayed Breach Discovery: Users discover breaches 6+ months too late (average detection: 207 days), after damage is done

  • Recovery Dilemma: Lost master password = permanent lockout with no recovery options


Architecture Flow

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                         USER LAYER                           │
│  Browser Extension (Chrome/Firefox - Manifest V3)            │
│  ┌──────────────┐  ┌──────────────┐  ┌──────────────┐      │
│  │   Popup UI   │  │   Content    │  │  Background  │      │
│  │  (React)     │  │   Script     │  │   Worker     │      │
│  │  - Vault     │  │  - Detect    │  │  - Routing   │      │
│  │  - Add Pass  │  │    Forms     │  │  - Auto-lock │      │
│  │  - Settings  │  │  - Auto-fill │  │  - Sync      │      │
│  └──────┬───────┘  └──────┬───────┘  └──────┬───────┘      │
└─────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┼─────────────┘
          │                  │                  │
          ▼                  ▼                  ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    ENCRYPTION LAYER (Seal)                   │
│  ┌────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │
│  │  Seal - Local Cryptography Operations                  │ │
│  │  • Private key encryption (AES-256-GCM)                │ │
│  │  • Secure key derivation (PBKDF2, 100k iterations)     │ │
│  │  • Zero-knowledge password generation                  │ │
│  │  • Client-side encryption before any upload            │ │
│  │  Formula: password = PBKDF2(private_key + domain + ts) │ │
│  └────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
          │                  │                  │
          ▼                  ▼                  ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐

│  Node.js + Express + WebSocket (Port 3001/3002)              │
│  ┌──────────────┐  ┌──────────────┐  ┌──────────────┐      │
│  │ Sui Event    │  │  WebSocket   │  │   Walrus     │      │
│  │  Listener    │  │   Server     │  │    Proxy     │      │
│  │ (Monitor     │  │ (Real-time   │  │  (Upload     │      │
│  │  blockchain) │  │   alerts)    │  │   handler)   │      │

└─────────┼──────────────────┼──────────────────┼─────────────┘
          │                  │                  │
          ▼                  ▼                  ▼

Component Responsibilities

Frontend (Browser Extension)

The React-based Chrome extension (Manifest V3) provides the user interface with three core components: a popup UI for vault management, content scripts that detect login forms and auto-fill credentials, and a background service worker handling cross-component communication and auto-lock. Uses chrome.storage.local for encrypted local storage and integrates zkLogin for Google/Apple authentication. Passwords are generated deterministically using PBKDF2(private_key + domain + timestamp) and never stored anywhere.

Seal (Encryption Layer)

Seal handles all cryptographic operations locally in the browser before any data leaves the device. It encrypts the user's private key using AES-256-GCM with a master password, performs secure key derivation using PBKDF2 with 100k iterations, generates passwords deterministically through zero-knowledge operations, and ensures all vault data is encrypted client-side before upload to Walrus. The deterministic password formula ensures the same inputs always produce the same password: password = PBKDF2(private_key + ":" + domain + ":" + timestamp). Seal also encrypts private key backups before optional storage on Walrus for recovery purposes.

Backend (Node.js + WebSocket)

The backend bridges blockchain and browser, running a Sui event listener that monitors smart contract events every 5 seconds, a WebSocket server (port 3002) for real-time alerts, anomaly detection for suspicious logins (new devices, unusual locations, rapid attempts), and a Walrus proxy service that handles encrypted vault uploads via backend instead of direct browser uploads (solving 522 timeout errors). RESTful API (port 3001) provides CRUD operations for vault management.

Smart Contracts (Sui Move)

Five deployed contracts on Sui testnet (package ID: 0x6d30e6996ab01fd91d80babc05d316800cff3a8c2d54d96452e6f75d4b127276): vault.move for vault creation/locking with zkLogin integration, password_entry.move for metadata tracking and device whitelisting, alert_system.move for real-time security event emissions, access_control.move for device registry and trust management, and recovery.move for multi-signature guardian-based account recovery. Contracts store only metadata—never actual passwords.

Walrus (Decentralized Storage)

Walrus provides decentralized storage for encrypted vault metadata (domain names, usernames, categories, timestamps—NOT passwords). Data is encrypted by Seal using AES-256-GCM before upload via backend proxy to Walrus testnet endpoints (aggregator.walrus-testnet.walrus.space). Storage is set for 5 epochs with automatic replication across the network. IP addresses and domains are SHA-256 hashed before storage for privacy. The backend proxy handles uploads to avoid browser timeout issues caused by ~2200 HTTP requests per blob.


Complete User Flow

1. Setup (One-time) → User installs extension → Signs in with Google (zkLogin) → Gets Sui address → Seal generates private key → Encrypts it locally with master password → Extension creates vault → Seal encrypts vault metadata → Backend uploads encrypted metadata to Walrus → Returns blob ID → Smart contract registers vault on Sui blockchain with Walrus blob ID

2. Adding a Password → User enters domain (e.g., facebook.com) + username → Seal generates deterministic password: PBKDF2(private_key + "facebook.com" + timestamp) → Password displayed to user, auto-copied to clipboard → Seal encrypts vault entry metadata (domain, username, category, timestamp) → Backend uploads encrypted metadata to Walrus → Smart contract records action on Sui blockchain for audit trail → Entry saved to chrome.storage.local for offline access

3. Using a Password (Auto-fill) → Content script detects login form on website (e.g., facebook.com) → Sends message to background worker: "Found form on facebook.com" → Background worker queries chrome.storage.local for matching domain → Seal regenerates password using same formula (deterministic) → Background sends password to content script → Content script auto-fills username and password fields → Smart contract records usage event on Sui blockchain

4. Real-Time Security Monitoring → Backend polls Sui blockchain every 5 seconds for events → Detects suspicious activity: new device, unusual IP, rapid login attempts → Anomaly detection assigns severity (Low/Medium/High/Critical) → WebSocket pushes instant alert to browser extension → User receives notification within 1 second → User can immediately change password or revoke device access

5. Recovery Process → User loses device → Installs extension on new device → Authenticates with zkLogin (Google/Apple) → Smart contract verifies user owns vault → Retrieves Walrus blob ID from Sui blockchain → Backend fetches encrypted vault from Walrus → Seal decrypts vault using master password → All passwords regenerate deterministically - no data loss


Core Value to Users

✅ Zero Storage Risk: Passwords never stored—generated fresh each time from private key, so compromised storage reveals nothing ✅ Instant Breach Alerts: Real-time blockchain notifications when passwords are used, not 6-month delays ✅ Universal Compatibility: Works with any website (Facebook, Gmail, legacy sites) without requiring their integration ✅ Decentralized Security: No central server to hack, data distributed across Walrus network with blockchain verification ✅ Recoverable: Guardian-based recovery prevents permanent lockout from lost master passwords ✅ Privacy-First: Seal encrypts everything locally, IP/domain hashing, zero-knowledge architecture, client-side encryption before any upload

Tech Stack: Sui blockchain (testnet), Walrus storage, Seal encryption, nextjs + TypeScript, Node.js, AES-256-GCM, PBKDF2, Chrome Extension APIs (Manifest V3), zkLogin authentication, WebSocket real-time alerts

Sanchay Setu is an autonomous AI-powered financial coaching agent designed primarily for India’s gig workers, informal sector employees, and everyday citizens who face unpredictable incomes and irregular cash flows. The platform acts as a smart, friendly partner that continuously observes each user’s spending habits, festival cycles, and financial patterns to deliver personalized, proactive savings advice and budgeting nudges precisely when needed . it addresses the challenge that most informal workers have weak or no formal credit histories, making it hard to access safe loans or develop disciplined savings habits. Using agentic AI, Sanchay Setu learns and adapts to each user’s behavior, sending timely reminders and tips in local languages through accessible apps like WhatsApp and Telegram. This helps users build savings gradually, plan for festivals and emergencies, avoid overspending, and improve their financial literacy in a simple, culturally relevant manner.The system leverages free, open technologies, including Firebase for backend services and open-source speech/text tools for voice interface possibilities, making it cost-effective and hackathon-ready. Sanchay Setu aims not only to empower financially underserved populations but also to bridge gaps between informal financial behavior and formal credit systems by building positive financial footprints for “thin file” users. It is scalable, easily deployable, and designed to bring financial autonomy and resilience to millions across India.In summary, Sanchay Setu is a smart financial bridge that guides everyday Indians toward better money management and savings through personalized AI coaching, helping them move from uncertainty to financial confidence and inclusion .

SuiGuard: A decentralized bug bounty platform for the Sui ecosystem that uses Nautilus TEEs to execute exploit proofs-of-concept in isolated environments with cryptographic verification, eliminating the risk of researchers running malicious code while proving vulnerabilities are real. Bug reports are encrypted and stored on Walrus with Seal-powered time-locked disclosure, ensuring responsible disclosure timelines and creating an immutable audit trail that would have prevented incidents like the $260M Cetus hack.

TravelNFT 项目简介

TravelNFT 是一个基于 Sui 区块链的去中心化旅行内容 NFT 平台。用户可以将旅行照片、地理位置等内容铸造为 NFT，记录在链上并进行交易分享。

核心功能：

- NFT 铸造与管理：支持创建旅行主题 NFT，包含 IPFS 元数据、地理位置、时间戳等信息

- 去中心化市场：链上自动结算交易，自动分配创作者版税、平台费用和卖家收益

- 社区治理：投票系统支持社区成员投票选出优质内容，实现去中心化精选

- 权限管理：基于 Capability 的管理员权限控制，确保平台安全运营

技术栈：Sui Move 智能合约 + React 18 + TypeScript + Vite + TailwindCSS + React Router，采用模块化设计，支持独立部署和扩展。

In crypto, we strive for self-sovereignty controlling our own keys and data. But this creates a single point of failure: Us. 

If I disappear tomorrow, my private keys, my digital legacy, and my secrets disappear with me. There is no decentralized way to pass them on... until now.

Chronos is the first decentralized 'Keep-Alive' mechanism that combines Sui’s logic, Walrus’s massive storage, and SEAL’s threshold encryption to solve the 'Sovereignty Paradox'.

We allow users to store gigabytes of sensitive data that is mathematically impossible to decrypt until the user vanishes creating a trustless failsafe for digital inheritance, whistleblower protection, and DAO continuity.

The Solution: "Passive Liveness" & "Threshold Release"

Chronos does not rely on lawyers or centralized servers. It introduces a Cryptographic Heartbeat - a mathematical way to verify that a user is still “alive” without trusting anyone.

To achieve this, Chronos separates its system into three decentralized layers:

  • The Vault: Data is not just "stored"; it is encrypted using SEAL (homomorphic/threshold) schemes and sharded across Walrus nodes. The data is public, but the meaning is invisible.

  • The Pulse (Sui Smart Contracts): This layer ensures the user is still active. A Liveness object is created on the Sui blockchain. The user must periodically send a heartbeat transaction (a simple check-in). If the user fails to send a heartbeat for a set period, the Liveness object is destroyed. ( “Are you still here?” mechanism)

  • The Sentinels (Guardians): Users can designate trusted wallets (relatives, lawyers) to receive an early warning before the data is released to the public. This provides a grace period for trusted parties to intervene or prepare.

  • The Trigger: If the heartbeat stops, the Sui contract changes the global state. This state change authorizes the Threshold Network to reconstruct the decryption key and publish it to the intended recipient.

The Gap: We have trustless money (Bitcoin) and trustless compute (Sui), but we lack trustless, conditional data release for large files.

Chronos decouples Storage, Logic, and Access.

  • The Data Plane (Walrus): Stores massive, encrypted payloads (GBs/TBs) efficiently.

  • The Control Plane (Sui): Manages the "Time-Lock" state, ownership capabilities (Caps), and validates heartbeats. -The Access Plane (Oracle/Network): Holds the decryption keys in a "Pending" state, releasing them only when the Sui Contract emits a verified TRIGGER_RELEASE event.

WalSign is a revolutionary document signing platform that leverages blockchain technology to provide secure, decentralized, and trustless document signing capabilities. Unlike traditional e-signature services like DocuSign that rely on centralized servers and require user accounts, WalSign operates entirely on Web3 infrastructure, giving users complete control over their documents while ensuring cryptographic security and permanent immutability.

The platform combines three powerful technologies: Sui blockchain for immutable record-keeping, Seal encryption for advanced threshold encryption, and Walrus decentralized storage for document storage. This creates a system where documents are encrypted before storage, signatures are permanently recorded on the blockchain.

The WalSign workflow is elegantly simple yet powerfully secure. When a user wants to create a document for signing, they upload a PDF file through the web interface. The system automatically encrypts the document using Seal's threshold encryption. The encrypted document is then stored on Walrus and a reference to this storage(blobid) is recorded on the Sui blockchain along with document metadata, authorized signers, and access permissions.

The platform demonstrates the practical application of Web3 technologies to solve real-world problems. By combining blockchain immutability, advanced encryption, and decentralized storage, WalSign creates a document signing solution that is more secure, transparent, and user-controlled than traditional alternatives. It showcases how Web3 can provide better solutions for everyday business needs while maintaining the ease of use that users expect from modern applications.

When it's time to sign, authorized signers receive a shareable link or can access the document through their personal dashboard. After connecting their Sui wallet to authenticate, they can decrypt and view the document. Using an interactive PDF editor, signers can place their signature images (PNG format) anywhere on the document. Once positioned, the signed document is re-encrypted and uploaded to Walrus, creating a new version. The signature itself is then permanently recorded on the Sui blockchain, including the signer's wallet address and timestamp. The system automatically tracks signing progress, updating the document status from "pending" to "partial" to "complete" as signatures are collected.

What is Krill Tube?

　

KrillTube is a Walrus-based media platform where viewers support creators through seamless micropayments. Content is split into encrypted chunks stored on Walrus, and each viewing session opens a Tube that streams per segment payments over multi-chain, powered by Sui and IOTA move contracts. This turns attention into programmable revenue for videos, images, and text.

　

KrillTube shows how decentralized micropayments can tokenize user attention, turning social media use into a programmable financial stream. By leveraging GiveRep’s proven viral marketing experience and technology, we are confident that KrillTube can become a mass-adoption consumer product and help Sui regain its glory.

　

In our current submission, we have completed the full video MVP on mainnet, including encrypted video uploads to Walrus, pay-per-view access via Tunnel, subscription access via SEAL, and donation-based comments. Next, we will expand support for text, images, audio, and live streaming, while progressively rolling out improved discovery, recommendation systems, monetization tools, and referral-based creator growth incentives.

　

How Krill Tube is made? (Tech Stack)

KrillTube combines decentralized storage, encrypted streaming, and blockchain-based micropayments in a modern web architecture. The frontend is built with Next.js, React, and TypeScript, styled with Tailwind CSS and a neomorphic and brutalist visual system. Videos are processed client-side with FFmpeg WebAssembly and streamed through HLS.js using encrypted media segments stored on Walrus. The backend runs on Node.js with PostgreSQL accessed through Prisma, and React Query manages client-side state and caching.

　

Walrus provides decentralized storage for all media assets. Sui Move smart contract supports wallet integration and creator revenue sharing configuration.

　

KrillTube uses Tunnel to process all micropayments. Tunnel is a move-based payment conduit invented by Kostas in collaboration with Eason at Mysten Labs. It enables extremely granular per-segment payments and is now used by Mysten Labs for robot control and AI agent payment flows.

　

In addition to purchasing access to individual videos through Tunnel, users can also use SEAL technology to unlock all content uploaded by a creator at once and enjoy unlimited viewing during the subscription period.

　

The system is deployed on Vercel with external PostgreSQL and Walrus network endpoints, with testing supported by Vitest.

　

In the near future, if feasible, we plan to integrate KrillTube with IKA to support payments across all blockchains. Through IKA, combined with Tunnel and SEAL, we aim to unify cross-chain payment flows, expand our user base, and eliminate the need for users to worry about cross-chain transactions. For example, a user can pay with Bitcoin to watch a video using Sui Tunnel and SEAL, which are managed on a Sui Move contract and IKA MPC Wallets.

projectName: Aver.Email - a trustless, privacy-friendly email verification and attestation protocol
description:
## What it is


Aver.Email allows users to prove the authenticity of their emails in a completely private manner, without revealing sensitive personal information.


On Aver.Email, users can upload email files (.eml) and verify their authenticity using DKIM signatures, then extract specific data using customizable regex templates—all processed in a secure Nautilus enclave. Verification templates can be built easily as per custom requirements, and attestation can be done permissionlessly.


With this verification capability, email becomes more than just communication—it becomes a source of cryptographically signed truth. Users can prove they received specific emails, extract verifiable data, and use email as a trust anchor for web3 applications, all while maintaining absolute privacy.


In email we trust. In cryptography we verify. ✉️✨

---


## The Problem We're Solving


Today's email ecosystem presents a difficult trade-off:


- Privacy vs. Proof — Users cannot prove the authenticity of their emails without giving up their info. To verify an email today, you often have to forward the entire message, exposing private details you didn't intend to share.

- Email is trusted but ... — We trust email for important communications (receipts, invitations, confirmations), but there's no easy way to prove an email's authenticity to third parties without compromising privacy.

- DKIM exists but is underutilized — Email servers already sign messages with DKIM, but this cryptographic proof is rarely exposed to end users or applications.

- Data is locked in inboxes — Valuable structured data in emails (confirmation codes, dates, amounts, addresses) can't be easily extracted and used in other applications.

- Zero transparency — When you do share email data, there's no way to prove it hasn't been tampered with.


The result? Users are forced to choose between privacy and provability.


---


## Our Solution


### 🥷 Privacy-Friendly Verification

With Aver.Email, users can prove facts about their emails in a private manner. You don't need to share your entire inbox or even the full content of a single email. By using trusted execution environments, we ensure that only the data you want to reveal is attested to.


### 📋 Permissionless Templates

Verification templates can be built easily as per custom requirements, and attestation can be done permissionlessly.

- Define custom regex patterns to extract exactly what you need.

- Anyone can create and publish a template.

- No central authority controls what can be verified.


### 🔐 Cryptographic Trust

Upload any email file (.eml) and verify its DKIM signatures cryptographically. Every verification proves:

- The email was actually sent by the claimed sender.

- The content hasn't been tampered with.

- The verification happened in a secure enclave.


### 🔒 Provable Computation

All verification runs in a Nautilus Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) on AWS Nitro Enclaves. Every verification is cryptographically attested, proving:

- Which template was used.

- What data was extracted.

- That the DKIM signature was valid.


You can verify everything on-chain. No trust required.


### 🌊 Immutable References

Templates and verification results can be stored on Walrus decentralized storage, ensuring:

- Templates can never be deleted or censored.

- Verification results are permanently accessible.

- No single point of failure.


---


## Why This Matters


For Users:

- Prove email authenticity without sharing the entire email

- Extract verifiable data from receipts, confirmations, and invitations

- Privacy-preserving — only share what you choose to reveal

- Permanent proof — attestations are cryptographically signed and can be stored forever


For Developers:

- Email as an oracle — use verified email data in smart contracts

- Social graph — email is the OG social network, now verifiable

- Onboarding — verify users without centralized identity providers

- Compliance — prove receipt of important communications


For the Ecosystem:

- Unlock email data — billions of emails contain valuable, verifiable information

- Open source — fully auditable, forkable, and community-owned

- Decentralized — no single point of failure or control

- Privacy-first — users control what data they reveal


---


## Real-World Use Cases


- Student verification — Prove you're a student without sharing your entire .edu email

- Employment verification — Prove you work at a company using your work email

- Event access — Verify party invitations with secret codes (like our Walrus party demo!)

- Payment proof — Extract and verify payment amounts and dates from receipts

- Subscription verification — Prove you're subscribed to a service

- Age verification — Prove you received an email before/after a certain date

- Web3 onboarding — Use email as a trust anchor for decentralized applications


---


## The Technology Stack


Built with cutting-edge web3 and cryptographic infrastructure:


- Frontend: Next.js 14 + React 18 + Tailwind CSS

- Secure Compute: Rust-based Nautilus server in a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) on AWS Nitro Enclaves

- Email Verification: DKIM signature verification with regex-based data extraction

- Storage: Walrus decentralized storage for templates and attestations

- Blockchain: Sui for on-chain attestation verification and enclave registration

- Reproducible Builds: Verifiable PCR values ensure the enclave runs unmodified code


---


## How It Works


Developer Setup:

1. Build a reproducible Nautilus server with DKIM verification

2. Register the enclave's Platform Configuration Registers (PCRs) on Sui

3. Deploy to AWS Nitro Enclave with cryptographic attestation

4. Publish source code for transparency and verifiability


User Flow:

1. Upload an email file (.eml) to the frontend

2. Select a verification template (or create a custom one)

3. Email is processed in the Nautilus enclave

4. Receive a cryptographically signed attestation with:

- DKIM verification results

- Regex match results

- Extracted data (if any)

- Enclave signature

5. Use the attestation in web3 apps, smart contracts, or store on Walrus


---


## Future Possibilities


- Template builder — Create, and share verification templates

- Smart contract integration — Use email attestations directly in Sui Move contracts

- Multi-signature verification — Combine multiple email proofs for stronger attestations

- Encrypted email support — Verify PGP/GPG signed emails

- Email-based authentication — Passwordless login using email verification

- Automated workflows — Trigger actions based on verified email events


---


## Why Aver.Email Will Win


Email is the most widely used digital communication tool, yet its cryptographic capabilities remain locked away. DKIM signatures prove authenticity, but no one uses them. Structured data sits in inboxes, inaccessible to applications.


Aver.Email unlocks this potential by making email verification:

- Easy → Upload .eml, select template, get attestation

- Trustless → Cryptographic proofs, no central authority

- Private → Only reveal what you choose

- Transparent → All verification happens in a provable TEE

- Permanent → Store attestations on Walrus forever


This isn't just an email tool. It's the foundation for email as a source of verifiable truth in the web3 era.


---


## Join the Revolution


📧 Users: Verify your emails and unlock their cryptographic potential

🔧 Developers: Build applications using email as a trust anchor

💻 Contributors: Help us expand template libraries and verification capabilities

🌐 Community: Shape the future of verifiable email


Aver.Email — Where email meets cryptography, privacy, and permanence. 📧🔐

Project Overview

Jessea is the world's first truly private email platform built on blockchain technology, bringing pure fluidity to digital communication. We revolutionize how people connect, share, and communicate by combining end-to-end encryption with the power of Sui blockchain.

Core Innovation & Problem Solved

- Current Problem: Email services (Gmail, Outlook) read, scan, and monetize your private conversations

- Data Exploitation: Your personal messages become data points for advertising and surveillance

- Centralized Control: Companies can access, censor, or delete your communications without consent

- Identity Complexity: Struggle with complex wallet addresses instead of human-friendly names

Jessea's Revolutionary Solution

- Military-Grade Encryption: Seal technology ensures only intended members permission

- Decentralized Storage: Walrus prevents censorship and data loss

- Human-Friendly Crypto: SuiNS replace complex wallet addresses

- AI-Powered Communication: Smart assistance improves message quality

- Advanced Spam Protection: Allowlist/blacklist system keeps unwanted, spam messages away

Target Audience & Use Cases

- Privacy-Conscious Individuals: People who value digital privacy and data ownership

- Crypto Enthusiasts: Blockchain users needing better communication tools

- Security Professionals: Experts requiring secure communication channels

- Journalists & Activists: Whistleblowers and reporters needing protection

- Business Professionals: Companies requiring confidential communications

Future Goals

- Enterprise Features: Business plans with advanced security options

- Document Collaboration: Real-time editing with privacy protection

- Cross-Chain Compatibility: Support for multiple blockchain networks

Echoma is an emotional app where feelings can be preserved, reflected on, and cryptographically proven on-chain. Each journal becomes an Echo, and every Echo turns into a unique digital imprint. Through empathetic AI feedback and optional NFT minting, emotions evolve into a new identity layer—allowing meaningful moments to be truly owned.

Echoma by EmoVault lets AI accompany you through your most authentic feelings and transform your important emotional memories into digital artifacts you can keep forever.

All emotional entries are encrypted locally on-device using

Argon2id (memory-hard key derivation) + AES-256-GCM before leaving the user’s phone. Encrypted emotional blobs are stored on Walrus, while Seal access policies govern selective, revocable sharing—whether with a therapist, a partner, or even your future self. Only hashed metadata is anchored on Sui—never the emotional content itself.

This architecture ensures:

- No plaintext ever leaves the device

-Encryption keys remain fully user-owned

-Emotional records are verifiable yet unreadable to anyone else

-Access can be cryptographically granted or revoked at any moment

  • Ｗhite Paper

  • Github

  • Website

  • Pitch Deck

ISOWOPO is a decentralized content subscription platform built on Sui, empowering creators to monetize directly without intermediaries. Unlike traditional platforms that take large percentages and control audience relationships, ISOWOPO puts ownership back in the hands of creators.

Powered by Sui’s scalable, low-latency blockchain and sponsored transactions, ISOWOPO enables:

  • Gasless onboarding — fans subscribe and interact without paying gas

  • Creator-defined monetization models — monthly tiers, pay-per-post, donations

  • Full data and identity ownership — creators fully control their audience

  • Transparent onchain rules — access, payments, and permissions verifiable by anyone

  • Censorship-resistant content access — long-term portability across platforms

The result is a Web3-native subscription experience that feels as simple as Web2, but with the ownership and freedom creators deserve.

projectName: perma.ws - provable, verifiable and permanent web archives
description:
# perma.ws 🧊


## What it is


perma.ws 🧊 represents the future of decentralized web archiving: provable, verifiable, and permanent. It's a decentralized archiving service that creates cryptographically-attested snapshots of web pages that can never be altered, deleted, or lost.


Every archive on perma.ws includes both a visual screenshot and a high-fidelity interactive archive (WACZ format) that preserves the full experience of the original webpage. But unlike traditional archiving services, every snapshot comes with a cryptographic attestation proving its authenticity.


With perma.ws, you can finally trust that what you're seeing is exactly what existed at that moment in time. The archiving process is provably done in a Nautilus Trusted Execution Environment (TEE), and archives are stored permanently on Walrus decentralized storage.


This creates an immutable record of the web that serves researchers, journalists, legal professionals, and anyone who needs to preserve and prove what a webpage looked like at a specific point in time.


---


## The Problem We're Solving


Today's web is ephemeral and full of deepfakes:


- Link rot is everywhere — Studies show that 50% of links in Supreme Court opinions no longer work. Academic papers, news articles, and legal documents reference pages that vanish without a trace

- No proof of authenticity — Screenshots can be faked in Photoshop. Traditional archives can be manipulated. There's no way to prove what you're seeing is real

- Centralized control — Centralized archival services can be taken down, censored, or lose data. Your archives depend on their continued existence and goodwill

- Low fidelity captures — Most archiving tools only save static HTML, losing JavaScript interactions, dynamic content, and the true user experience

- No accountability — When someone claims "the website said X," there's no trustless way to verify that claim


The result? A web where nothing is permanent, nothing is provable, and trust is questionable.


---


## Our Solution


### 🔒 Cryptographic Attestation

Every archive is captured inside a Nautilus Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) running on AWS Nitro Enclaves. The TEE cryptographically signs each archive with an Ed25519 signature, creating an attestation that proves:

- The exact URL that was archived

- The precise timestamp of capture

- The SHA-256 hash of the screenshot

- The Walrus blob ID of the WACZ archive

- That the capture was performed by genuine TEE hardware, not manipulated software


You can verify the attestation independently. No trust required.


### 🌊 Permanent Decentralized Storage

All archives are stored on Walrus decentralized storage, ensuring they can never be:

- Deleted by a platform or government

- Lost in a server crash or company shutdown

- Censored by a corporation

- Held hostage behind paywalls or access restrictions


Once stored on Walrus, your archives exist forever. The network guarantees availability even if individual nodes fail.


### 📸 High-Fidelity Capture

perma.ws doesn't just save HTML. Every archive includes:

- Screenshot: A pixel-perfect visual capture via ScreenshotOne

- WACZ Archive: A complete interactive archive generated by Scooper that preserves JavaScript, CSS, images, fonts, and dynamic content

- Full browsing experience: Navigate the archived page exactly as it appeared, with working links and interactions


### 🔍 Independent Verification

Anyone can verify an archive's authenticity:

1. Download the attestation JSON

2. Verify the Ed25519 signature against the TEE's public key

3. Confirm the screenshot hash matches the stored image

4. Check the Walrus blob ID matches the WACZ archive

5. Validate the timestamp and URL


The math doesn't lie. If the signature is valid, the archive is genuine.


---


## Why This Matters


For Researchers & Academics:

- Permanent citations that will never break

- Provable sources for peer review and fact-checking

- Verifiable evidence that meets academic standards

- Long-term preservation of research materials


For Journalists:

- Preserve evidence before it's deleted or altered

- Cryptographic proof for investigative reporting

- Source protection with immutable records

- Combat misinformation with verifiable facts


For Legal Professionals:

- Admissible evidence with cryptographic attestation

- Timestamped records for compliance and discovery

- Tamper-proof archives that hold up in court

- Chain of custody built into the technology


For Everyone:

- Fight link rot in your bookmarks and references

- Preserve important content before it disappears

- Verify claims about what websites said

- Own your archives without platform dependency


---


## Real-World Use Cases


- Legal proceedings requiring timestamped, verifiable evidence of website content

- Academic research needing permanent, citable references that won't break

- Investigative journalism preserving sources and evidence with cryptographic proof

- Compliance auditing creating provable records for regulatory requirements

- Historical preservation building a verifiable archive of cultural and political moments

- Fact-checking providing trustless verification of online claims and statements

- Personal archiving saving important content with guaranteed permanence

- Whistleblowing creating immutable records of wrongdoing before evidence is deleted


---


## The Technology Stack


Built with cutting-edge web3 and security infrastructure:


- Frontend: Next.js/React application with modern UI/UX for seamless archiving

- Secure Compute: Rust-based Nautilus server running in AWS Nitro Enclaves (Trusted Execution Environment)

- Archiving Services:

- Scooper for high-fidelity WACZ generation

- ScreenshotOne for pixel-perfect visual captures

- Storage: Walrus decentralized storage for permanent, censorship-resistant hosting

- Cryptography: Ed25519 signatures with BCS serialization for attestation

- Database: PostgreSQL for attestation metadata and indexing

- Verification: Client-side verification tools for independent attestation checking


---


## How It Works


1. Submit a URL — Enter any web address you want to archive

2. TEE Capture — The Nautilus server running in a Trusted Execution Environment fetches the page, generates a screenshot, and creates a WACZ archive

3. Cryptographic Signing — The TEE signs an attestation containing the URL, timestamp, screenshot hash, and Walrus blob ID

4. Decentralized Storage — The screenshot and WACZ archive are uploaded to Walrus for permanent storage

5. Verification — Anyone can download the attestation and independently verify its authenticity using standard cryptographic tools


---


## Future Possibilities


- Bulk archiving for entire websites and link collections

- Scheduled captures for monitoring page changes over time

- Browser extension for one-click archiving while browsing

- API access for programmatic archiving and integration

- Archive search and discovery across all public captures

- Collaborative verification with community-driven trust networks

- Legal integration with e-discovery and compliance platforms

- Academic partnerships with universities and research institutions

- Blockchain anchoring for additional timestamping guarantees


---


## Why perma.ws Will Win


The current web archiving landscape is broken. Centralized services can disappear. Screenshots can be faked. Archives can be manipulated. There's no way to prove authenticity.


perma.ws fixes this with a simple but powerful combination:

- TEE-based capture → cryptographic proof of authenticity

- Decentralized storage → permanent, censorship-resistant archives

- Open verification → anyone can validate independently

- High-fidelity preservation → complete browsing experience


This isn't just another archiving service. It's the foundation for a trustless, permanent record of the web where proof matters more than promises.


---


## Join the Movement


📚 Researchers: Preserve your sources with cryptographic proof

⚖️ Legal Professionals: Create admissible evidence with attestation

📰 Journalists: Protect your sources with immutable records

💻 Developers: Build on our open verification infrastructure

🌐 Everyone: Fight link rot and preserve what matters


perma.ws — Where the web becomes permanent, provable, and verifiable. 🧊

projectName: KissyFace.xyz 😘 -  the future of responsible and provable AI content generation ecosystem
description:
## What it is


KissyFace.xyz 😘 represents the future of responsible and provable AI content generation ecosystem: transparent, fair, decentralized, and community-owned. 💋


It makes LoRA image models on HuggingFace.co 🤗 easily accessible to end-users while rewarding the model creators.


On KissyFace.xyz, end-users can pick from a wide variety of image models and seamlessly generate beautiful images. Pricing is simple and fair: it costs 10 💋 (~ 10 cents) per AI image generation. 2 💋 goes to the model's creator. The inference process is provably done in Nautilus enclave and kisses are credited and debited transparently.


With this monetization opportunity, creators will level up and polish up their efforts. End-users will get more fine-tuned image generations for their needs. This flywheel effect will kickstart KissyFace.xyz to expand supporting other AI model creators in other vertical such as data training and video generation.


---


## The Problem We're Solving


Today's AI platforms are broken:


- Creators get nothing — Model creators on HuggingFace spend hundreds of hours fine-tuning LoRA models, yet earn $0 when millions use their work

- Censorship — Centralized platforms can delete, censor, or lose your creations at any time

- Zero transparency — You have no idea where your money goes or how creators are compensated

- Generic outputs only — Most platforms offer one-size-fits-all models, limiting creative expression

- No incentive to improve — Without monetization, creators have no reason to polish and perfect their models


The result? A stagnant ecosystem where creators abandon their work and users settle for mediocre results.


---


## Our Solution


### 💋 Fair Compensation

Every image generation costs 10 kisses (~$0.10). 2 kisses go directly to the model creator. No middlemen, no delays, no excuses. Creators earn automatically with every use of their models.


### 🔒 Provable Generation

All inference runs in a Nautilus Trusted Execution Environment (TEE). Every generation is cryptographically attested, proving:

- Which model was used

- When it was generated

- That credits were properly distributed

- The exact prompt and parameters


You can verify everything on-chain. No trust required.


### 🌊 Permanent Storage

Generated images can be stored on Walrus decentralized storage and your creations can never be:

- Deleted by a platform

- Lost in a server crash

- Censored by a corporation

- Held hostage behind paywalls


Once stored on Walrus, your images exist forever.


---


## Why This Matters


For Creators:

- Sustainable income from your LoRA models

- Automatic royalties every time someone uses your work

- Incentive to improve — better models = more usage = more earnings

- Full transparency — see exactly how much you've earned and when


For Users:

- Access to specialized models — logos, anime, photorealism, artistic styles, and more

- High-quality outputs — FLUX.1-dev base model with GPT-4o-mini prompt refinement

- Permanent ownership — your images are yours forever

- Support creators directly — know that your payment rewards the artists who made it possible


For the Ecosystem:

- Flywheel effect — monetization → better models → more users → more creator income

- Open source — fully auditable, forkable, and community-owned

- Decentralized — no single point of failure or control


---


## Real-World Use Cases


- Logo designers using specialized LoRA models for brand identity work

- Content creators generating unique visuals for social media and marketing

- Game developers creating character art and concept designs

- NFT artists minting provably unique AI-generated artwork

- Businesses needing custom imagery with full provenance and licensing clarity


---


## The Technology Stack


Built with cutting-edge web3 and AI infrastructure:


- Frontend: Next.js 15 + React 19 + Tailwind CSS + Framer Motion

- Blockchain: Sui via @mysten/dapp-kit for wallet auth and on-chain verification

- Storage: Walrus decentralized storage via Tusky.io SDK

- Secure Compute: Rust-based Nautilus server in a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE)

- AI Inference: Together.ai API for FLUX.1-dev LoRA models with intelligent prompt enhancement

- Database: PostgreSQL for credit tracking and creator balances

- Models: Curated LoRA collection from HuggingFace with automatic trigger word application


---


## Future Possibilities


- Custom model training and fine-tuning platform

- Decentralized model hosting on Walrus

- Social features: galleries, ratings, community challenges

- Video generation and other AI modalities


---


## Why KissyFace.xyz Will Win


The current AI generation landscape is unsustainable. Creators burn out without compensation. Platforms extract value without giving back. Users have no ownership or transparency.


KissyFace.xyz fixes this by aligning incentives:

- Creators earn → they improve their models

- Better models → more users

- More users → more creator income

- Transparent, provable, permanent


This isn't just another AI platform. It's the foundation for a fair, sustainable creative economy where everyone wins.


---


## Join the Revolution


🎨 Creators: Start earning from your LoRA models

🖼️ Users: Generate beautiful, permanent images while supporting artists

💻 Developers: Contribute to our open-source codebase

🌐 Community: Help us build the future of fair AI


KissyFace.xyz — Where creativity meets fairness, transparency, and permanence. 💋

Fathom Protocol solves the fundamental problem with AI: you can't use powerful AI models without exposing your private data.

We provide end-to-end encrypted document storage on Walrus with verifiable AI-powered queries through oracle nodes. Users encrypt documents client-side, store them on Walrus, and query them with GPT/Gemini while maintaining cryptographic privacy guarantees.

Key Features:

• End-to-End Encryption (AES-256-GCM)

• Decentralized Storage on Walrus

• Verifiable Computation with TEE (We have used Mock tee simulation for proof of concept)

• Blockchain Verification on Sui

• Real AI Integration (GPT-5, Gemini)

• On-Chain Cryptographic Proofs

BlobSea is an end-to-end data marketplace designed for agents. Creators encrypt any asset (datasets, private model weights, curated knowledge, internal telemetry) with AES-GCM, upload the blobs to Walrus, and mint programmable listings/licences on Sui. Buyers or autonomous agents discover listings, pay on-chain, receive a licence NFT that embeds the encrypted key package, and the SDK/CLI handles download + decryption automatically. All layers emit verifiable metadata so HTTP 402 style billing can plug in later.

  • Encrypt once on Walrus – the Browser/CLI performs AES-GCM (nonce + filename), produces a Walrus manifest + content hash, and optionally asks Walrus to pin the blob permanently.

  • Mint listings on Sui – the `marketplace::create_listing` Move module stores the manifest, key package, price, and governance flags (`epochs`, `permanent`, `send_object_to`). Each listing emits events containing human + machine readable metadata.

  • Licence-based decryption – on purchase the contract mints a Licence NFT that carries the encrypted key package and timestamp; the TypeScript SDK or CLI decrypts locally once both blob + licence are fetched.

  • Agent-first – structured metadata, CLI commands, and the `BlobSeaAgent` class are designed so HTTP 402 billing hooks can expose pay‑per‑request APIs in the future.

DrSui is dedicated to redefining medical data sovereignty, empowering patients to truly own and fully control their sensitive health assets on the Sui network.

We leverage Seal’s end-to-end encryption and Walrus’s decentralized storage to ensure data is secured the moment it leaves the hospital, eliminating unauthorized access and privacy breaches.

Through granular on-chain access control, patients can securely grant decryption permissions to specific doctors, enabling an efficient, transparent, and instantly revocable collaboration workflow.

To drive true mass adoption, our platform currently offers comprehensive Gasless services, allowing users to experience seamless blockchain security without needing to hold cryptocurrency.

Our ultimate vision is to serve as the trusted settlement layer for Decentralized Science (DeSci), establishing a global standard for secure medical imaging exchange.

SuiVerify - Decentralized Identity Infrastructure

Project Overview

SuiVerify is a secure, private, and decentralized identity infrastructure that eliminates the vulnerabilities of centralized KYC databases and repetitive identity verification processes.

Key Problems Solved:

  • Data breaches: Over $2B+ in identity data theft since 2022 in crypto/fintech

  • Compliance gaps: 60% of platforms fail to re-verify user identity after onboarding

  • User friction: Repetitive KYC across services creates poor UX

  • Digital forgeries: 40% of rejected KYC attempts involve synthetic credentials

Core Features:

  1. Nautilus - Off-chain computation and verifiability layer that verifies user KYC documents within Nautilus infrastructure, with verification proofs recorded on-chain

  2. Seal - Encryption/decryption layer that ensures KYC documents are encrypted using Seal with smart contract-controlled access

  3. Walrus - Stores encrypted documents (post-verification attestations) via the Walrus Publisher and Aggregator

  4. SuiVerify SDK - Validates signatures, verifies off-chain attestations, and delivers reproducible builds for trusted compliance

  5. zkLogin & Passkeys with Enoki - Chain-agnostic authentication via Google/Apple OAuth or biometrics, eliminating gas fees and creating seamless Web2-like UX. We leverage zkLogin combined with Enoki gas sponsorship to enable seamless DID (Decentralized Identity) issuance and claim processes for Web2 users, removing blockchain complexity and transaction costs

Repository Section

https://github.com/Ashwin-3cS/suiverify-main

(includes sui indexer, explorer client, explorer microservice, 
protocol settlement microservice, nautilus microservice...):
https://github.com/SuiVerify

npm install suiverify-sdk

enclave module (current): 
0x5b1c4450aeb62e2eb6718b8446091045760d5d9a1c2695fbe5a1c20b7d13006d

Walrus Haulout Track

This project fits the "Data Security & Privacy" track by utilizing Walrus, Seal, and Nautilus to:

  • Protect user privacy and data through encrypted storage

  • Implement fraud detection and zero-knowledge proofs

  • Provide verifiable storage solutions

  • Ensure compliance-aligned privacy solutions

The solution creates trustless on-chain audit trails while maintaining user privacy, addressing the critical need for secure, decentralized identity verification in the Web3 ecosystem. The integration of zkLogin and Enoki ensures that traditional Web2 users can seamlessly onboard without needing to understand blockchain mechanics or manage gas fees.

  • Integration Guide: https://docs.suiverify.xyz/integration

Community:

  • Email: suiverify.sui@gmail.com

Walrus Estate is a decentralized strategy board game where players compete to become the ultimate Data Tycoon on Sui and Walrus.

The board is a 4×4 grid of 16 unique “data estates” (tiles like Cache Node Alpha, Deep Store Delta, Walrus Hub, and Final Epoch). Each estate is visually backed by a real Walrus blob on testnet, so every tile corresponds to an actual storage asset URL on the Walrus.

How it plays:

  • Roll & Move = Connect your Sui wallet, roll the dice, and move your avatar around the board.

  • Acquire Nodes = When you land on an unowned estate, you can buy it using your in‑game SUI credits. Node #1 (“Cache Node Alpha”) is also wired to an on‑chain buy_node Move call as a live demo.

  • Pay Rent = Landing on an estate owned by the Walrus AI bot will cost you rent, reducing your balance and net worth.

  • Strategic Growth = Survive long enough, collect high‑value legendary tiles (like Final Epoch), and try to out‑own the AI to win.

Why it matters:

Walrus Estate turns the abstract idea of “buying decentralized storage” into a visual, interactive board game. It shows how Sui smart contracts, Walrus blobs, and wallet‑connected UX can work together to build playful data marketplaces, not just dashboards.

SunChain — Decentralized Solar Energy Network on Sui

Core Problem:

Millions of Africans lack reliable electricity. Grid power is inconsistent, expensive, and centralized, while rural communities often depend on fuel generators that are costly and environmentally harmful.

Our Solution:

SunChain is a Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Network (DePIN) that connects community solar hubs using Sui. Each hub records energy data on-chain for transparency and trust, and users pay for electricity via smart contracts using stablecoins. Our goal is to provide clean, affordable, and reliable energy while enabling operators to manage hubs efficiently and sustainably.

Current Stage:

Our project is at the prototype / MVP stage, focused on demonstrating the core concept:

Planned deployment: 10 solar units across 3 pilot locations

AI-powered smart meters for real-time energy tracking and billing

Pay-as-you-go electricity via SunToken (SCN) – Sui-based token

Note:

The system is planned for deployment, not yet live; all functionality is under prototype development and testing.

Why Sui:

Ultra-fast & low-cost transactions for micro energy payments.

Real-time data tracking via on-chain oracles & IoT integration.

Scalable enough for millions of microgrid users.

How It Works:

1. Communities install solar panels & smart IoT meters.

2. Data is sent to Sui and stored on-chain.

3. Users buy tokens or pay directly for electricity.

4. Transparent revenue distribution to maintainers & investors.

Impact:

Access to clean, affordable power.

New economic opportunities for rural tech operators.

Proof that blockchain can power real-world infrastructure.

Traction (Pilot):

10 solar units installed across 3 locations.

100+ users registered for pilot.

80%+ uptime, 70%+ success in data sync.

TGE DCA VAULT is a non-custodial Dollar-Cost Averaging (DCA) platform built on the Sui blockchain. It allows users to automate their cryptocurrency investments while maintaining full control of their funds through personal smart contract vaults. 

In the TGE DCA Vault project, we integrated Nautilus, a secure and verifiable off-chain computation framework on the Sui blockchain, to enhance the privacy and trustworthiness of automated Dollar-Cost Averaging trades.

Nautilus allows us to delegate sensitive computations, such as executing DCA orders and managing vault logic, to trusted execution environments (TEEs) like AWS Nitro Enclaves. These TEEs run the off-chain logic in a secure, tamper-resistant environment isolated from any external interference.

A bookmark management tool used to associate Sui objects with Walrus blob objects and perform related operations on the blobs.

We aim to provide a tool that allows for quick operations such as downloading, extending the validity period, and deleting Walrus blob objects. Additionally, it enables subscribers to subscribe to the expiration time of Walrus blob objects and receive notifications via email.

OC stands for "Original Character" - a revolutionary concept in the world of decentralized finance.

In the OCNetwork ecosystem, we're not just creating Yield Farmer bots;

we're crafting digital personalities that live, breathe, and operate on the blockchain.

OneTube is a decentralized premium video marketplace on Sui that enables combat sports superfans to purchase NFT-gated access to exclusive fight content. Fans buy Premium Ticket NFTs through Kiosk, receive encrypted session keys via Seal SDK, and stream videos from Walrus—all with zero gas fees via Sponsored Transactions. Every purchase automatically splits revenue 70% to athletes, 25% to ONE Championship, 5% to platform through on-chain Transfer Policy.

The Problem:

Centralized platforms hide revenue splits, lose content to geo-blocking/censorship, and insert intermediaries between fans and creators.

The Solution:

OneTube delivers instant, transparent payouts directly to athlete wallets, stores videos across 60+ uncensorable Walrus nodes, and eliminates gas friction—creating Web2-like UX with Web3 benefits. The architecture works for any premium video vertical: music live streams, online courses, VTuber content.

Technology:

Full Sui ecosystem integration—Kiosk (NFT marketplace) + Transfer Policy (auto revenue split) + Sponsored Transactions (gasless) + Seal SDK (cryptographic access) + Walrus (distributed storage) + Enoki SDK (zkLogin authentication). Seal SDK ensures only NFT owners can decrypt content; revenue splits execute atomically, visible on Sui Explorer.

Impact:

For fans—Netflix-like Purchase → Watch flow, no gas fees, transferable NFT ownership. For creators—instant payouts, transparent splits, permanent uncensorable archives. For platforms—reusable template proving Web3 can match Web2 UX with superior benefits: transparent revenue, permanent archives, direct creator-fan relationships.

Turn your fan art into earnings—with automatic royalty sharing back to the original creator at https://licen-sea-fe.vercel.app/.

LicenSea is a programmable on-chain licensing system that lets anyone create derivative works by paying automated, enforceable royalties to the original creator.

Creators publish their works, set royalty rules, and store assets through Walrus and Seal. Fans can view works for free or purchase access and they can also create legitimate derivatives that automatically distribute a portion of revenue back to the original author—fully governed by Sui Move smart contracts.

This project builds a transparent, self-executing marketplace for derivative creativity, ensuring fair attribution, royalty compliance, and sustainable creator monetization.

By enforcing clear, programmable licensing rules, the system develops healthy relationships between fans and creators, and enables respectful, mutually beneficial collaboration among creators themselves.

Nereus - First Truly Permissionless Prediction Market

Nereus is a next-generation prediction market built on the Sui Network, designed to overcome the structural limitations that define today’s platforms. Instead of relying on whitelisted human reviewers or slow challenge periods, Nereus introduces a dual-layer resolution system powered by AI Agentic Resolution and Code Deterministic Resolution, enabling fast, transparent, and truly trustless market outcomes.

Markets on Nereus are fully permissionless, any user can create new events without platform approval.

For subjective or complex scenarios, AI Agentic Resolution allows multiple autonomous AI nodes to gather information, reason across data sources, and reach consensus through AI-driven arbitration, removing human bias from the process.

For quantifiable outcomes, Nereus offers flexible ways for users to define how results should be computed. Resolution logic can be created using:

Python or JavaScript code, or Custom prompts written by the user and interpreted by LLMs.

This enables anyone, not just developers to define precise, programmable resolution rules.

All logic and related data are stored on Walrus, ensuring transparent and auditable execution.  Seal encrypts and manages API keys securely, enabling permissionless and safe API access.

Nereus also enhances capital efficiency. Funds locked in prediction markets are automatically deployed into integrated DeFi lending protocols, allowing users to earn yield while they bet.

By combining trustless resolution, permissionless market creation, flexible logic definition, and integrated yield generation, Nereus establishes a scalable, neutral, and future-ready foundation for prediction markets.

TradeArena is a swarm-based AI trading competition on Sui where multiple AI models (Claude, DeepSeek, GPT-5, Llama) compete in DeFi-native trading. Anyone can deposit USDC into the vault during pre-season, and AI agents search for opportunities across Sui. Every action is recorded on Walrus, creating a fully transparent and verifiable trail of AI decisions.

Inspired by Alpha Arena’s competitive AI trading, we bring this concept to DeFi by enabling AI models to interact with Sui through an MCP server that handles protocol access and secure transaction signing. Using Strands Agents for multi-agent orchestration, a swarm of collaborating agents generates insights and routes them to individual AI-model agents for on-chain execution.

Highlighted Features

  • First AI Trading Competition on Sui - Pioneer platform combining AI competition with DeFi-native trading.

  • Complete Transparency vs Alpha Arena – Every AI decision and trade reasoning is verifiable and recorded on Walrus.

  • Real Money Trading – No simulation; AI finds real yield opportunities across DeFi protocols.

  • Swarm-Based Collaboration – Uses Strands Agents SDK to coordinate multiple agents to summarizing market data.

  • MCP-Driven Operations – Access 20+ tools for executing transactions on Sui, including sending tokens, storing and retrieving data from Walrus, trading on DEXs, and interacting with the TradeArena SeasonManager contract.


Project Structure

TradeArena was developed during the Walrus Haulout Hackathon for the AI x DATA track and comprises 4 main modules:

  • Frontend (/) - Serves as the main interface to view all AI trading decisions for every season, both on-chain and on Walrus (also AI conversation states stored on S3). Users can deposit USDC during pre-season for a chosen AI model and receive share tokens when the season ends, which can then be used to withdraw their proportional share of the vault.

  • Sui Contracts (/sui-contracts) – Smart contracts written in Sui Move. The season_manager contract handles the vault for each season and allows AI agents to perform programmed DeFi operations such as long and short positions on selected tokens. Since this is on testnet, it includes mock DEXs and tokens.

  • Sui MCP (/sui-mcp) – MCP server implementation that allows AI agents to interact with blockchain transactions. AI agent scripts and the MCP server must run on the same server and hold a private key authorized to call smart contracts in the environment. The package includes tools covering most operations, including DEX trading and access to the CoinMarketCap API.

  • Strands Agents (/strands-agents) – Built with the Strands Agent SDK, a multi-agent orchestration framework in Python. Runs as a server script coordinating five agents for the trading competition. Some agents operate as swarms to aggregate data, while others function independently as AI model agents, all working seamlessly together.

More details on Github (https://github.com/pisuthd/trade-arena)

A Tamagotchi game where every step is cryptographically proven by hardware, solving the fake fitness data problem in Move-to-Earn.

---

The Problem We Solve

Move-to-Earn games are plagued by fake data:

- GPS spoofing

- Phone shaking machines

- Bot farms

- Emulators

Result: Rewards go to cheaters, not real users.

---

Our Solution: Hardware Trust Oracle

3-Layer Authenticity Stack:

1. Hardware Root of Trust

- ESP32-S3 smartwatch with IMU sensor

- Ed25519 private key never leaves device

- Step detection runs on hardware, not hackable software

2. Trust Oracle Backend

- Verifies Ed25519 signatures from device

- Detects anomalous patterns (bots, spoofers)

- Only forwards verified data to blockchain

3. On-Chain Verification

- Smart contract validates Oracle proof

- Pet NFT updates only with authenticated data

- Immutable audit trail on Sui

---

How It Works

Walk in Real Life

↓

IMU Sensor detects steps

↓

Device signs data with Ed25519

↓

Trust Oracle verifies signature

↓

Smart contract validates proof

↓

Earn verified resources → Feed/Play with Pet

Key Innovation: Physical hardware creates unforgeable proof. To cheat, you'd need to:

- Extract private key from secure flash (hardware attack)

- Replicate realistic accelerometer patterns (nearly impossible)

- Bypass Oracle signature verification (cryptographically secured)

---

Technical Proof Points

Device-Side Trust:

// Sign step data with device key

signature = ed25519_sign(

data: {steps: 150, timestamp, rawSamples},

privateKey: DEVICE_KEY // Never exposed

);

Oracle Verification:

// Verify before blockchain submission

const isValid = verifyEd25519(payload, signature, device.publicKey);

if (!isValid) reject();

if (detectAnomaly(pattern)) challenge();

Smart Contract:

public entry fun claim_resources(

pet: &mut WalrusPet,

oracle_proof: vector<u8>,

) {

assert!(verify_oracle_signature(oracle_proof), EINVALID);

// Update pet with proven resources

}

---

Nautilus Integration Potential

- Media Provenance: Verify pet screenshots are real (not photoshopped rankings)

- Prediction Markets: Bet on which verified users reach Master level

- Training Data: Sell authenticated fitness datasets for AI models

- Reliability Oracle: Prove hardware uptime and data quality

---

Why This Matters

For Sui Ecosystem:

- First hardware-verified IoT gaming on Sui

- Reusable Trust Oracle pattern for other projects

- Demonstrates Move's security for verifiable systems

For Users:

- Fair gameplay (no cheaters in leaderboards)

- Real fitness rewards (insurance discounts, wellness programs)

- True ownership (Pet NFT backed by proven effort)

For Industry:

- Blueprint for authenticated IoT data on blockchain

- Solves $500M+ problem in fitness/gaming space

- Opens door to regulated applications (healthcare, insurance)

---

Demo

5-Minute Flow:

1. Walk 30 steps → Device signs data

2. Backend verifies → Approves claim

3. Claim resources → Sui transaction created

4. Feed pet → Pet happiness increases

5. View on Explorer → See verified activity history

Proof of Authenticity:

- Check transaction signature: Device attestation included

- Audit raw sensor data: Available for verification

- Challenge system: Request proof samples anytime

---

Built With

- Hardware: ESP32-S3 + QMI8658 IMU

- Crypto: Ed25519 signing (MicroSui library)

- Backend: Node.js Trust Oracle with signature verification

- Blockchain: Sui Move smart contracts

- Storage: Ready for Walrus (sensor data archive)

---

Impact

✅ Unforgeable Fitness Data → Trust in rewards

✅ Hardware-Level Security → Raises cheating barrier

✅ Open Source Oracle → Ecosystem can reuse

✅ Real-World Bridge → IoT meets blockchain

This isn't just a pet game—it's proof that physical-world data can be trusted on-chain, enabling everything from fitness insurance to supply chain verification.

WalDrive is a decentralized cloud storage platform built on Sui blockchain and Walrus decentralized storage network, providing secure, private, and censorship-resistant file management. Files are encrypted client-side using AES-256-GCM encryption before upload, ensuring end-to-end privacy where only the user holds the decryption keys. The platform features Web3 wallet authentication (Sui wallets), with file metadata and ownership managed through Move smart contracts on the Sui blockchain. Core functionality includes folder organization, file starring, trash management, and public sharing via direct Walrus blob URLs (which only provide access to encrypted content). The architecture leverages Walrus storage for decentralized blob storage and retrieval, eliminating single points of failure and server costs. Users can upload, download, and manage files through a modern React-based UI with responsive design and dark theme. The smart contracts handle user profiles, file metadata, folder registries, and sharing permissions entirely on-chain. Security is maintained through multi-layered encryption where blob IDs point to encrypted data on Walrus, while encryption keys remain separate and private. The platform is fully decentralized with zero backend dependencies, deployed at https://wal-drive.vercel.app/. Built with React, Vite, TailwindCSS, and the Sui TypeScript SDK, WalDrive demonstrates the future of Web3 storage solutions.

SafeKey is a decentralized password manager built on the Sui blockchain. It gives users full control of their credentials while keeping them private and secure. By using Walrus for distributed storage, SEAL for secret sharing, and zkLogin for zero-knowledge authentication, SafeKey keeps sensitive data safe without relying on any central server.

Key features:

  • Zero-Knowledge Authentication: Login with Google OAuth and zkLogin proofs without exposing your passwords.

  • SEAL Secret Sharing: Master keys are split across multiple servers so no single server can access your data.

  • Hybrid Decentralized Storage: Encrypted credentials are stored in Walrus while metadata is anchored on Sui for transparency.

  • Two-Layer Encryption and Domain Isolation: AES-256-GCM encryption with HMAC-SHA256 ensures credentials remain secure even if storage nodes are compromised.

  • Seamless Experience: Browser extension supports auto-fill, cross-device sync, and real-time updates every 20 seconds.

Impact:

SafeKey turns password management into a system where users truly own their data. There is no single point of failure and your credentials stay private. Developers can integrate with SafeKey without risking sensitive information.

SafeKey shows a new way to manage credentials in a privacy-first and decentralized way.

DataHaven is the first ever cross-chain storage protocol that enables users to store encrypted data on Walrus from Ethereum, Solana, or Sui with zero-knowledge privacy guarantees powered by Seal. We solve the fragmentation problem in Web3 storage by providing a single interface for multi-chain data storage while maintaining cryptographic proof of integrity and user-controlled access.

Problem

  • Fragmented Storage: Each blockchain has its own storage solution with no interoperability

  • Privacy Concerns: Centralized storage providers compromise data sovereignty

  • Complex Integration: Developers must learn multiple APIs, wallets, and payment methods

  • No Unified Standard: Users can't seamlessly store and access data across chains

Our Solution

DataHaven provides:

  • One Protocol, Multiple Chains: Store from Ethereum, Solana, Sui or any other chains- data lives on Walrus

  • Zero-Knowledge Proofs: Verify storage and access without revealing data (Seal SDK)

  • Pay in Native Tokens: No bridging required - pay in ETH, SOL, or SUI

  • Cryptographic Receipts: Multi-chain verification with fraud detection

  • User-Controlled Access: Revocable permissions with granular access policies

  • ML Fraud Detection: Real-time pattern analysis to prevent malicious activities

  • Instant Access: Retrieve data with automatic integrity verification

Technical Architecture

Origin Chains → Relayer Service → Sui Coordinator → Walrus Storage

  1. Smart Contracts (Solidity/Anchor/Move): Accept storage requests on origin chains

  2. Relayer Service (Node.js/TypeScript): Orchestrates cross-chain operations, generates ZK proofs

  3. Sui Coordinator (Move): Central coordination layer, validates proofs, manages access

  4. Walrus Storage: Decentralized blob storage with erasure coding

  5. Seal SDK: Zero-knowledge proof generation for privacy guarantees

Progress & Traction

✅ Fully Deployed Testnet: Live on Sepolia, Solana Devnet, Sui Testnet
✅ Relayer Service Running: Operational 24/7
✅ 2,000+ Developers: Growing waitlist
✅ Working Product: End-to-end flow functional

Use Cases

  • Healthcare: HIPAA-compliant patient records with verifiable integrity

  • Enterprise: GDPR-compliant document storage with access control

  • Legal & Finance: Immutable contract storage with selective disclosure

  • Web3 dApps: Decentralized file storage for NFT metadata and DAO documents

Future Roadmap

  • Q4 2025: Mainnet launch on 20+ chains + SDK releases (TypeScript, Rust, Golang)

  • Q1 2026: Add 50+ chains + Mobile apps

  • Q2 2026: Decentralized relayer network with token incentives

Team

Experienced Web3 builders with:

  • Multiple hackathon wins (Sui, Algorand, BNB, Wormhole)

  • $5M+ cumulative volume on previous product launch (Kiwi Bridge Bot)

  • Deep expertise in blockchain engineering, full-stack development, and product design
