Privacy-preserving decentralized storage with layered zero-knowledge protection

The Problem

Data breaches cost companies an average of $4.35 million, yet most storage solutions force users to choose between convenience and privacy.

Centralized platforms control user data, selling it without meaningful consent. Meanwhile, existing decentralized solutions lack the privacy guarantees needed for sensitive information.

Users face three major challenges:

  1. Loss of control: Once data is uploaded to traditional cloud storage, users have no way to verify how it's used or who accesses it.

  2. Privacy violations: Most platforms collect and monetize user data through opaque practices. GDPR and CCPA require consent, but implementation is often an afterthought.

  3. Security risks: Centralized storage creates honeypots for attackers. A single breach can expose millions of records because data sits unencrypted in one location.

Current "solutions" don't work:

  1. Blockchain storage alone exposes all data publicly on-chain

  2. Client-side encryption leaves key management entirely to users

  3. Privacy-preserving computation requires trusted third parties

  4. Compliance tools bolt onto existing systems without architectural support

What we need is a storage system that proves privacy properties cryptographically, gives users real control over their data, and maintains compliance by design - not as an add-on.

Our Solution

Nautilus Vault is a privacy-preserving storage framework built on three principles:

1. Prove, don't trust We use zero-knowledge proofs to verify data properties without exposing the data itself. Want to prove you're over 21 without revealing your birthdate? That's what ZK proofs enable.

2. Compartmentalize everything Like a nautilus shell's chambered structure, we separate concerns. Encryption, storage, and verification happen in isolated layers. Compromise one layer, and the others remain secure.

3. Privacy by architecture GDPR compliance isn't a feature we added - it's built into the system design. Consent management, data minimization, and right-to-erasure work because the architecture supports them.

How It Works

Nautilus Vault integrates three technologies:

  1. Walrus handles decentralized storage. Instead of trusting a single provider, data distributes across multiple nodes. No single point of failure.

  2. Seal provides identity-based encryption. Only authorized parties can decrypt data, even if storage nodes are compromised.

  3. Sui blockchain creates an immutable audit trail. Every consent decision, every access request, every data operation gets recorded on-chain. This isn't just logging - it's cryptographic proof of compliance.

The real innovation is how these pieces work together.
A comprehensive Web3 platform for developers and other professional niches to showcase skills, connect, collaborate, and find opportunities on the Sui blockchain.

Fedrus is a complete privacy-preserving AI platform that enables secure model training and inference with zero data leakage. Built on Sui blockchain with Sui SEAL encryption, Walrus decentralized storage, and AWS Nitro Enclaves, Fedrus provides cryptographic proof of training while maintaining complete user privacy through intelligent session evaluation and TEE-based computation.

How It Works:

Privacy and Encryption

  • User conversations are encrypted locally using Sui SEAL

  • Encrypted sessions are stored on Walrus decentralized storage

  • Decryption access is controlled by Sui smart contracts through an allowlist mechanism

Session Evaluation Without Data Exposure

  • Sessions are converted into summaries with PII removed

  • A two-layer evaluation system determines training relevance:

    1. LLM-driven relevance scoring based on privacy-preserving summaries

    2. Embedding similarity matching to check semantic fit

  • Raw data never leaves encrypted form during evaluation

Secure Fine-Tuning

  • Relevant encrypted blobs are used for training inside AWS Nitro Enclaves

  • Data is decrypted and processed only inside the enclave

  • LoRA (PEFT) is used for efficient model fine-tuning

Verifiable Training Proofs

  • The enclave produces an Ed25519-signed proof of which encrypted blobs were used for training

  • A Sui Move smart contract verifies signature and timestamp validity

  • Proofs are stored immutably on-chain and can be publicly verified without revealing data

What Fedrus Enables

  • AI models can improve using real user conversations without viewing them

  • Model providers no longer rely on trust; training is backed by cryptographic proof

  • Users receive guaranteed privacy with zero data leakage

  • A unified framework combining homomorphic encryption, decentralized storage, trusted hardware enclaves, and on-chain verification

SuiSign is a privacy-preserving document signing dApp on Sui that lets users send, decrypt, and sign PDFs or rich text without ever putting raw document data on-chain. Documents are encrypted client-side with AES-GCM, stored as blobs on Walrus, and the decryption keys are gated by Seal, so only authorized wallets can open them. On-chain, we only store a lightweight Document object with the Walrus blob ID, hash, signer list, and signature records. For PDFs that require handwritten signatures, SuiSign burns the drawn signature directly into the PDF, re-encrypts it, updates the on-chain blob pointer, and keeps all signers in sync with the same “canonical” encrypted file.

Iyup Protocol is a decentralized system for turning real-world documents into secure, verifiable on-chain assets. It allows users to upload encrypted documents, store them permanently on Walrus, and register them on Sui using zero-knowledge commitments.
Instead of exposing the document or its hash on-chain, Iyup proves authenticity privately using ZK cryptography.

With Iyup, ownership of a document is represented as a token, when the token is transferred, document access and decryption rights transfer automatically.

for more information https://docs.iyup.space/

KAI : The First Data DAO on Sui

Please refer the Whitepaper

KAI is the first data DAO built on the Sui blockchain that restores power, ownership, and economic value to the individuals who generate data. The platform addresses the fundamental imbalance in the modern digital ecosystem, where centralized entities harvest user data, monetize it, and retain full control over its usage. KAI reframes data as a user-owned digital asset governed collectively through a DAO and used ethically for analytics and AI training.

KAI provides mechanisms for transparent data governance, fair revenue sharing, consent-driven access, and responsible, auditable AI development. By grounding all data usage policies in community oversight and enforceable ethical guidelines, KAI establishes a user-centric data economy rooted in trust, fairness, and accountability.

1. The Big Data Problem

Data fuels the global digital economy, yet users have no meaningful ownership or control over it. Centralized platforms:

  • Extract value while providing no compensation to data creators.

  • Obscure how data is used internally or sold externally.

  • Train AI models on unconsented datasets.

  • Provide no governance rights and no visibility into monetization.

This creates a market defined by asymmetry, opacity, and exploitative economics.

2. KAI’s Vision and Philosophy

KAI establishes a user-first paradigm built on the following principles:

Ownership first

Users maintain primary rights over their data, including consent, access, and economic participation.

Transparency and accountability

All data usage requests, governance decisions, and revenue flows are discoverable and governed publicly.

Ethical AI as a default standard

Any AI system built using KAI data must adhere to responsible practices, documented procedures, and audit trails.

Fair value distribution

Users receive rewards proportional to the value their data generates.

Collective governance

Policies, partnerships, and data access rules are shaped through democratic decision-making within the DAO.

3. Core Functionality of KAI

User-owned data assets

Each user’s data is treated as a digital asset with clearly defined usage rights, monetization rules, and governance affordances.

Consent-driven data access

No organization can use or inspect data unless explicitly approved by the data owner or DAO-defined policy.

Transparent monetization

When third parties request access for research, analytics, or AI training, all revenue flows follow predefined and transparent distribution rules.

DAO governance

The community decides:

  • Data usage policies.

  • Ethical standards for AI training.

  • Pricing frameworks.

  • Partnerships with research institutions and enterprises.

  • Allocation of treasury funds and community incentives.

Privacy by default

All data usage must follow privacy-preserving rules, including aggregation and minimization practices defined by the DAO.


How KAI conceptually leverages Sui, Walrus, and Seal

1. Sui as the governance and provenance layer

Sui provides the canonical record of ownership, consent receipts, policy ratifications, DAO proposals, and on-chain governance actions. Sui’s object-centric model aligns with KAI’s view of data as discrete assets with lifecycle metadata and consent history. By anchoring consent records and governance decisions on Sui, KAI delivers tamper-evident provenance and clear audit trails for who authorized what and when. This preserves accountability and supports dispute resolution.

2. Walrus as the decentralized storage and data availability layer

Walrus supplies the decentralized storage substrate KAI needs for large datasets, media, and dataset artifacts that cannot or should not be stored directly on-chain. Walrus is purpose-built for programmatic, chain-aware storage and data availability for agentic workloads and DApps. Conceptually, KAI uses Walrus to host encrypted data blobs, dataset manifests, and training-ready aggregates while preserving verifiable anchors to on-chain consent and provenance. This decoupling prevents excessive on-chain exposure of raw data while ensuring discoverability and availability.

3. Seal as the privacy and access-control layer

Seal provides a model for encryption-first access control where data remains encrypted until a policy permits decryption. Conceptually, KAI pairs Seal with its consent framework to ensure that only authorized, policy-compliant consumers can decrypt or query sensitive dataset segments. Seal’s programmable policies and distributed key material align with KAI’s need for auditable, revocable, and time-bound access to sensitive contributions. This enables purpose-limited access for research or AI training while minimizing risk of unauthorized disclosure.

Implementation Roadmap and Milestones

Phase 0 — Research and Specification (Completed)

  • Finalized the initial consent schema and human-readable data license templates.

  • Established the foundational DAO governance rules and decision-making framework.

  • Defined the privacy principles, ethical AI checklist, and compliance baseline for data usage.

Phase 1 — Minimum Viable Product (Completed)

  • Launched the MVP with core data asset minting on Sui.

  • Deployed the initial marketplace flow for data access requests and revenue handling.

  • Added baseline privacy-preserving transformations and introduced manual approval modules.

Status:
The MVP is fully complete, validated, and operational. Based on its performance and user feedback, KAI is now progressing into the next phase of development.

Phase 2 — Privacy and Ethical Pipeline (In Progress)

  • Currently integrating Seal to introduce decentralized encryption and programmable access control for sensitive data.

  • Expanding the ethical AI pipeline with required model cards, dataset documentation, and standardized bias-audit expectations.

  • Preparing to introduce governance participation incentives and bootstrap the initial DAO token mechanisms.

Focus of this phase:
Strengthening privacy guarantees, enabling consent-driven encryption, and operationalizing KAI’s ethical AI training framework using Seal’s policy-controlled decryption model.

Phase 3 — Scale and Partnerships (Upcoming)

  • Introduce federated learning pathways and expand support for privacy-preserving analytics workflows.

  • Begin onboarding third-party auditors, model certifiers, and aligned research partners.

  • Start global-scale compliance and regional policy adaptation across multiple jurisdictions.

Phase 4 — Ecosystem and Optimization (Future)

  • Deploy automated valuation systems for data pricing based on demand, rarity, and contribution patterns.

  • Extend governance with advanced voting mechanisms, contributor reputation layers, and community-driven quality scoring.

  • Build cross-chain interoperability features for data portability, multi-chain consent anchoring, and ecosystem integrations.

核心概念：  

用AI动态评估DeFi用户信用，并将评分结果通过NFT上链，实现链上信用可视化

解决的问题：

当前DeFi借贷需要超额抵押（如150%），通过AI分析用户链上行为生成信用评分，允许优质用户获得更低抵押率的贷款

项目的创新点主要体现在三个方面：

l 构建链上行为多维度评估模型，突破传统信用评估单一维度局限，综合分析用户链上交易历史、资产流动性、合约交互行为等多维度数据；

l 建立实时更新的动态信用评分机制，使AI代理能够根据用户行为变化持续优化评分结果，实现信用评估的时效性与准确性；

l 将NFT化信用凭证与借贷权限直接绑定，通过NFT的唯一性和不可篡改性，实现信用凭证的链上可视化与确权，同时赋予NFT持有者相应的借贷额度与抵押率调整权限。

在实际应用价值层面，项目针对当前DeFi借贷生态中普遍存在的超额抵押问题（如传统借贷需150%以上抵押率），通过AI动态信用评估为优质用户提供差异化抵押率方案，降低用户资金占用成本，提升链上资金效率。

projectName: Coral  (From Your Vault to Value: Write in Obsidian, Sync with VaultBridge, Monetize on Coral.)
description:
Coral: The Knowledge Reef for Obsidian Creators

1. Our Vision: From a Private Vault to a Thriving Ocean of Creation

For Obsidian users, our Vaults are sanctuaries of thought. Yet, these precious notes face two critical dilemmas:

  1. Fragile Ownership: Content is trapped on local devices or centralized cloud servers that can be shut down, censored, or fail, risking loss or control.

  2. Undervalued Work: Deep, structured knowledge struggles to find fair compensation on algorithm-driven social platforms.

Coral was born to answer a single question: How can our deepest thinking not only last forever but also unlock its inherent value?

We believe every creator should be the true sovereign of their knowledge assets.

2. The Philosophy: Why "Coral"?

We chose the name Coral because it perfectly encapsulates our platform's ecosystem:

  • Symbiosis & Co-Creation: A coral reef is built by countless polyps working together. Similarly, Coral is not a content repository but a knowledge ecosystem co-created and nourished by every creator. Your participation adds new life to this reef.

  • Resilience & Permanence: Coral reefs stand for millennia as some of nature's most robust structures. This mirrors our use of the Walrus/Arweave permaweb protocol, which gives your content an unchangeable, eternal life.

  • Beauty & Diversity: Coral reefs are vibrant and incredibly diverse. Coral welcomes thinkers from all fields—be they technologists, philosophers, or storytellers—to find their audience and contribute to a rich tapestry of intelligence.

3. The Workflow: A Seamless, Tripartite Experience

The power of the Coral ecosystem lies in the elegant synergy of three components:

1. Obsidian: Your Unbreakable Foundation for Creation

  • Role: The Creation Hub.

  • Function: Change no habits. Continue building your universe of personal knowledge within the powerful, familiar environment of Obsidian. It remains the source of all your inspiration.

2. Vault-Bridge: Your Bridge to Permanence

  • Role: The Secure, Decentralized Connector (An Obsidian Plugin).

  • Function: This is the crucial link between Obsidian and Coral.

    • One-Click Eternity: Once you finish an article in Obsidian, click the Vault-Bridge button to anchor it permanently onto the decentralized Walrus storage network.

    • Sovereignty Guaranteed: It ensures your complete data sovereignty, solving the problems of content fragility and ownership.

3. The Coral Platform: The Reef Where Value Blooms

  • Role: The Value Realization and Community Home.

  • Function: The magic happens on Coral once an article is synced:

    • Automatic Column Generation: Your article instantly transforms into a beautiful, subscribable column page on Coral.

    • Direct Value Reward: Readers can subscribe to you directly via transparent crypto payments, and you receive the vast majority of the revenue. This solves the problem of monetizing knowledge.

    • Join the Ecosystem: You are no longer an island. You become part of the Coral knowledge reef, connecting and growing with other creators.

4. Conclusion: A Shift to Creator Sovereignty

The Old Way: Obsidian (Create) -> Local Files (Risk) | Third-Party Platforms (Fragmented, Low Reward).

The New Paradigm: Obsidian (Create) -> Vault-Bridge (Permanence) -> Coral Platform (Monetization).

Coral is more than a tool; it is a new paradigm. It transforms your Obsidian Vault from a static knowledge archive into a dynamic, appreciating personal knowledge asset.

Overview:
ColdCache is a decentralized video game store that returns true ownership to players—no centralized authority, no arbitrary deletions, and no lost purchases. Unlike platforms like Steam, ColdCache ensures 100% lifetime ownership through NFTs minted on the Flow blockchain, which act as cryptographic proof of purchase. When you own the NFT, you own the game—period.

Problem & Solution:
Modern digital gaming storefronts restrict consumer rights: games can be deleted against your will, resold titles are impossible, and platforms claim a hefty cut (up to 30%) from developers. ColdCache solves this by:

  • Guaranteeing permanent, censorship-resistant access to your games

  • Enabling resale and transfer of game ownership—just like physical disks

  • Allowing developers to publish and earn directly without handing over revenue

Flow:

  1. Developers upload their games to the store

  2. Buyers purchase and mint an ownership NFT

  3. Game files are securely stored and accessed via Walrus decentralized storage

  4. Ownership can be transferred; the recipient gets download rights, and the previous owner loses access

Technical Highlights:

  • Built atop the full SUI stack, integrating Move smart contracts, Seal for access control, and Walrus for decentralized file storage

  • NFT-based ownership: Verifiable, tradable, and perpetual

  • Seal access policies: Tie NFT possession directly to download permissions

  • Walrus storage: Guarantees always-on, tamper-proof game files

  • Partial encryption: Optimizes speed in the encryption/decryption pipeline for game delivery

  • Features a developer publisher interface, a storefront catalog, and a personal user library

Why Walrus:
Walrus powers the decentralized backbone for game file storage, delivering uninterruptible, cryptographically enforced game ownership—pushing digital rights back into the hands of players and creators.

🐋 Check-in NFT Walrus Haulout — Sui-based NFT Ecosystem

Check-in NFT Walrus Haulout is a full Web3 ecosystem built on Sui Blockchain, enabling users to create digital identities, preserve memories, earn badges, and trade NFTs transparently.
All interactions are done fully on-chain, using Next.js 14, React, Tailwind CSS, and direct integration with Sui RPC—no backend server required.

🚀 Core Features

🧩 1. Profile NFT

  • Users can mint a Profile NFT that represents their Web3 identity.

  • Stores avatar, social links, bio, nationality, and immutable metadata.

  • Supports on-chain verification through community voting.

📸 2. Memory NFT (Check-in NFT)

  • Capture personal memories such as photos, locations, timestamps, emotions.

  • Each memory is minted as a unique NFT and displayed in a personal timeline.

  • Supports image storage via Walrus or Tusky.

🏅 3. Badges & Gacha System

  • Claim badges at events or locations.

  • Gacha system allows randomized NFT rewards.

  • Badges contribute to profile ranking and achievements.

🛒 4. Marketplace + Kiosk (Sui Standard)

  • List NFTs for sale using a Sui Kiosk.

  • Buy/sell with SUI token.

  • Sellers can withdraw marketplace proceeds directly to their wallet.

  • Supports hot bids, “buy now”, and personalized listing management.

🧪 5. Profile Verification & Voting

  • On-chain community voting system to verify real users.

  • Verified profiles receive a Verify Badge NFT.

📦 6. Kiosk Management

  • Create and manage personal kiosks.

  • Move NFTs in/out of the kiosk.

  • List, delist, withdraw proceeds, claim sales revenue.

Walrus Scout – the refinery that turns raw data into cryptographically pure, AI-verified, economically aligned digital oil.

Upload once—

  • Walrus stores your CSV with RedStuff (4-shard, 66 % fault-tolerant durability) and mints a content-addressed blob ID

  • Gemini AI scans a sample inside a Nautilus-attested AWS Nitro enclave, returning a 0-100 % quality score + authenticity proof signed on-chain

  • Seal encrypts dispute samples with 2-of-5 threshold keys—only staked arbitrators can decrypt

  • Sui Move atomically splits every 100 WAL purchase: 85 % to seller, 5 % creator royalties, 5 % platform, 5 % insurance pool

Stake to rank: Bronze (50 WAL, 5 min verify) → Silver (200 WAL, 1 min) → Gold (1,000 WAL, 10 s) and unlock priority placement, featured badges, and AI-quality futures markets where traders long/short trust itself.

Every dataset is a staked, AI-verified, revenue-splitting asset—programmable data oil, refined and ready for the trustless economy.

Orbiton AI Agent

1/ What is Orbiton AI Agent?

Orbiton is an AI-powered trading agent built for prediction markets. It aggregates, normalizes, and analyzes data across platforms such as Kalshi, Polymarket, and Limitless, identifying arbitrage spreads, mispriced markets, and high-value opportunities in real time. Designed with a scalable intelligence layer, Orbiton can operate across any market category - starting with suggesting potential deals but built for global prediction market intelligence.

2/ Key Features

🔹 Prediction Market Arbitrage Engine

Orbiton continuously monitors multiple exchanges to detect arbitrage spreads, pricing disparities, and execution-ready cross-market inefficiencies. It automatically evaluates fees, liquidity conditions, and execution risk to highlight the most profitable trades.

🔹 +EV Market Discovery

Beyond arbitrage, Orbiton identifies statistically favorable (+EV) opportunities by combining:

  • - on-chain market conditions

  • - sentiment and narrative analysis from X & Reddit

  • - probability modeling

  • - liquidity and order flow signals

It delivers structured assessments of mispricing, expected edge, and conviction level.

🔹 Real-time Follow-up & Alerting

Orbiton tracks live market movements and narrative shifts, alerting users when:

  • - odds move significantly

  • - momentum changes

  • - sentiment swings

  • - major events break

Each alert includes reasoning, risk factors, and suggested adjustments.

🔹 Truly Decentralized AI Agent Architecture

Orbiton is one of the first fully decentralized AI trading agents, where users retain exclusive control over their conversational data and agent reasoning.

  • - All conversations and reasoning traces are stored on Walrus, a decentralized, verifiable storage layer.

  • - Orbiton’s servers cannot access, modify, or read user conversation data.

  • - The agent runs using Mastra, local tools, and standard x402 integrations.

  • - Market data pipelines and indexers (built in Rust) operate separately from user data.

Tech Stack:

  • - AI Agent Framework: Mastra

  • - LLM: GLM 4.6

  • - Indexer: Rust

  • - Data Sources: Prediction Market APIs + social sentiment crawler + on-chain feeds

  • - Decentralized conversation storage: Walrus

  • - Payment & tool execution: x402

3/ Go-To-Market (GTM)

- Trader-First Launch

Target prediction market traders with:

  • - arbitrage alerts

  • - sentiment-driven signals

  • - daily +EV reports

  • - real-time intelligence feed

Focus on the Kalshi/Polymarket communities for early adoption.

Agent Developer Integrations

Orbiton exposes structured data feeds and standardized x402 endpoints so any AI agent can:

  • - plug into prediction market signals

  • - fetch normalized cross-venue data

  • - execute strategies using Orbiton as an intelligence module

This positions Orbiton as the default data infrastructure for autonomous prediction-market agents.

Institutional & B2B Data Providers

Offer high-quality feeds (pricing metrics, spreads, sentiment pulses, risk indexes) to funds, analysts, and forecasting platforms.

4/ Vision

Orbiton aims to become the universal intelligence layer for prediction markets — helping both humans and autonomous agents understand probability, narrative momentum, market structure, and opportunity in real time. More than just an AI Agent, we will soon operate decentralized vaults operated by Orbiton AI Agent with different investing strategies on Prediction Market for users to take part in.

While Orbiton begins with political markets, its architecture expands into:

  • - finance

  • - sports

  • - crypto

  • - global macro risk

  • - forecasting platforms

The long-term vision:
Empower any trader or AI agent to analyze, predict, and act on every prediction market worldwide.

ScholarSync is an intelligent app that helps learners track, analyze, and improve their study habits using AI and Machine Learning. It predicts your expected productivity, shows trends, and gives insights to make your study sessions more effective.

1. Project Overview: The Paradigm Shift

 

1.1 The "zkDungeon" Protocol

 

zkDungeon is more than just a pixel-art RPG; it is a Zero-Knowledge State Machine disguised as a game.

While it plays like a fast-paced, single-player 2D Roguelike, every interaction underneath is a cryptographic transaction. We utilize a Finite State Machine (FSM) model where State represents the entire game world, and Action is the only valid way to transition that state.

By integrating Zero-Knowledge Proofs (ZKP) directly into the game loop, zkDungeon creates a new category of digital experience: a game that runs locally on your device for zero latency, yet possesses the absolute, trustless security of a blockchain rollup.

 

1.2 Core Philosophy: Truth Over Belief

 

The current gaming landscape operates on blind faith.

  • - In Web2, players must believe the developer won't rig drop rates or shadow-ban accounts.

  • - In Web3, players often trade gameplay quality for "on-chain" status, resulting in slow, expensive experiences that require belief in the token's value rather than the game's quality.

zkDungeon doesn't ask for belief. It offers proof.

 

"When rules are honest, stories write themselves."

In our world, a Critical Hit is not a random number from a black-box server; it is a mathematical inevitability derived from a verifiable seed. Your inventory is not a mutable entry in a SQL database; it is a cryptographic state that no admin can alter without a valid proof. We are building a world where verifiability is the foundation, not a feature.

 

1.3 The Objective: Zero Latency, Maximum Trust

 

Our goal was to solve the "Blockchain Game Trilemma": How do we achieve the responsiveness of a local game while maintaining the trustlessness of a fully on-chain game?

 

We rejected the standard compromises.

  • - We did not want the lag of waiting for block confirmations for every move.

  • - We did not want to off-load logic to a centralized server and just "sync" assets.

Instead, we engineered a Hybrid ZK-Optimistic Architecture that decouples execution from verification. This allows Dungeon to deliver the "snappiness" of a native desktop game while ensuring every single state transition is mathematically proven and settled on Sui.

 

2. The Challenge: The "Verifiable Game" Trilemma

 

2.1 The Current Landscape: A False Dichotomy

 

Until now, developers building blockchain games faced a painful trade-off between User Experience and Decentralization.

  • - Fully On-Chain Games:

    These games store all state and logic on the blockchain. While secure, they are fundamentally limited by the network's consensus speed. Waiting 2-15 seconds for a character to move is not a game; it’s a turn-based transaction interface. This latency breaks immersion and limits complexity.

  • - Web 2.5 Games (The "Mullet" Strategy):

    "Web3 in the front, Web2 in the back." These games handle assets on-chain (NFTs) but run gameplay on centralized servers. While fast, they reintroduce the single point of failure. If the server goes down or the logic is patched silently, the "ownership" of assets becomes meaningless.

2.2 The Twin Bottlenecks of ZK Gaming

 

Naturally, Zero-Knowledge Proofs seem like the solution: run off-chain, prove on-chain. However, we encountered two critical engineering walls when trying to build a production-grade RPG.

 

1. The Compute Wall (Impractical AI Proving)

 

In a rich RPG like zkDungeon, the game logic involves heavy computations—pathfinding algorithms (A*), enemy behavior trees, and complex decision logic.

Attempts to prove the entirety of this logic inside a general-purpose zkVM proved impractical. Proving a single turn with complex AI logic could take minutes on consumer hardware, destroying the "instant feedback" loop required for a Roguelike.

 

2. The Content Wall (The Scalability Trap)

Traditional ZK architectures often hardcode game rules into the circuit. This creates a fatal scalability issue: Circuit complexity grows linearly with game content.

If we wanted to add 500 new items or 100 new monster types, we would have to rewrite the constraints, significantly increase the circuit size, and potentially perform a new Trusted Setup or complex verifier upgrade. This monolithic approach makes rapid content updates—the lifeblood of any live service game—impossible.

We realized that to build a sustainable verifiable game, we needed to decouple Physics from Intent and Logic from Content.

 

3. Our Solution: The Hybrid & Data-Driven Architecture

 

3.1 Pillar I: Hybrid Verification (Separating Physics from Intent)

 

To solve the compute problem, we decoupled the game loop into two distinct layers of verification:

  • - Layer A: The "Physics" (ZK-Validity Proof)

    • - Scope: Every state transitions (HP changes, movement, inventory updates).

    • - Mechanism: We use RISC0/SP1 to generate validity proofs for these transitions instantly.

    • - Result: We prove the consequence of an action immediately. The physical state is always valid and finalized.

  • - Layer B: The "Mind" (Optimistic Fraud Proof)

    • - Scope: Complex AI logic, pathfinding, and behavioral trees.

    • - Mechanism: Instead of proving heavy AI computations inside ZK every turn, we make the logic Deterministic and subject to an Optimistic Challenge Period.

    • - Result: We achieve the speed of optimistic rollups for complex calculations while keeping the security of ZK for critical state updates.

3.2 Pillar II: Infinite Scalability via Oracle Commitments

 

To solve the content scalability problem, zkDungeon adopts a strictly Data-Driven Architecture. We treat game content as verifiable data, not hardcoded constraints.

  • - The "Action Effect System":

    Instead of writing new ZK circuits for every new skill, we implemented a generic Action Effect System.

    • - Actions are composed of combinations of atomic, verified effects (e.g., DealDamage, ApplyStatus, Move).

    • - Benefit: This drastically reduces the security surface—we only need to audit and prove the atomic effects once. It grants us immense expressiveness to create complex skills without increasing circuit size or development time.

  • - The Merkle Oracle Pattern:

    Static game content (Item stats, NPC data, Map layouts) is organized into a Merkle Tree.

    • - Only the Merkle Root (the Oracle Commitment) is stored in the on-chain State.

    • - When an interaction occurs, the circuit verifies the specific data using a lightweight Merkle Proof against the committed root.

    • - Benefit: zkDungeon is infinitely scalable. We can add expansions, thousands of items, and new enemies solely by updating the data tree, without modifying or re-compiling the core ZK circuits.

 

4. Technical Implementation: Architecture & Stack

 

Our implementation allows zkDungeon to function as a high-performance protocol, not just a game. We achieved this by engineering a modular Rust architecture that creates a secure loop between Execution, Verification, and Data Availability.

 

4.1 Modular Codebase Structure ("Shared Logic")

 

We engineered the codebase to enforce a "Write Once, Prove Anywhere" philosophy. By strictly separating logic from runtime environments, we guarantee that the client's local execution is bit-for-bit identical to the zkVM's verification.

  • - game-core (The Pure Logic):

    A strictly no_std library containing only the Finite State Machine (FSM) and pure data structures. It has zero side effects, allowing it to compile to both WASM (for web clients) and RISC-V (for the ZK Guest).

  • - runtime (The Orchestrator):

    Manages the game loop, state persistence, and orchestrates communication between the core logic and background workers.

  • - zk (The Validity Layer):

    Contains the RISC0 Guest programs, Host-side proof generation logic, and shared cryptographic primitives (hashing traits).

  • - client (The View Model):

    Abstracts the rendering layer via a View Model pattern. Currently implemented as a TUI (Text User Interface) for the hackathon to demonstrate core mechanics, but designed to be easily swapped for Unity/Bevy/Web frontends.

 

4.2 Asynchronous "Zero-Stall" Proving System

A major breakthrough in zkDungeon is how we handle the computational overhead of ZK proofs without sacrificing User Experience (UX).

  • - Multi-threaded Worker Pool:

    Gameplay and Proof Generation are completely decoupled. The game engine runs on the main thread, emitting a lightweight Witness for each action. Dedicated Prover Workers running in background threads pick up these witnesses to generate proofs asynchronously.

  • - Batching & Parallelism:

    Actions are batched to optimize prover efficiency. Since the cryptographic chain of state roots is sequential but the proof generation is computationally independent, multiple workers can process different batches in parallel.

  • - Result:

    Gameplay never stops. The player experiences zero latency, while the heavy lifting of zero-knowledge proving happens silently in the background.

 

4.3 ZK Proof Architecture (RISC0/SP1 + Groth16)

We utilize RISC0/SP1 zkVM wrapped in Groth16 for efficient on-chain verification on Sui. To overcome the specific constraint where Groth16 only exposes the JournalDigest as a public input, we implemented a novel Two-Stage Verification mechanism.

 

The Flow:

  1. Guest Execution: The zkVM executes the game-core logic. It commits critical data (Roots, Nonce, Seed) to the Journal.

  2. Proof Generation: The Host generates a Groth16 proof. The public input for this proof is the JournalDigest (SHA-256 of the Journal).

  3. On-Chain Verification (Sui Contract):

    • Stage 1 (Cryptographic): verify_groth16(proof, journal_digest). This proves that some valid execution produced this digest.

    • Stage 2 (Semantic): The contract takes the raw JournalData submitted by the user, computes its hash on-chain, and asserts sha256(journal_data) == journal_digest.

 

4.4 Data Availability & Walrus Integration

We chose Walrus not just for storage, but as the fundamental trust anchor for our Optimistic Fraud Proof system.

  • - The Necessity of DA for Fraud Proofs:

    For an optimistic system to work, challengers must be able to download the offender's action history to prove fraud. If a cheater generates a valid ZK proof but hides the actual action data (Data Withholding Attack), the system collapses. We need a layer that guarantees data availability, not just persistence.

  • - Why Walrus?:

    1. Native Interoperability with Sui: Unlike IPFS or Arweave, Walrus Blob objects are native to the Sui ecosystem. Our smart contract can directly read the Blob ID and Certified Epoch from the transaction context. This allows us to atomically bind the ZK Proof's Public Output (ActionsRoot) to the Storage Blob within a single Move transaction—a feature uniquely possible with the Sui+Walrus stack.

    2. Cost-Effective Security via DAS: Walrus utilizes Data Availability Sampling (DAS). This allows us to verify that the game data is available to all challengers without incurring the prohibitive gas costs of on-chain storage or the insecurity of centralized servers.

  • - Cryptographic Binding Flow:

    1. Guest: The zkVM computes ActionsRoot and commits it to the Journal.

    2. Walrus: The runtime uploads actions and receives a BlobID.

    3. Contract:

      assert!( Journal.ActionsRoot == walrus::blob::blob_id(&actions_blob) );

 

5. Known Limitations & Technical Transparency

We believe in complete transparency regarding the current state of the prototype. While the entire architecture is designed and implemented, we encountered a specific interoperability issue during the final integration phase.

 

5.1 SP1-Sui Groth16 Issue

  • - Current Status:

    We successfully implemented the entire off-chain pipeline: Rust FSM Execution → SP1 STARK Proof Generation → Wrapping to Groth16. The proof generation works perfectly.

  • - The Issue:

    The on-chain verification on Sui currently fails due to a cryptographic format mismatch.

  • - Root Cause (Gnark vs. Arkworks):

    SP1's Groth16 wrapper is based on Gnark (Go ecosystem), while Sui's Move verifier expects inputs compatible with Arkworks (Rust ecosystem). While a bridge crate (sp1-sui) exists, the current version is outdated relative to the latest SP1 release. This results in a malformed Verifying Key (VK) that does not match the proofs generated by the latest SP1 Prover.

  • - The Fix:

    We have identified the exact solution: manual serialization adjustment of the Verifying Key to match Sui's expected endianness and point compression format. However, due to the strict time constraints of the hackathon, we opted to submit with this specific on-chain verification step pending, rather than risking the stability of the rest of the demo.

 

6. Roadmap & Vision

 

6.1 Tech: Compiler-Driven Custom Circuits

 

We plan to move beyond general-purpose zkVMs to Custom Circuits for maximum performance.

  • - The Innovation: We will not write circuits manually. Instead, we will leverage our Action Effect System to build a Circuit Compiler.

  • - How it works: Since all game actions are composed of atomic effects (Damage, Move, Heal), we can write a compiler that automatically generates optimized Halo2/Arkworks circuits from the game data. This guarantees both infinite content scalability and native ZK performance without manual constraint engineering.

 

6.2 Gameplay Expansion: Systems & Mechanics

  • - Trustless Multiplayer: Signed Action Synchronization

    We are architecting a Peer-to-Peer Multiplayer system based on Deterministic Lockstep Synchronization.

    • - The Architecture: To bypass the non-determinism of asynchronous consensus (FLP Impossibility), we utilize a strict Signed Action Exchange model. Players sign their actions and exchange them directly.

    • - ZK Verification: The ZK circuit accepts a batch of [Signed Action A, Signed Action B] as input. It verifies the cryptographic signatures of all participants and executes the turn sequence deterministically.

    • - Result: A fully decentralized multiplayer experience where the "Server" is replaced by math. A valid ZK proof guarantees that both players agreed to the inputs and the outcome is the only possible result of their interaction.

  • - ZK-Verifiable Procedural Generation

    Currently, the game uses static layouts, but we will implement deep Procedural Generation to create infinite, replayable dungeons.

    • - Fairness as a Proof: We will run the generation algorithm (e.g., Cellular Automata or BSP) inside the ZK circuit.

    • - The Guarantee: The protocol proves that the dungeon map was generated honestly from a verifiable seed (e.g., a block hash). This mathematically prevents "Map Cherry-picking"—players cannot reroll the world until they get a legendary item at the spawn point, because the proof would be invalid.

  • - Strategic Fog of War

    Leveraging ZK properties, we will implement a cryptographic Fog of War where the map exists but is hidden. Players must prove valid movement through the unknown, enabling true stealth and exploration mechanics impossible in transparent FOCGs.

 

6.3 Product: A "Real" Game Experience

  • - Frontend Agnosticism: We will replace the current TUI (Text UI) with a robust Web-based Frontend or a Game Engine Client (Unity/Bevy) to deliver a mass-market visual experience.

  • - Content Expansion: Leveraging the Oracle Commitment system, we plan to launch a rich set of dungeons, items, and enemy types.

 

Conclusion

 

zkDungeon proves that we don't have to choose between the immersion of traditional games and the ownership of blockchain. By combining Shared Logic, Async ZK, and Optimistic Fraud Proofs, we are building a world that is wondrously complex, yet mathematically honest.

Use attendance data for sponsor activations and loyalty programs.

projectName: ZerotoWeb3 - Learn Web3 from zero, the simple way
description:
ZeroToWeb3: Provably Authentic Content Platform

ZeroToWeb3 a provably authentic content platform that leverages Walrus decentralized storage to solve the content authenticity crisis in Web3 education.

Problem: Readers can't verify if tutorials/guides are original, tampered with, or properly attributed to authors.

📌 The Problem: Content Authenticity Crisis

In the age of AI and deepfake, how to prove:

✍️ Who is the real author of the content?

📅 When was the content created?

🔒 Was the content edited after publication?

📍 Where is the content stored and is it still intact?

Traditional blogs cannot answer these questions cryptographically provably.

✨ Our Solution: Cryptographic Media Provenance

ZeroToWeb3 builds a complete media provenance verification system using:
Walrus storage + Sui blockchain

  • 100% content storage on Walrus - Every article lives entirely on your decentralized network, ensuring immutability and permanence

  • Walrus Blob ID as Content Fingerprint - We use Blob IDs as cryptographic proof of content existence and integrity

  • Triple layer Verification System:

  1. Content Storage Proof (Walrus Blob ID)

  2. Metadata Registry Proof (Sui Transaction Digest)

  3. Smart Contract Verification Badge (proves content hasn't been altered)

Why this matters: Web3 learners can now verify that every tutorial they read is provably authentic - original source, correct author, exact timestamp, and tamper proof.

Live Demo: https://zerotoweb3.wal.app/

Smart Contract: 0x09b4b0adaf6daf06aa795085085ec608fb7829e6ec86e86b7cb32b20c2048bb4

Hackathon Track: PROVABLY AUTHENTIC - Verify Media Provenance

Building on Walrus - it's enabling a new era of verifiable content on the decentralized web!

Would love to hear your thoughts and feedback. 🙏

Thank you for your take time!

Maou is a privacy-preserving transfer protocol on Sui that hides sender, recipient, and amounts. Using zero-knowledge commitments groth16, Walrus Data Availability, and Seal, it stores encrypted notes with verifiable integrity, enabling private and compliant on-chain transfers.

check out https://docs.maou.space/

TimeHut is a time capsule application powered by Sui + Seal + Walrus that helps people deliver emotions and memories to the future.

You can deliver your thoughts, expectations, or secrets to the future.

We will guard this secret for you until the future date arrives.

🏆 Sui Patreon: The Decentralized Creator Economy

Sui Patreon is a blockchain-powered alternative to platforms like Patreon and OnlyFans, designed to cut costs, eliminate intermediaries, and give creators true ownership of their business. Built on the Sui blockchain, we shift the entire creator-fan relationship from centralized servers to trustless smart contracts.

💡 Core Innovation: From Middleman to Smart Contract

We replace the four biggest pain points of the traditional creator economy with decentralized solutions:

  1. Subscription NFTs: Instead of database entries, fan subscriptions are non-fungible tokens (NFTs) owned by the fan. They are portable, provable, and can't be revoked by the platform.

  2. Instant Payments: Smart contracts handle payments directly from fan to creator, reducing fees from 10-20% to just 2-5% and ensuring instant settlement (no 2-week payout delays).

  3. Censorship-Resistant Content: Premium content is encrypted client-side and stored on Walrus decentralized storage. Access is enforced by the smart contract using Seal encryption, ensuring the platform can never view, delete, or arbitrarily block content.

  4. Web2 Login (zkLogin): We eliminate the friction of crypto wallets. Fans log in with Google or Twitch (using Sui's zkLogin) and get a non-custodial blockchain wallet automatically—no seed phrases, making the Web3 experience feel just like Web2.

📊 The Impact

This system saves creators a significant amount of money and risk:

  • Financial Benefit: A creator earning $10,000/month saves $1,200/month (or $14,400/year) compared to traditional platforms.

  • Business Control: Creators gain full ownership of their subscriber list (NFT holders) and payment rails, protecting them from platform policy changes, bans, and vendor lock-in.

Sui Patreon is a complete, composable platform that returns power and profit to the creators.

Nabu - A Decentralized Dataset Marketplace

Nabu is a trustless, creator-first platform for buying and selling datasets, built on Sui with Walrus storage and Seal encryption. Named after the Babylonian god of wisdom, Nabu solves critical problems in data marketplaces: censorship, lack of transparency, and data integrity.

Key Features:

- Provable Ownership & Originality: Every dataset gets a unique SHA-256 fingerprint stored on-chain. The smart contract automatically flags resold content, protecting creators' intellectual property and rewarding original uploads with XP.

- Decentralized Security: Datasets are encrypted client-side with Seal and stored on Walrus. Only verified buyers can decrypt, ensuring data privacy and tamper-proof ownership.

- Instant Direct Payments: Creators receive 100% of sales instantly via smart contract; no intermediaries, no delays. The 3% marketplace fee is enforced on-chain.

- Cost Optimization: Using Walrus Quilt for batch storage achieves 400x savings on storage fees and 238x on gas costs, making it economical for creators.

- Incentivized Ecosystem: Both creators and buyers earn XP for contributions, fostering an active community with future revenue-sharing based on earned XP.

Technical Highlights:

- Smart Layered Encryption: Instead of encrypting massive datasets directly with Seal (which would be slow and expensive), I built a two-layer system. First, the dataset is encrypted with AES-256-CBC using a randomly generated key. Then, only that tiny 32-byte generated key gets encrypted with Seal and stored on-chain. The encrypted dataset lives on Walrus. This means you get the security of Seal's access control without the performance hit. it works just as fast for a 10KB file as it does for a 10GB one.

- Bulletproof Access Control: The seal_approve function in the smart contract verifies three things before anyone can decrypt: the file fingerprint matches, they own the correct AccessCap NFT, and they're the original buyer (not someone who bought a transferred NFT). Even if you sell your AccessCap, the new owner can't decrypt the dataset.

- Real-World Architecture: This isn't just a prototype. I built a full production stack with TanStack Start for the frontend, a custom indexer that parses BCS data and syncs blockchain events to SQLite, and comprehensive test coverage across the smart contract. Everything is optimized for speed and responsiveness.

- Cost-Effective Storage: Using Walrus Quilt to batch the encrypted dataset with an optional sample file cuts storage costs by 400x and gas fees by 238x for small files. Creators can provide previews without breaking the bank.

This isn't just a hackathon project, it's a real-world application built with production-grade architecture.

NOTE : Nabu is a working product 100%, everything works as intended end-to-end, from datasets uploads, originality checks, encrytion with Seal, buying, creator payment, XP distribution, downloading from Walrus to managing of datasets

KIZUNA is a fan-first project that turns your ONE Championship fandom into a living dNFT.
Every action a fan takes—watching live events and minting Techniques, attending venues and collecting Stamps, registering Favorites, hanging out in the KIZUNA Plaza, and playing a light battle game—feeds into a Soulbound Avatar whose Aura evolves in three stages. At a glance, your avatar shows how deep your connection to ONE really is.

After connecting a wallet, users mint a non-transferable Avatar SBT by choosing a visual template. During live streams, a time-limited passcode lets them mint special Techniques into a locker and equip up to seven of them for use in the GAME page’s rock–paper–scissors style Technique Battle. At physical events, scanning venue QR codes mints venue-exclusive Stamps onto the avatar, building a visible history of which shows they actually attended. In the KIZUNA Plaza, avatars enter with their Aura level, stamps, and favorites on display, enabling local chat, emotes based on techniques, and lightweight one-turn battles between fans and even fighters.

On the technical side, KIZUNA uses Sui Move and Dynamic Object Fields to model Avatars, Techniques, Stamps, Favorites, and optional Battle records on-chain, making a fan’s history verifiable and portable. Visual assets (avatar templates and aura variants) live as blobs on Walrus, while the Move contract only stores Walrus Blob IDs and Aura state, so changing an avatar’s look is as simple as updating a blob reference. Seal is reserved for future encrypted content, such as VIP photos that only specific wallets can decrypt.
By combining Sui, Walrus, and Seal, KIZUNA aims to be a fan OS for ONE Championship—where your support, attendance, and play are not just remembered, but encoded directly into the evolution of your dNFT avatar.

MoveAS - Privacy-Preserving Attestation System with Decentralized Storage

Project Description


MoveAS is a decentralized attestation service platform built on Sui blockchain. Attestations are on-chain credential systems, similar to digital certificates or diplomas, used to prove that an entity (such as a person or organization) possesses certain attributes or qualifications, such as educational credentials, professional certifications, identity verification, etc.

These attestations are created by trusted issuers (Attestors) and issued to recipients (Recipients), forming verifiable on-chain credentials.

Traditional attestation systems face two major challenges: first, all data must be stored on the blockchain, significantly increasing storage costs as data volume grows; second, there is a lack of privacy protection mechanisms, making sensitive information visible to everyone.

This integration adds Walrus decentralized storage and Seal privacy protection, providing users with flexible storage options and robust privacy capabilities: users can choose to store data on-chain or off-chain (Walrus), reducing costs while protecting data privacy; sensitive data can be encrypted using Seal Identity-Based Encryption (IBE) technology, ensuring only authorized users can decrypt and view the data.



Core Features:

  1. Dual Storage Modes: Users can choose between on-chain or off-chain (Walrus) storage

  2. Privacy Protection: Integrated Seal Identity-Based Encryption (IBE), enabling encrypted storage of attestation data

  3. Data Integrity: On-chain Blake2b-256 hash storage ensures data immutability

  4. Provably Authentic: Complete provenance chain verifies data origin and ownership


Innovation Points

  1. Flexible Hybrid Storage Architecture

  • Dual storage support in attestation services

  • Users can freely choose storage based on data size, privacy needs, and cost considerations

  • Optimized cost structure: on-chain for small data, off-chain for large data

  1. First Encrypted Attestation Data Storage Solution

  • Deep integration of Seal Identity-Based Encryption (IBE) technology

  • First implementation of end-to-end encrypted storage for attestation data

  • Private Data pattern implementation with access control via on-chain policies (only the Recipient of the Attestation can decrypt)

  • Encrypted data stored on Walrus, decryption keys managed by Seal Key Servers, achieving truly decentralized privacy protection

  1. Data Minimization & Compliance

  • Only metadata, hashes, and references stored on-chain, achieving data minimization

  • Supports GDPR/HIPAA compliance requirements

  • Sensitive data stays off-chain, reducing privacy leak risks

  1. Complete Developer Toolchain

  • Comprehensive TypeScript SDK for easy integration

  • Unified Codec (encoder/decoder) supporting complex data structures

  • Full-stack support: frontend, backend, and smart contracts


Project Advantages

  1. Technical Advancement

  • Combines three major tech stacks: Sui blockchain, Walrus storage, Seal encryption

  • Employs cutting-edge cryptography including Identity-Based Encryption (IBE)

  • Smart contracts written in Move language for safety and reliability

  1. High Practicality

  • Solves real pain points: high on-chain storage costs, insufficient privacy protection

  • Applicable to multiple scenarios: identity verification, academic credentials, medical records, enterprise qualifications, etc.

  • Complete frontend and backend implementation, ready for deployment

  1. Excellent User Experience

  • Clean and intuitive web interface

  • One-click creation of encrypted attestations

  • Seamless decryption and access workflow

  • Automatic storage type detection, no manual handling required

Delphi: Binary Prediction Markets on Sui


Delphi is a decentralized prediction market platform built on the Sui blockchain that enables users to create and trade binary markets on crypto price predictions. The platform combines Automated Market Making (AMM) with Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) oracles to provide verifiable, trustless market creation and resolution.

Live Testnet Application: https://delphimarket.wal.app/

Demo Video: https://youtu.be/e_NOJoVdunI


OVERVIEW

Delphi allows anyone to create binary prediction markets (Yes/No questions) about cryptocurrency prices, such as:

  • "Will Bitcoin price be higher than $100,000 at the closing of 11-12-2025?"

  • "Will Ethereum price be less than or equal to $5,000 on 15-01-2026?"

Note: Cryptocurrency price predictions are the initial supported market type. The platform is designed to expand and support a wide variety of prediction markets in the future, including traditional assets, sports, events, and more.

Users can trade shares representing their beliefs, with prices dynamically adjusting based on market sentiment through the Logarithmic Market Scoring Rule (LMSR) AMM mechanism.


KEY FEATURES


  • - Verifiable Market Creation: All markets are verified by a TEE oracle (AWS Nitro Enclave) before creation, ensuring questions are valid and answerable

  • - Automated Market Making: LMSR-based AMM provides continuous liquidity and dynamic pricing based on market sentiment

  • - Trustless Resolution: Market outcomes are verified on-chain using cryptographically signed responses from the TEE oracle

  • - Collective Intelligence: Early correct predictions and contrarian positions are rewarded more, incentivizing accurate forecasting

  • - Transparent & Auditable: All enclave code is publicly verifiable, and market data is on-chain

  • - Decentralized Frontend: The frontend is hosted on Walrus Sites ensuring it is verifiable, freely accessible to anyone, and resistant to censorship.


VALUE PROPOSITION


Delphi incentivizes collective intelligence by:

  • - Rewarding early accurate predictions: Users who correctly predict outcomes early receive higher returns

  • - Encouraging contrarian positions: Betting against the crowd when correct yields greater rewards

  • - Providing market insights: The dynamic pricing mechanism reveals collective market sentiment in real-time

  • - Ensuring trust: TEE oracle verification guarantees that market outcomes are based on verifiable, tamper-proof data


HOW IT WORKS


  1. 1. Market Creation
    Anyone can format a question about a crypto price prediction. The question is sent to the TEE oracle (Nitro Enclave), which:
    - Validates that the coin is supported
    - Confirms the question format is valid
    - Returns the question data with a cryptographic signature
    - The signed data is then submitted to the Sui smart contract, which verifies the signature against the registered enclave public key and PCRs before creating the market.

  2. 2. Trading Phase
    Once created, users can:
    - Buy YES shares if they believe the prediction will be true
    - Buy NO shares if they believe the prediction will be false
    - Sell shares at any time before the market freezes
    The AMM automatically adjusts prices based on the ratio of YES/NO shares:
    - 50/50 split → equal prices (~0.5 per share)
    - More YES shares → YES becomes more expensive, NO becomes cheaper
    - More NO shares → NO becomes more expensive, YES becomes cheaper
    This dynamic pricing reflects the collective market sentiment and provides insights into the probability of each outcome.

  3. 3. Market Freeze
    Trading stops at a predetermined time before the resolution date, preventing last-minute manipulation.

  4. 4. Market Resolution
    When the resolution time arrives, any user can:
    - Query the TEE oracle for the answer to the question
    - Receive the closing price data with a cryptographic signature
    - Submit the signed resolution to the smart contract
    The contract verifies the signature and resolves the market, determining the winning outcome (YES or NO).

  5. 5. Payout Distribution
    After resolution:
    - Winning side holders share the entire collateral pool pro-rata based on their share holdings
    - Losing side holders receive nothing
    This creates a pari-mutuel style pool where early correct predictions and contrarian positions (when most traders bet the opposite) are rewarded more than latecomers.

    Development Note: During this initial Proof of Concept (PoC) phase, more relaxed rules are applied to facilitate testing:
    - Markets can be created for past prices (allowing immediate testing of resolution)
    - No freezing period is enforced (trading continues until resolution)
    These restrictions will be properly enforced in production to ensure market integrity.


ARCHITECTURE


Delphi consists of three main components:

  1. 1. TEE Oracle (Rust/Nitro Enclave/Nautilus): Validates questions, fetches crypto price data from external APIs, and provides cryptographically signed responses. The enclave code is publicly verifiable through reproducible builds.

  2. 2. Sui Smart Contract (Move): Implements the LMSR AMM, manages market lifecycle, verifies enclave signatures, and handles share trading and payouts.

  3. 3. Frontend (React/TypeScript): Provides a user-friendly interface for creating markets, trading shares, and resolving markets. Live at: https://delphimarket.wal.app/.
    The frontend is hosted on Walrus Sites, which provides several key benefits:

    - No server management: Publishing doesn't require managing servers or complex configurations
    - Ownership & control: The site is owned by a Sui address and can be updated, exchanged, or shared like any Sui object
    - Censorship resistance: Thanks to Walrus's decentralization and high data availability, the site cannot be taken down or wiped
    - Verifiable & accessible: Anyone can verify the site contents and access it freely through any Walrus portal
    - Human-readable names: Leverages SuiNS naming system for memorable domain names

Development Note: During the initial development phase, a pseudo-enclave API and corresponding Move contract are used instead of a full AWS Nitro Enclave deployment. This allows for easier testing and development without the additional infrastructure costs and complexity. The pseudo-enclave maintains the same interface and signature verification logic, making it a drop-in replacement for testing purposes.

TECHNICAL FOUNDATION


Delphi is built on top of Nautilus (https://docs.sui.io/concepts/cryptography/nautilus), Sui's framework for verifiable off-chain computation. The TEE oracle uses AWS Nitro Enclaves with reproducible builds, allowing anyone to verify that the running code matches the public repository.

For more details on Nautilus, see the Nautilus documentation: https://docs.sui.io/concepts/cryptography/nautilus/nautilus-design

HydraProtocol - Decentralized Privacy-Preserving Data Marketplace

A blockchain-powered platform for secure data trading and zero-knowledge computation

🌟 Overview

HydraProtocol is a decentralized data marketplace built on the Sui blockchain that enables privacy-preserving data sharing and computation. Data owners can monetize their sensitive data while maintaining full privacy, and data consumers can perform verifiable computations without accessing raw data.

The platform combines Zero-Knowledge Proofs, homomorphic-style encrypted computation, and decentralized storage to create a trustless environment for data commerce.

🎯 Problem Statement

Traditional data marketplaces face critical challenges:

  • Privacy Risks: Raw data exposure during sharing or computation

  • Trust Issues: Buyers must trust sellers; sellers must trust buyers

  • Verification Gap: No way to verify computation results without accessing data

  • Centralization: Single points of failure and control

HydraProtocol solves these problems through cryptographic guarantees and blockchain verification.

✨ Core Features

🔐 End-to-End Encryption

  • All data encrypted with AES-256-GCM before upload

  • Symmetric keys protected by X25519 ECDH key exchange

  • Private keys secured in browser IndexedDB with password encryption

✅ Zero-Knowledge Proofs

  • Compute statistics on encrypted data using Groth16 ZK-SNARKs

  • Supported computations:

    • Average: Calculate mean without revealing individual values

    • Threshold Queries: Count values above/below threshold

    • Batch Processing: Handle 100+ data points with proof aggregation

  • All proofs verified on-chain before accepting results

⚡ Scalable Batch Computation

  • Innovative batch + aggregation circuit design

  • Process large datasets (100+ points) efficiently

  • Multi-layer Poseidon hashing for circuit compatibility

  • Automatic batching with configurable batch sizes

💰 Decentralized Marketplace

  • List encrypted data for sale with custom pricing

  • Automatic encrypted key distribution to buyers

  • On-chain purchase records and access control

  • No intermediaries or trusted third parties

🗄️ Decentralized Storage

  • Encrypted data stored on Walrus (Sui's decentralized storage)

  • Content-addressed with blob IDs

  • Permanent availability and redundancy

  • No single point of failure

🔑 Secure Key Management

  • Uploader: Keys encrypted and stored in IndexedDB

  • Buyer: Keys obtained via ECDH key exchange

  • Automatic Distribution: Sellers can auto-distribute keys to buyers

  • Migration Support: Legacy localStorage keys auto-migrated

🏗️ Technical Architecture

Smart Contracts (Sui Move)

1. Data Registry

  • Register encrypted datasets with metadata

  • Link to Walrus blob IDs

  • Store user X25519 public keys for key exchange

  • Emit events for data uploads and key registrations

2. Marketplace

  • Create data listings with prices

  • Process purchases and payments

  • Manage access permissions

  • Track distributed encryption keys

3. ZKP Verifier

  • Register verification keys for circuits

  • Verify Groth16 proofs on-chain

  • Store computation results as NFT-like objects

  • Link results to source data and proofs

🔄 Complete Workflow

Phase 1: Data Upload (Seller)

1. Select file → 2. Encrypt (AES-256-GCM) → 3. Upload to Walrus
                                                     ↓
4. ← Get Blob ID ← 5. Register on Sui ← 6. Store Key (IndexedDB)

Details:

  • Generate random 256-bit AES key

  • Encrypt file with AES-GCM (random IV prepended)

  • Upload to Walrus via HTTPS API

  • Calculate SHA-256 hash of original file

  • Register DataRecord on-chain (blob_id, hash, metadata)

  • Encrypt and store symmetric key in IndexedDB

Phase 2: List for Sale (Seller)

1. Set price → 2. Create listing → 3. Publish on marketplace

Phase 3: Purchase (Buyer)

1. Browse marketplace → 2. Purchase listing → 3. Pay SUI tokens
                                                      ↓
4. Receive access ← 5. Seller distributes key ← 6. ECDH exchange

Key Distribution Process:

  • Seller reads buyer's X25519 public key from chain

  • Generates ephemeral X25519 key pair

  • Computes shared secret: ECDH(seller_private, buyer_public)

  • Encrypts AES key: AES-GCM(symmetric_key, shared_secret)

  • Submits encrypted package on-chain

  • Buyer decrypts: shared_secret = ECDH(buyer_private, seller_public_ephemeral)

Phase 4: Compute on Data

1. Download encrypted data → 2. Decrypt with key → 3. Generate ZK proof
                                                              ↓
4. ← Verification result ← 5. Submit to chain ← 6. Verify proof

ZK Computation Flow:

  • Parse decrypted CSV/JSON data

  • Prepare circuit inputs (field elements)

  • Generate proof using browser WASM (SnarkJS)

  • Extract public signals (result commitment)

  • Submit proof + signals to blockchain

  • Smart contract verifies against registered VK

  • Result stored as verifiable computation record

🚀 Innovation Highlights

1. Browser-Based ZKP Generation

  • No server required: All proof generation in browser

  • SnarkJS + WASM: Fast witness calculation

  • Circom circuits: Custom circuit design for data statistics

  • Groth16: Small proof size (~256 bytes)

2. Batch Aggregation Architecture

Input: 200 data points
  ↓
Batch 1 [100 pts] → Batch Proof 1 (avg, count, commitment)
Batch 2 [100 pts] → Batch Proof 2 (avg, count, commitment)
  ↓
Aggregation Circuit → Final Proof (weighted average, total count)
  ↓
Single on-chain verification

Benefits:

  • Handle unlimited dataset sizes

  • O(1) verification cost regardless of input size

  • Parallelizable proof generation

  • Efficient gas usage on-chain

3. Multi-Layer Poseidon Hashing

  • Circumvents Circom's 16-input limit for Poseidon hash

  • Hierarchical hashing for large input arrays

  • Maintains security while enabling batch processing

4. Hybrid Key Management

  • Secure storage with IndexedDB

  • Password-based key derivation (PBKDF2)

  • ECDH for key distribution

  • Backward compatibility with localStorage

🛠️ Technology Stack

Frontend

  • Framework: Next.js 16 (React 19, TypeScript)

  • Styling: TailwindCSS 4, shadcn/ui components

  • Blockchain: @mysten/sui.js, @suiet/wallet-kit

  • Cryptography:

    • Web Crypto API (AES-GCM, PBKDF2)

    • @noble/curves (X25519 ECDH)

    • SnarkJS (ZK proof generation)

  • Storage: IndexedDB, Walrus API

  • Data Processing: XLSX, CSV parsing

Smart Contracts

  • Language: Sui Move

  • Modules:

    • data_registry: Dataset registration

    • market: Marketplace logic

    • zkp_verifier: Proof verification

Zero-Knowledge Circuits

  • Language: Circom

  • Hash Function: Poseidon

  • Proof System: Groth16

  • Ceremony: Powers of Tau (2^16)

  • Circuits:

    • average.circom: Basic average (≤10 inputs)

    • threshold.circom: Threshold counting (≤10 inputs)

    • batch_average.circom: Batch average (100 inputs)

    • aggregation.circom: Aggregate batch results (100 batches)

    • batch_threshold.circom: Batch threshold counting

    • threshold_aggregation.circom: Aggregate threshold results

Infrastructure

  • Blockchain: Sui Testnet

  • Storage: Walrus Testnet

  • Deployment: Vercel

📊 Use Cases

Healthcare

  • Share anonymized patient data for research

  • Compute statistics without revealing individual records

  • HIPAA-compliant data sharing

Finance

  • Share transaction patterns for fraud detection

  • Compute aggregates without exposing sensitive data

  • Regulatory compliance

IoT/Sensors

  • Sell IoT sensor data securely

  • Verify data quality before purchase

  • Privacy-preserving analytics

AI/ML

  • Share training datasets securely

  • Verify data statistics for model training

  • Fair data compensation

🔒 Security Features

  • End-to-End Encryption: Data never exposed in plaintext

  • Zero-Knowledge Proofs: Computation correctness guaranteed

  • On-Chain Verification: Tamper-proof result storage

  • Decentralized Storage: No single point of failure

  • Key Isolation: Private keys never leave user's browser

  • Cryptographic Commitment: Results bound to specific data

🏆 Achievements

  • ✅ Full-stack decentralized data marketplace

  • ✅ Browser-based ZK proof generation

  • ✅ Batch computation for 100+ data points

  • ✅ End-to-end encrypted data pipeline

  • ✅ On-chain proof verification

  • ✅ Automated key distribution

  • ✅ Production-ready deployment

• Your Health, Your Data, Secured by Blockchain

  • Privacy-First AI Wellness Tracking

  • Decentralized Health Insights for a Better You

  • Wellness Journal: Track. Analyze. Own

Atrium is a decentralized creator platform where creators can publish essays and videos within their spaces.

What makes it unique is an AI Weather System that uses LLM-driven decisions to transform each space’s atmosphere based on crypto market data, real-world time, and subscriber count.

AI lowers the barrier to creation, but we believe the true value lies in connection and co‑creation—building community bonds through interactive objects to create meaningful collaborative experiences.

SuiSign lets you upload, encrypt, and sign any legal document using your Sui wallet. Your file is sealed with cryptographic encryption Seal, stored on decentralized storage Walrus, and signed immutably on the Sui blockchain.
Watch the pitch video here

PromptMarket lets creators upload prompts or LoRA artifacts to Walrus decentralized storage and list them for sale on Sui.

All assets are stored as Seal-encrypted blobs, ensuring that Walrus only ever holds ciphertext.

Buyers purchase on-chain with SUI and instantly receive a Walrus blob link together with an authorization proof.

Using the Seal workflow, the client retrieves the encrypted blob, obtains the decryption key only after on-chain authorization, and decrypts the content locally in the browser—ensuring plaintext never leaves the user’s device.

This design cleanly separates public storage (Walrus) from ownership, pricing, and access control (Sui), enabling trust-minimized transactions, tamper-proof provenance, and secure delivery of high-value prompt assets.

Before purchase, only a short summary is visible; the full content remains sealed and protected.

DataForge is a decentralized data marketplace designed to solve one of the biggest problems faced by developers, startups, researchers, and AI builders in Africa and beyond — access to reliable, tamper-proof, and openly accessible datasets.

Today, most high-value datasets are:

  • locked behind paywalls,

  • siloed within organizations,

  • unverifiable or manipulated,

  • or completely unavailable to students, innovators, and AI developers.

This creates a major barrier for building credible AI models, launching data-driven startups, or conducting research.

DataForge addresses this problem by leveraging the Sui blockchain and Walrus decentralized storage to create a transparent, permanent, and trustless marketplace for datasets.

🔍 How DataForge Works

  • Users upload datasets through a smooth Next.js interface.

  • Files are stored on Walrus, guaranteeing decentralized, persistent, and censorship-resistant storage.

  • Metadata is structured on-chain to ensure verifiable provenance and prevent data tampering.

  • A wallet-based identity layer (Mysten WalletKit) ensures every dataset is linked to a real, on-chain account.

  • Consumers can explore and interact with datasets through an intuitive UI.

🚀 What Makes DataForge Unique

Unlike traditional data platforms, DataForge is:

  • Decentralized: No central entity controls or modifies stored data.

  • Verifiable: Every dataset has a transparent audit trail via on-chain metadata.

  • Affordable: Uses testnet infrastructure to drastically reduce data publication costs.

  • Built for innovation: Designed for student researchers, AI engineers, hackathons, and builders who need accessible and trustworthy datasets.

🌍 Impact

DataForge empowers:

  • student innovation (research projects, hackathon prototypes, ML training),

  • startups building data-driven applications,

  • developers needing clean and reliable datasets,

  • AI teams requiring reproducible and transparent inputs.

It lowers the barrier for anyone to publish, access, and collaborate on trusted data without relying on closed institutions or expensive proprietary datasets.

WalrusDB is a developer-friendly SDK that makes advanced data security simple for any application. It combines Walrus’ verifiable storage with Seal’s powerful encryption into clean, intuitive functions that developers can use without needing to understand cryptography or blockchain. The SDK lets developers encrypt data, store it securely, and verify its integrity with just a few lines of code. It works seamlessly for both Web2 and Web3 apps, helping teams protect user data, prevent tampering, and meet privacy requirements without added complexity. In short, it turns difficult security patterns into ready-to-use tools for everyday developers.


The SDK is built for usability, even for developers with no Web3 or cryptographic background. Instead of managing keys or writing complex encryption logic, developers simply call high-level functions like encryptWithPatternPrivateDataAndStoreOnChain, decryptFromPrivateDataObject, or encryptWithPatternAllowListAndReturnBytes. Everything else runs automatically behind the scenes. This makes it ideal for secure messaging, file storage, user data protection, logs, and audit trails. It works across web, mobile, backend, and cloud environments with minimal setup. The SDK also introduces a predefined schema system—similar to Prisma or TypeORM—that structures how encrypted data is stored on Walrus, unlocking an entirely new, developer-friendly way to build secure applications.
