STARFISH 🌟 Voice Data Marketplace

Decentralized marketplace for voice recordings with encrypted storage, provable ownership, and fair creator incentives

🌊 What is STARFISH?

StarFish is a fully decentralized, non-custodial marketplace for voice data where users can securely monetize their voice recordings through encrypted data subscriptions. Built on Sui blockchain with Seal encryption, the platform enables creators to Record voice datasets in various languages and dialects, which are encrypted and stored on Walrus decentralized storage.

🚫 No Backend. No Servers. No Custody. Everything runs on-chain and on decentralized infrastructure—there's no central server that can be shut down, no company holding your data, and no middleman taking cuts.

Buyers can purchase time-limited subscriptions to access these datasets, with payments going directly to creators. The system uses advanced cryptographic access control to ensure only authorized subscribers can decrypt and download the voice data, creating a trustless marketplace for AI training data, voice cloning, and linguistic research while maintaining complete privacy and security through end-to-end encryption.


Built for the Data Economy/Marketplaces track using Sui blockchain, Walrus decentralized storage, and Seal encryption.


🎯 The Problem


Voice data is critical for AI training, language preservation, and accessibility tools—yet current markets are broken:

  1. Centralized platforms exploit creators - Big tech collects voice data with minimal compensation

  2. No provable ownership - Creators can't prove they contributed specific datasets

  3. Languages are disappearing - 40% of the world's 7,000 languages are endangered, with no economic incentive to preserve them

  4. Quality is inconsistent - No mechanism to incentivize high-quality, properly categorized recordings

  5. Voice data is hard to find - Categorized, high-quality voice datasets are scattered and difficult to discover

💡 Our Solution: STARFISH

A decentralized voice data marketplace where:

  • Creators own their data with on-chain proof of contribution

  • Encryption protects content until purchase (Seal threshold encryption)

  • Immutable storage on Walrus ensures data persistence

  • Language creators earn discounts - incentivizing new language/dialect additions

  • Dynamic pricing based on recording duration and subscription length

🎙️ Why Voice Data on STARFISH is Different

Unlike scraped or crowd-sourced voice data, STARFISH provides:

  • Structured Categories - Voice data organized by language, dialect, and duration—easy to find exactly what you need

  • In-App Recording Only - Users must record directly on the platform with guided sample texts—no uploading random files, ensuring consistent quality

  • High-Quality Datasets - Standardized recording interface with waveform visualization reduces low-quality submissions

  • Curated Sample Texts - Each language includes reading material contributed by native speakers for guided recording

  • Provenance Tracking - Every recording has on-chain attribution to the original creator

This is the first voice data marketplace that enforces quality through a record-only model—you can't upload pre-existing files, only create fresh recordings through our interface.


💯 Fully Decentralized Stack



Layer | Technology | Decentralized?

---------------------|------------------|-------------------------

Smart Contract | Sui Blockchain | ✅ On-chain

Data Storage | Walrus | ✅ Decentralized blobs

Encryption | Seal | ✅ Threshold cryptography

Access Control | Smart Contract | ✅ On-chain verification

Payments | SUI tokens | ✅ Direct to creators

Backend Server | None | ✅ No backend needed

Custody | None | ✅ Non-custodial

Zero centralized infrastructure — the frontend is a static site that talks directly to the blockchain.


🔄 How It Works

Creator Flow: Anyone can permissionlessly add new language categories, dialects, and duration options to the platform—and if you create a language category, you earn a 20% lifetime discount on all purchases in that language. Creators then record voice samples directly in the browser (no file uploads allowed), reading from community-contributed sample texts. The recording is encrypted client-side using Seal, uploaded to Walrus decentralized storage, and published to the Sui blockchain as a marketplace listing.

Buyer Flow: Buyers browse the marketplace, filtering by language and dialect, with dynamic pricing displayed based on recording duration. They can purchase single subscriptions (1 day to 1 year) or bulk-purchase 2-10 datasets in one transaction. Payment in SUI goes directly to the creator with no middleman. Upon purchase, buyers receive a Subscription NFT that grants time-limited access to decrypt and download the voice data. When the subscription expires, access is revoked until renewed.

✨ Key Features

STARFISH combines several powerful mechanisms to create a fair, secure, and high-quality voice data marketplace:

On-Chain Categories — Languages, dialects, and durations are stored directly on the Sui blockchain, creating a community-curated, permissionless taxonomy that anyone can extend. The creator of each language category is recorded on-chain and receives permanent discount benefits.

Creator Incentives — Users who add new languages receive a 20% discount on all purchases within that language, forever. This encourages early contributors to expand the platform with rare and endangered languages, knowing they'll benefit from the ecosystem they help build.

Seal Encryption — All voice recordings are encrypted client-side using Seal's threshold encryption before upload. The data remains encrypted on Walrus storage, and only users with valid subscriptions can request decryption keys from the Seal network.

Dynamic Pricing — Prices scale automatically based on recording duration (30 seconds as base unit) and subscription length (1 day to 1 year). This creates fair, predictable pricing: longer recordings and longer access cost proportionally more.

Bulk Subscriptions — Buyers can purchase access to 2-10 datasets in a single transaction, streamlining acquisition for AI researchers who need diverse training data. Each dataset in the bulk purchase still pays its creator directly.

Time-Limited Access — Subscriptions are represented as on-chain objects with expiration timestamps. The smart contract verifies subscription validity before allowing decryption, ensuring creators continue earning from their work.


📊 Quality Incentives & Curation

For Producers (Voice Recorders)

  • Sample texts provided - Each language includes curated reading material

  • Duration options - Standardized lengths (30s, 1min, 5min) for consistent quality

  • On-chain reputation - Dataset history tied to wallet address

  • Record-only model - No file uploads allowed, only in-app recordings for quality assurance

For Consumers (AI Researchers, Developers)

  • Filter by language/dialect - Find exactly what you need

  • Subscription model - Try before committing long-term

  • Bulk purchase - Efficient acquisition for large training sets

  • Guaranteed format - All recordings follow the same quality standards

Community Curation

  • Anyone can add languages/dialects (permissionless)

  • Sample texts are community-contributed

  • Language creators become stakeholders with discount incentives



🔐 Security Model

  1. Threshold Encryption (Seal) - Data encrypted with 2-of-N threshold scheme

  2. On-Chain Access Control - Smart contract verifies subscription validity

  3. Time-Locked Access - Subscriptions expire, requiring renewal

  4. No Central Key Holder - Decryption keys distributed across Seal servers



🌍 Preserving Endangered Languages

STARFISH creates economic incentives for language preservation:

  1. First-mover advantage - Add a language, get permanent discounts

  2. Community sample texts - Native speakers contribute reading material

  3. Immutable storage - Recordings persist on Walrus regardless of platform

  4. Open access model - Anyone can record, anyone can purchase

"Every two weeks a language dies. STARFISH ensures voices are preserved forever."



🏆 Hackathon Submission

Track: Data Economy/Marketplaces

Key Innovations:

  1. Fully decentralized - No backend servers, no custody, everything on-chain

  2. Creator incentive model - Language creators get permanent discounts

  3. Encrypted-until-purchase - Seal threshold encryption protects content

  4. Immutable preservation - Walrus ensures data survives platform changes

  5. On-chain provenance - Every recording has verifiable creator attribution

  6. Record-only approach - No file uploads, only in-app recordings for guaranteed quality

The Problem: Locked Capital and Limited Reusability

Walrus storage faces a critical liquidity problem: once users purchase storage, there's no mechanism to recover funds if their needs change. A developer who bought storage for a project that got cancelled? That capital is locked. A business that over-estimated their storage needs? No refunds, no resale.

Even worse, existing storage is extremely difficult to reuse due to operational limitations. The constraints on what you can do with already-purchased storage make it nearly impossible to repurpose allocations for different use cases or transfer them efficiently.

This creates three critical pain points:

  • 💸 Zero liquidity - No way to monetize unused storage or recover investment

  • 🔒 Operational constraints - Severe limitations on reusing existing storage allocations

  • ⚡ Capital inefficiency - Money locked in storage that can't be recovered or repurposed

The fundamental flaw: Walrus has no secondary market. Storage is a one-way purchase with no exit strategy, and the technical limitations make it extremely difficult to adapt existing storage to new needs.

The Solution: A Peer-to-Peer Storage Marketplace

Storewave is the first decentralized secondary marketplace for Walrus storage resources on Sui. We enable users to buy and sell pre-existing storage allocations, creating liquidity and price discovery in the Walrus ecosystem.

Think eBay for decentralized storage - users with unused storage can recoup costs by selling excess capacity, while buyers get storage at market-driven prices, often 20-40% cheaper than purchasing new from the system.

How It Works:

  1. Sellers list unused storage with custom pricing

  2. Our optimizer finds the cheapest combination of marketplace listings + new storage

  3. Buyers save money with automatic cost optimization

  4. Smart contracts execute trades trustlessly and atomically

  5. Everyone wins - sellers recoup costs, buyers save money, network utilizes resources efficiently

🚀 Top Features That Make Storewave Revolutionary

1. Intelligent Cost Optimizer

Our proprietary algorithm compares four different strategies to find the absolute cheapest way to acquire storage:

  • Greedy marketplace selection

  • Dynamic programming optimization

  • Hybrid marketplace + system approach

  • Pure system baseline

Result: Users always get the best deal, automatically.

2. Programmable Transaction Blocks (PTB)

Complex multi-step operations execute atomically:

Buy from 3 marketplace listings → Split storage → 
Reserve additional from system → Fuse into single object → 
Transfer to buyer

All in one transaction. All or nothing. No partial failures.

3. Smart Fallback System

If marketplace operations fail (congestion, insufficient listings, etc.):

  • Automatic fallback to system-only purchase

  • Transaction never fails

  • User always gets their storage

Reliability meets optimization.

📦 The Storewave SDK: Power in Your Hands

We didn't just build a marketplace - we built an ecosystem. The Storewave SDK lets any developer integrate our optimization engine into their applications.

SDK Features:

console.log(`Save ${cost.savingsPercentage}% vs system!`);

  • Query listings by seller, price, size

  • Get wallet storage and blob objects

  • Check WAL balances

  • Automatic coin management (merge, split, transfer)

🛡️ Built-In Safety:

  • Dry-run simulation before execution

  • Automatic fallback if marketplace fails

  • Type-safe TypeScript interfaces

  • Comprehensive error handling

  • Network configuration management

🌐 Universal Compatibility:

  • Works in Node.js servers

  • ESM and CommonJS support

  • Full TypeScript definitions

SDK Impact:

The SDK transforms Storewave from a standalone marketplace into a platform. Developers can:

  • Build storage-optimized dApps

  • Create automated storage management tools

  • Integrate marketplace pricing into analytics

  • Build storage arbitrage bots

  • Add Storewave to existing Walrus applications

Published on npm as storewave-sdk - ready to use today.

💎 Why Storewave Matters

Real Innovation:

  • First secondary marketplace for Walrus storage

  • First dual-splitting mechanism (time + size)

  • First optimization algorithm comparing marketplace vs system

  • First production SDK for storage marketplace integration

Real Value:

  • For Users: 20-40% cost savings on storage

  • For Sellers: Monetize unused capacity and recover locked capital

  • For Network: Better resource utilization and liquidity

  • For Developers: Easy integration via SDK

🏆 What We've Built

✅ Smart Contracts - Deployed on Sui testnet
✅ Backend API - Real-time indexing + optimization
✅ Web Frontend - Full marketplace UI
✅ TypeScript SDK - Published to npm
✅ Documentation - Complete technical docs
✅ Testing - Algorithm validation with multiple scenarios

The Bottom Line

Storewave solves a real problem that every Walrus user faces: locked capital and limited storage reusability. We built a complete ecosystem - marketplace, optimizer, SDK - that makes decentralized storage more liquid, more affordable, and more accessible.

This is the infrastructure the Walrus ecosystem needs.

Project Overview

Sui-DAT (Sui Decentralized AI Training) is a revolutionary platform that democratizes AI training by enabling distributed machine learning across participants' computers instead of centralized data centers. Built for the Walrus Haulout Hackathon - AI x Data Track, this project leverages the Sui blockchain and Walrus storage to create truly decentralized AI that trains across distributed compute and stores intermediaries on-chain.

Key Features

  • Decentralized Training: Distributes model training across multiple participants

  • Blockchain Integration: Uses Sui blockchain for secure operations and transparent reward distribution

  • Walrus Storage: Utilizes Walrus decentralized storage for model data and gradients

  • Collaborative Learning: Allows multiple participants to contribute to the same model

  • Reputation System: Tracks and rewards contributors based on their contributions

  • Real-time Monitoring: Provides tracking of training progress and performance metrics

  • Web-based Interface: Offers a user-friendly dashboard for managing training sessions

Technology Stack

Backend

  • FastAPI (Python web framework)

  • MongoDB (NoSQL database)

  • Sui SDK (blockchain integration)

  • Walrus Client (decentralized storage)

Frontend

  • Next.js (React-based web framework)

  • TypeScript (type-safe JavaScript)

  • Tailwind CSS (utility-first CSS framework)

  • Shadcn UI (component library)

  • React Flow (workflow visualization)

Blockchain

  • Sui (high-performance blockchain)

  • Walrus (decentralized storage system)

Architecture

The platform follows a microservices architecture with these main components:

  1. Frontend - Next.js web interface for user interactions

  2. Backend - FastAPI service handling business logic and API endpoints

  3. Smart Contracts - Sui Move contracts managing on-chain operations

  4. Storage - Walrus for decentralized file storage

How It Works

  1. Model Creation: Models are registered on the Sui blockchain

  2. Participant Registration: Contributors join training sessions

  3. Distributed Training: Participants train on local data and submit gradients

  4. Gradient Aggregation: The system aggregates gradients from multiple participants

  5. Model Updates: Updated models are stored on Walrus and tracked on-chain

  6. Reward Distribution: Contributors receive rewards based on their contributions

About ImHuman

ImHuman is a privacy-focused identity verification system designed for modern digital platforms using ZK, Ai, Walrus, Seal. Its goal is simple, to confirm that a user is real and unique without exposing personal information. This approach protects users while helping platforms prevent bots, fraud, and identity abuse.

The Problem imhuman Solves

  1. Excessive exposure of personal data: Most verification systems require sensitive information like ID documents, biometrics, phone numbers, or emails. Once leaked, this information cannot be taken back.

  2. Bot and Sybil attacks: Digital platforms, especially Web3, are flooded with fake accounts that exploit rewards, manipulate votes, or spam services.

  3. Outdated verification methods: Traditional KYC is invasive and doesn’t fit privacy-first environments. Users often only need to prove that they are “human” or “unique,” not reveal who they are.

Impact if the Problem Remains Unsolved

  • Platforms remain vulnerable to bot abuse and identity fraud

  • Massive data breaches continue to grow

  • User trust decreases due to constant data collection

  • Developers waste time building their own verification systems

  • Digital ecosystems become less reliable and more costly to maintain

Current Data Privacy and Security Risks

  • Large-scale identity leaks (national IDs, selfies, documents)

  • Device fingerprinting and hidden tracking

  • Centralized login systems that expose user databases

  • CAPTCHA systems that can be bypassed by machine learning models

  • KYC providers storing raw user data without strong encryption

These problems show that traditional identity systems are no longer enough.

How imhuman Addresses These Issues

  1. Privacy-preserving identity proofs: imhuman allows users to prove that they are real, unique, or eligible without revealing personal information. No names, no IDs, no phone numbers.

  2. Zero-knowledge approach: Verification is done through cryptographic proofs. The platform knows the proof is valid but never sees the underlying data.

  3. No sensitive data stored: Since verification happens through proofs, imhuman does not need to store identity details. This eliminates most risk of data leaks.

  4. Anti-Sybil mechanism: Each user generates a unique, anonymous identifier that prevents multiple identities, while still keeping the user fully private.

  5. AI analysis: Ai will analyze transactions made by users.

How ZK, Walrus, Seal, and AI Work Together?

ImHuman uniquely combines four cutting-edge technologies into a unified privacy-preserving identity verification system:

1. Zero-Knowledge (ZK) - The Privacy Foundation

- Uses ZKTLS Reclaim Protocol to generate cryptographic proofs of CEX verification

- Proves statements (e.g., "user is KYC verified") without revealing identity data

- Enables verification without data exposure - the cornerstone of privacy

2. AI - The Intelligence Layer

- Analyzes on-chain transaction patterns to detect human vs. bot behavior

- Generates humanity scores (0-100) based on behavioral analysis

- Provides defense-in-depth by detecting anomalies even with legitimate accounts

3. Walrus - The Decentralized Storage

- Stores encrypted verification credentials with persistence guarantees

- Uses Reed-Solomon erasure coding for redundancy

- Provides economic incentives for reliable storage without centralization

4. Seal - The Encryption Layer

- Encrypts all data before storage on Walrus

- User-controlled keys ensure only the user can decrypt

- Protects data even if storage nodes are compromised

The Integration Flow:

User Identity → ZK Proof (Privacy) → AI Analysis (Intelligence) → Seal Encryption (Security) → Walrus Storage (Persistence)

This combination ensures that ImHuman can verify humanity while maintaining complete privacy, leveraging AI for intelligent detection, and storing credentials securely and persistently on decentralized infrastructure.


The Problem ImHuman Solves

Excessive exposure of personal data: Most verification systems require sensitive information like ID documents, biometrics, phone numbers, or emails. Once leaked, this information cannot be taken back.

Bot and Sybil attacks: Digital platforms, especially Web3, are flooded with fake accounts that exploit rewards, manipulate votes, or spam services.

Outdated verification methods: Traditional KYC is invasive and doesn't fit privacy-first environments. Users often only need to prove that they are "human" or "unique," not reveal who they are.

How to use the app*

  1. - Install the Reclaim Verifier app from the App Store or Play Store.

  2. - Open the CEX Verify page.

  3. - Select Binance and tap Start verification.

  4. - Scan the barcode with your phone’s camera.

  5. - You’ll be redirected to the Reclaim Verifier app. Log in to Binance if asked.

  6. - Tap Share Data. This only shares the proof, not your personal data.

  7. - Once it’s successful, go to the Onchain Verify page.

  8. - Connect your wallet and bind it to your account.

  9. - Tap Analyze, then Wrap to JSON, and finally Submit to Walrus Testnet.

We decided to contribute to the ecosystem of SUI with the integration of Walrus mainly.

the integration relies on 2 main solutions:

1. Zelf Authenticator > which replicates the same functionality as google authenticator or any other tool that offers this solution but with our technology that will be explained down below.
2. Integrate into our Zelf Name Service the creation of .wal and .sui tag names that will enable the end-users to re-create the private key with your face, doing a liveness detection that is deep-fake resistant.

What is Zelf Name Service?

Zelf Name Service (ZNS) is a revolutionary way of seed phrase (mnemonic key) storage, with a cutting-edge privacy-preserving non-biometric encryption, enabling innovative wallet management to ensure security without storing or exposing biometric data. The end user's face generates a unique, non-biometric binary representation that we call ZelfProof, which facilitates highly secure encryption and decryption.

Unlike traditional biometric systems that store templates and are subject to breaches or misuse, Zelf ensures that no biometric data is ever retained. It is a fully privacy-preserving solution designed for the next generation of identity verification, proof of personhood, and secure access control.

What is Zelf Authenticator?

🚀 ProofChain — AI-Powered Media Verification + Immutable Sui Hash Registry

Fake media, AI-generated images, and manipulated documents are becoming one of the fastest-growing digital threats. Everyday people, institutions, journalists, researchers, and businesses struggle to tell real content from fabricated content.

Today:

  • Images are easily edited

  • AI-generated media is nearly indistinguishable

  • There is no easy way to prove the origin or authenticity of a digital file

  • Institutions have no universal system for document verification

This creates a critical gap in trust — especially in education, legal workflows, journalism, and secure corporate communication.

🔐 ProofChain solves this through a hybrid AI + blockchain verification system.

✔ AI detection

Each uploaded media file is analyzed using a custom AI pipeline to determine:

  • authenticity

  • manipulation traces

  • probability score

✔ On-chain integrity anchoring (Sui blockchain)

ProofChain generates a SHA-256 hash of the media before processing, then immutably stores the hash on the Sui blockchain via a custom Move module.

This creates:

  • tamper-proof verification

  • a permanent public proof

  • zero-ambiguity authenticity checking

✔ Decentralized certificate for every media item

Each verified item is minted as a blockchain-backed certificate with:

  • timestamp

  • confidence score

  • media signature hash

  • verification ID

✨ What Makes ProofChain Unique

Instant Trust
AI inference + blockchain immutability gives a double-layer verification system.

Tamper-Proof
Hashes cannot be modified once written on-chain.

Fast & Lightweight
Runs on a simple React UI, Express API, and optimized Move module.

Universal Use Cases

  • student document authentication

  • journalism image verification

  • legal document proof

  • HR onboarding fraud prevention

  • KYC document check

  • institutional record-keeping

🌎 Impact

ProofChain empowers:

  • institutions needing reliable identity & document verification

  • journalists fighting misinformation

  • students needing proof of originality

  • organizations working in security, compliance, and due diligence

By combining AI detection with blockchain-backed proof, ProofChain lowers the barrier for trustworthy verification in a world overwhelmed by synthetic media.

Wavein AI Verifier — Decentralized AI Verification System on Sui

This package contains the official demonstration assets for Wavein AI Verifier, an experimental decentralized verification framework that integrates artificial intelligence with the Sui blockchain to provide transparent, auditable, and tamper-resistant verification of user-generated data.

Project Overview

Wavein AI Verifier is designed to explore how AI-driven analysis and on-chain proof registration can enhance the trustworthiness of user interactions in decentralized environments. The system generates AI-based evaluations on the client side and records verification outcomes directly on-chain using a custom Move smart contract.

Key Technical Components

1. AI-Powered Client-Side Evaluation

The frontend interfaces with an external AI model through a secure API to analyze user inputs and generate verification results. All processing occurs client-side, ensuring no centralized backend is required.

2. On-Chain Proof Storage (Sui Move)

Verification outputs are submitted to the Sui blockchain and permanently stored through Move modules. This provides:

  • Immutable audit logs

  • Transparent verification history

  • Trustless record-keeping

3. Wallet-Based Authorization (Sui Wallet Kit)

Users connect their Sui wallet to sign and authorize verification submissions, ensuring that:

  • All actions are user-controlled

  • No custodial intermediaries are involved

  • Transactions remain verifiably authentic

4. Serverless, Decentralized Architecture

The entire system runs without traditional server infrastructure, relying on:

  • Client-side logic

  • Blockchain execution

  • External AI inference APIs

This reduces attack surfaces and emphasizes decentralization.

Purpose of This Upload

This submission is intended for:

  • Hackathon evaluation

  • Decentralized hosting on Walrus

  • Technical reference for judges and reviewers

It represents a functional prototype demonstrating the intersection of:

  • Artificial intelligence

  • Decentralized storage

  • Blockchain-based verification

  • User-centric on-chain interactions

Summary

Wavein AI Verifier demonstrates how AI can be combined with decentralized technologies to create a transparent, verifiable, and trust­worthy verification system. By eliminating centralized components and using Sui's Move-based on-chain logic, the project highlights a future where AI-powered verification is both decentralized and user-controlled.

INTRODUCTION:


Right now, most projects talk about “on-chain innovation,” but doesn't really focus on solving a real human problem — especially one common in emerging markets like Nigeria, Kenya, India, etc., where fake transfers and unverified payments are a huge issue.
So let’s integrate that perfectly into the POT abstract

Project Title:

Proof of Transaction (POT) — The On-Chain Truth Layer for Verifiable Payments and Real-World Trust

Abstract:

Proof of Transaction (POT) is a decentralized protocol that converts every payment into a verifiable, privacy-preserving proof of authenticity, bridging the gap between Web3 finance and real-world commerce.
In today’s world, merchants and users constantly face fake transfers, unverifiable receipts, and scam payments — especially in peer-to-peer and cross-border transactions. POT introduces a new on-chain “truth engine” that allows any party — individual, merchant, or dApp — to instantly verify the legitimacy of a transaction without exposing private data.
Built on Walrus and powered by zero-knowledge proofs (ZKPs), POT ensures every transaction carries an immutable cryptographic proof that can be referenced, shared, or audited in real time. This enables:

Local and global merchants to confirm payments before releasing goods or services.

Web3 payment apps and escrows to automate dispute resolution using verifiable data.

Developers to build new financial products on a trusted transaction layer.

Users to own and monetize their transaction data safely in the on-chain data economy.

POT lays the foundation for a world where trust in payments is guaranteed by cryptography, not screenshots — empowering a new era of transparent, scam-free digital commerce.
In essence, POT isn’t just proof of payment — it’s proof of truth.
 This version hits both angles:

The Web3 innovation side (ZKPs, verifiable data, Walrus).

The real-world application (local merchants, fake transfer prevention, verified payments).

Coeus Protocol — Permissionless Prediction Markets Engine


Coeus Protocol is a next-generation prediction-market infrastructure built for viral, high-engagement markets. It solves two core trust and liquidity problems that plague traditional protocols:

🤔 The Problems

- Liquidity transparency & fairness: Traditional markets rely on market-makers who often dominate outcome positions, leaving little for retail traders. Users may trust the quoted price but not believe the underlying probability genuinely reflects crowd conviction.

- Resolution infrastructure trust: Many oracles depend on centralized operators or economic-governance frameworks vulnerable to 51% attacks or ambiguous “text-rules”. Market creators publish text, not executable code — so users trust the text, but not a verifiable execution path.

🛠 The Coeus Mechanism

- Market creators publish resolution logic and a deadline to Walrus Protocol.

- Sensitive data (API keys, secrets) are sealed and never publicly exposed.

- At the deadline, the execution engine (leveraging Nautilus Framework in a trusted-execution environment) retrieves the logic + secrets, runs the code, and publishes the result on-chain.

- Users deposit funds into one or more outcome-pools (they may buy multiple outcomes). Funds are locked in.

- Each outcome’s share is priced via a bonding-curve: early entrants pay less, later entrants pay more — rewarding early conviction.

- Upon resolution: all losing-pools payoff the single winning-pool. Users holding the winning pool receive a share proportional to their weight. No market-maker, no intermediaries, no wash trading.

🎯 Why It Matters

- Truly permissionless — Anyone can create a market, publish resolution logic and launch it.

- End-to-end verifiable — Logic is public, execution is attested, settlement is on-chain.

- Fair liquidity dynamic — Bonding-curve pricing aligns incentives: early believers gain more, late entries still participate without egregious dilution.

- Resilient infrastructure — Sealed secrets + TEE execution + decentralized storage eliminate single-point-of-trust failure.

Coeus Protocol enables prediction markets where you don’t just trust the numbers—you verify the code, execution and settlement.

Archimeters is a parametric 3D design platform and marketplace built on the Sui blockchain. Creators can upload custom three.js 3D algorithms, and users can generate personalized designs through parameter adjustments and mint them as NFTs. This hackathon adds support for abstract 3D (non-printable objects) and implements complete data trading and encryption protection mechanisms.

Business Model

Reusable Design Algorithm Sales:

Unlike traditional one-time sales, Archimeters enables a "one algorithm, multiple revenue streams" business model. After creators upload a parametric design algorithm (Atelier), they earn revenue every time a user mints a Sculpt using that algorithm. This means an excellent design can generate continuous income rather than a one-time transaction, providing creators with a sustainable revenue source.

User Participation in Creation:

Unlike traditional NFT platforms where users can only purchase random or preset images, Archimeters allows users to actively participate in the creation process by adjusting parameters. Users can preview parameter adjustments in real-time, find the parameter combination that best matches their preferences, and then mint, truly achieving a "co-creation" rather than "passive purchase" experience.

Walmarket - The First Verifiable AI Oracle for Prediction Markets

Track: Provably Authentic (Truth Engine + Trust Oracle)

Tagline: Cryptographically-proven AI execution meets collective intelligence - no trust required

---

Description

Walmarket is the world's first verifiable AI oracle for prediction markets, built on SUI with Nautilus TEE and Walrus storage. By running AI inference inside secure enclaves with cryptographic attestation, Walmarket

eliminates the need to trust oracle operators - proving AI execution integrity through hardware security and immutable evidence storage.

---

The Problem

Traditional AI oracles suffer from a critical trust problem:

- No Execution Proof: Users must blindly trust that operators run the correct AI model

- Unverifiable Inputs: No way to verify what data was actually fed to the AI

- Tampered Outputs: Operators can manipulate results without detection

- Fake Reasoning: Stored explanations may not match actual AI inference

- Centralized Control: Single points of failure and potential manipulation

Result: Users are forced to trust black-box oracles with no cryptographic guarantees.

---

Our Solution

Walmarket eliminates oracle trust through verifiable AI execution:

Nautilus TEE Integration:

- Secure Enclave Execution: GPT-5 inference runs inside Nautilus Trusted Execution Environment

- Remote Attestation: Each oracle report includes cryptographic signature (enclave key + mrenclave)

- Tamper-Proof: Hardware guarantees prevent operators from manipulating inputs, outputs, or execution

- Enclave Registry: On-chain SUI whitelist tracks authorized TEEs with epoch-based key rotation

Verifiable AI Oracle Architecture:

Off-Chain (Nautilus TEE Reporter):

1. Collect and normalize data from multiple trusted sources

2. Execute GPT-5 inference inside secure enclave with fixed prompts/schemas

3. Generate evidence bundle: input data, AI output, reasoning, prompts, model version

4. Upload evidence bundle to Walrus to get blob_id and blob_hash

5. TEE signs report digest with enclave key and generates remote attestation

On-Chain (SUI Aggregator):

1. Validate enclave signature against Enclave Registry whitelist

2. Verify blob_hash matches Walrus anchor

3. Check model_id, prompt_hash, parser_hash, schema_hash against policy

4. Aggregate multiple verified reporter submissions (median)

5. Allow optimistic challenges with evidence bonds

6. Slash reporters for signature/hash mismatches or policy violations

Immutable Evidence Storage (Walrus):

- Complete Audit Trail: Input data, AI output, reasoning, prompts, schemas, model versions

- Blob Hash Anchoring: On-chain reports cryptographically linked to off-chain evidence

- Post-Hoc Verification: Anyone can fetch evidence bundles from Walrus to verify oracle honesty

- Permanent Records: Tamper-proof storage ensures accountability forever

Economic Security:

- Stake & Slash: Oracle reporters stake collateral, automatically slashed for violations

- Optimistic Challenges: Community can dispute outcomes with evidence bonds

- Replay Protection: Timestamps and nonces prevent report replay attacks

---

Key Features

- Cryptographically Proven AI: TEE attestation proves GPT-5 executed correctly - no trust required

- Single Model Policy: GPT-5 with fixed prompts/schemas ensures reproducibility

- Full Transparency: Complete evidence bundles on Walrus (input, output, reasoning)

- On-Chain Verification: SUI smart contracts validate TEE signatures, enclave registry, blob hashes

- Tamper-Proof Execution: Nautilus hardware security prevents operator manipulation

- Economic Alignment: Stake, slash, and challenge mechanisms ensure honest reporting

- Auditable Forever: Anyone can verify oracle decisions from permanent Walrus records

---

Tech Stack

Blockchain & Smart Contracts:

- SUI Network - High-performance Layer 1 with Move smart contracts

- Enclave Registry - On-chain whitelist for authorized Nautilus TEEs

Trusted Execution:

- Nautilus TEE - Secure enclaves for verifiable AI inference with remote attestation

- Cryptographic Signatures - Enclave keys prove execution integrity (mrenclave verification)

AI & Data:

- GPT-5 - Single model policy with fixed prompts and JSON schemas for consistency

- Multi-Source Verification - Cross-reference trusted APIs (Reuters, CoinGecko, etc.)

Storage:

- Walrus - Decentralized storage for evidence bundles (input, output, reasoning, prompts)

- Blob Hash Anchoring - On-chain verification links SUI reports to Walrus evidence

Frontend:

- Next.js 16, React 19, TypeScript - Modern web framework with server/client components

- Tailwind CSS 4 - Utility-first styling with retro pixel art design

- @mysten/dapp-kit - SUI wallet integration (Phantom, Sui Wallet, Ethos)

---

Impact

Walmarket eliminates the oracle trust problem by making AI execution cryptographically verifiable:

Before Walmarket:

- Trust oracle operators to run AI honestly

- No way to verify model, inputs, or outputs

- Black-box decision making with no accountability

- Centralized points of failure and manipulation

With Walmarket:

- Hardware-proven execution via Nautilus TEE attestation

- Cryptographic signatures prove AI inference integrity

- Immutable evidence permanently stored on Walrus

- On-chain verification via SUI smart contracts

- No trust required - mathematics and cryptography guarantee honesty

Result: The world's first prediction market oracle where AI execution is cryptographically proven, not blindly trusted.

---

Why This Matters for Walrus Haulout Hackathon

Walmarket showcases Provably Authentic infrastructure through:

1. Walrus as Truth Anchor: Evidence bundles stored immutably with cryptographic blob hash verification

2. TEE + Walrus Integration: Nautilus proves execution, Walrus stores evidence, SUI verifies both

3. Post-Hoc Auditing: Anyone can verify oracle honesty from permanent Walrus records

4. Unstoppable Truth: Combining TEE security + Walrus storage + SUI verification creates infrastructure that cannot be censored, manipulated, or destroyed

Walmarket proves that verifiable AI oracles are possible - and Walrus is essential for storing the cryptographic evidence that makes trustless verification a reality.

Pelagius is a decentralized data aggregator built on Sui and Walrus. It uses a distributed network of independent operator nodes to provide verifiable ingest, storage, and retrieval through Walrus Proof-of-Availability, on-chain manifests, and lightweight staking. Phase 0 delivers a fast, trustless data pipeline where clients can prove integrity end-to-end—forming the foundation for future compute, sealed data access, and SLA-based infrastructure markets.

MindShard is a decentralized platform for storing, verifying, and trading AI fine-tuning adapters.
Built on Walrus, Sui, Seal, and Nautilus, it enables creators to upload adapters, register on-chain provenance, enforce encrypted access, and verify authenticity: delivering verifiable, private, and programmable AI collaboration.

EcoLedger is a blockchain-powered sustainability verification network that turns eco-friendly actions into digital value. It allows individuals, companies, and communities to record activities like recycling, renewable energy generation, and waste-to-electricity conversion as verifiable blockchain entries. These verified actions earn “ECO Tokens,” which represent measurable environmental impact.

EcoLedger integrates AI x Data to analyze sustainability performance, predict carbon offset potential, and visualize eco-impact across regions. The system empowers transparency, accountability, and green innovation—helping governments, corporations, and citizens align toward a carbon-neutral future.

Built for the Data Marketplaces and AI x Data tracks, EcoLedger transforms human responsibility into digital credibility, uniting progress and planet under one decentralized system.

Vision & Future Impact

EcoLedger envisions a world where every sustainable action becomes a traceable digital achievement. By merging AI, blockchain, and green innovation, it empowers individuals and organizations to turn environmental responsibility into measurable global impact. Our goal is to create a transparent, reward-driven ecosystem that accelerates humanity’s transition toward a carbon-neutral future — where technology and nature evolve in perfect harmony.

VeriLens, currently under construction, is a decentralised digital media and content verification and provenance layer that proves the authenticity and origin of digital content directly on-chain. Built on SUI, it leverages Walrus for decentralised media storage, Nautilus for trusted authenticity attestations in Trusted Execution Environments TEE, and Seal for controlled access to the original media and content birthed.

Fundsui is a decentralized creator-subscription platform. fully built using Sui, Walrus, and Seal, as well as web technologies such as Next.js. A web 3.0 Patreon!

Fundsui allows creators to create their own channels, and set their subscription price. They can then upload podcast on Walrus and encrypted with Seal. Users can then subscribe to those channels for a set period of time, which then gives them access to decrypt and listen to podcast.

--3% Fee, Forever!--

Creators launching their subscriptions on other web 2.0 centralized platforms are at the mercy of those platforms to not increase their fees. In fact just this year Patreon increased their fees for new users from 8% to 10%, and had another change in how their fees worked in 2017. While platforms such as Substack started taking a 30% cut from creators who had subscriptions made through Apple's IAP.

We have created a trust-through-immutability system where we take a 3% fee that cannot changed! It's built directly into the smart contract, and immutable by the contract providers. Creators who publish on the Fundsui smart contract can rest well knowing that their earnings will never be subjected to surprise fee hikes or shifting platform policies.

--Censorship-Resistant--

Not only can others host their own frontends for it, we encourage it! We provide revenue sharing for other frontend host to incentivize them to host their own frontend. Every new subscription or renewal will provide one percent to the current frontend host. This provides censorship resistance as there is not a single frontend that has control over what is allowed on their page, and gives users trust that even if they are banned from one frontend they can go to another.

Other platforms have faced payment processor censorship this year. Itch.io faced disruptions to because of payment processor complaints, and PayPal stopped processing Steam transactions in some countries due to content disputes. By building on cryptocurrency, Fundsui creators are free from this risk, no payment processor can censor their content or dictate what they create and sell.

--Where do we go from here?--

We would love to tackle the Web3 Patreon RFP, however since I work full time as a platform engineer and Michael is a full time student, we would need additional support and funding to do so. We have ideas on how to continue this project beyond just podcast and into something much more accessible. I believe that this can be the killer app for both Seal and Walrus.

Aurora TrustScanner is an advanced, AI-enhanced smart contract security engine built for the Sui ecosystem. It combines on-chain data, decentralized storage, and verifiable computation to deliver trustworthy, transparent contract analysis for everyday users.

Aurora brings together Sui + Walrus + Seal + Nautilus into a single, seamless trust layer for Web3.


Aurora’s mission is simple:

Make Web3 safe, transparent, and understandable — without sacrificing decentralization.

By combining cutting-edge AI with decentralized Sui infrastructure, Aurora gives users a new superpower: knowing who and what to trust.
